Review_Date: Logan B wrote a review Mar 22
Review_Title: Great place close to the square
Review_Text: Here's what I loved about it - It was right outside of the main square so it was an easy access point while shopping and doing other things near there. The staff was really courteous and nice and we really enjoyed them. My wife was looking for something that we couldn't seem to find at any shops and a staff member volunteered to run to a shop to pick it up for us. This was the kind of service we got there.    The breakfast was not the best we had but was decent.    The only negatives were that at night it could get a little noisy because of how close it was to the square. But we wore earplugs and were able to sleep just fine.    Overall a great experience and we would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mike K wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We were so happy to be back in Marrakech for our third stay at Riad Andalla. Slightly apprehensive partly due to Covid and partly due to the change of ownership of the Riad. We need not have worried - things are starting to thrive again in Marrakech and Riad Andalla continues to shine under Valerie's new management.    Our welcome was warm and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Karim deserves special mention for his fantastic English and his attention to detail. His smile is infectious and he really puts you at ease. He tells you "this is your home now" and that's exactly how we were made to feel.    All in all our trip was exactly as we have come to expect from Riad Andalla - pretty much perfect.

Review_Date: Judith V wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Getting the help I needed…  Okay I can only agree with all the others:nice clean perfect location and superfriendly staff. Besides that: What made the difference for me is that I needed medication unexpectedly and while my husband could’nt find it or get it without prescription the owner (so sorry the name didn’t stick as I was pretty miserable) reassured me and called her own doctor who came to see me in the Riad (I was so happy I didn’t have to go out) and I got what I needed. Those are the things that make a huge difference. So grateful and now 2 days later back home healthy and well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gladys J wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: This Riad is extremely nice and clean. The staff are amazing too! Lots of little sitting areas to sip tea in between sightseeing. Everything in the medina is with walking distance including the large square and easy to find your way around. This Riad has a great rooftop restaurant serving the best breakfast and dinners we had on our two week trip around Morocco. Best part is the friendly staff who really try hard to make your stay pleasant and give good advice on what to do and not do. To my husband and i this Riad was the perfect place for what we wanted to do in Marrakech. Gladys from Canada
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gilded Cage Bou... s wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Lovely little riad in the main square steps from the action. Spent one night here and loved that the location was so close to everything. Tiny Little room with everything you’d need. Clean comfy and cozy and great service. Really nothing to complain about at all! Lots of steps to climb if you have mobility issues but common with any riad. Thank you!

This trip made me realise how I love accommodation based on service. The whole Andalla team are incredible they go above and beyond at every moment. Beautiful morning smiles and welcomes. Booking anything we need and recommending the best with no request being too much. In 5days it felt like we were leaving a family!    The Riad is within a 2min walk to the square but it is peaceful. Fantastic restaurants very close by (we ate in every recommendation). The first night we had an evening meal on the Riad rooftop which was delicious and a must. Would recommend to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ricky O wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Riad Andalla has an excellent location - just steps from Jmaa El Fnaa where everything happens - shopping dining entertainment etc. I stayed for 9 nights and felt that I could have stayed for another 9 nights. The room I stayed in (Salma) was wonderful and everything worked - AC Toilets comfortable bed clean safe. Most notable was how I was treated - like a valuable friend. Thanks to Pascal Valerie Jordi Laura and Karim. I felt like an honored guest all the time. It was pure joy to have known them. I will stay at Riad Andalla again and again. Merci Beaucoup famille Blanchard!

Review_Title: perfect service great location good rooms wonderful place
Review_Text: an excellent place to stay in Marrakesh. It is located less then two minutes from the main square of the old city. You can actually see it from the dining area on the top of the Riad. the rooms are clean air-condition - perfect. The building is beautiful from the inside. But the most important is the service Karim the owner answered all our requests always with a smile all the team was very friendly and professional .They prepared special breakfast according to our requests and gave us information that we needed.  IT WAS THE BEST PLACE I STAYED IN MAROCCO

We went in this typical Riad very close to the principal Square in April. The welcome was fabulous thanks to the all staff. I suggest to every guest to try the dinner was amazing.  Sit down on the terrace and enjoy the view on the Square Djema El Fna sipping a cup of tea or rosé wine.  I hope to come back soon.

Review_Date: Nadege J wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: My stay at the Riad Andalla was an out of this world experience. The hospitality is unique. The entire staff was absolutely amazing. The welcome we received from the onset set the stage of the treatment. The service was genuine. I would go back anytime if my finances would let me. A must place to stay! Try their spa! !!! You can thank me later!

I stayed in Riad Andalla for 3 nights with my adult sons. Beware- there is Riad Andalla and Riad Andalla and Spa-- 2 different riads in Medina of Marrakesh which causes confusion for some.  Riad Andalla is lovely property 1 minute walk from Cafe France at Djeema El Fna square. It is little difficult to find but we asked proprietor of small store at the corner and he brought us there.  Location can't be beat. You are right there were all the action is but you close the door to riad-- and total peace and tranquility.  Riad has beautiful rooftop where they serve breakfast and dinner and it overlooks the square which is incredible.  Owners of the riad and all the people working there were lovely friendly and very helpful. Breakfast served is typical Moroccan- so very heavy on breads.  For our last dinner we ordered lamb tanjia-- typical dish for Marrakesh that is cooked in ashes for 6-7 hours. It was fantastic.  I would go back anytime and can only recommend this lovely place.

First we had a nice stay at this place and the people working there did their outmost to make us feel welcome.    On the down side.  First of all Riad Andalla is actually not a real riad as they don’t have an open air garden in the middle. Maybe that’s not such a big thing but we stayed in other riads with gardens and its for sure a different experience with flowers birds smells tranquility etc.    Other issues is that Andalla is that its situated a little far from the major activities if price is conceded. There where other / similar alternatives closer in the same price range.    Last issue we had was that the Wi-Fi was unstable. Not that its a big issue or unique for this place bit no less.    It seems that we didńt like the place but that not the case. The thing is that you can get more for less.    //Peter

Review_Date: Gaurangi W wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We stayed here and it’s such a lovely hotel/riad. The staff are brilliant and so so helpful. The rooms are beautiful and clean.  The food is delicious. We went for a spa and hamman experience as well which was amazing. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Rafael Fernandes wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: This place has by far surpassed my expectations.    The entire staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. Special mention goes to Karim William Moniem and Mustafa who made the time here much more pleasant.    The bedroom was very good with excellent heating was very quiet and had a very cozy bed.    The breakfast was amazing with lots of different (and delicious) bread as well as some sort of pancake with very good jam. They also had fresh orange juice which was awesome.    I would definitely recommend this as your number 1 place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anabela Pires wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I traveled alone with two children and my stay at Riad Andalla was the best option I could have made! The staff is very friendly and helpful! They made us feel at home! The riad is very close to the square and has amazing views from the terrace. The breakfast is very good the cleanliness impeccable and the maximum safety!  We felt welcomed by friends and this was one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech! Thank you all! Hope to be back soon!

Uon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the owners and served mint tea as is the custom in Morocco. I haven't seen any other riads but this one was spacious comfortable and colorful. Our rooms were great. What we enjoyed most were the rooftop terrace from where you can see the range of mountains and also the large square Jemaa el-Fna. In fact we got a magnet which has the exact view of the square on it! The other thing we loved most was the location. It is a three minute stroll from the square yet when you are at the riad you do hear a sound. It is very peaceful. Everyone at Riad Andalla was very kind and helpful. We would definitely recommend it.

Oh this riad is just amazing! Beautiful architecture. Just loved it so much couldnt get enough of it. The room was nice and big too. And the bathroom is wonderful with the tiled shower. The rooftop terrace was lovely. The breakfast was a bit boring almost the same every morning but that is not an issue. The guys who working there are very kind and helpful. They have good sense of humour too. Loved them all. The place is just a short walk to the main square. It is so close to it but still very quiet inside. Just barely heard the muezzin early in the morning :) One night there was a huge cat fight in the courtyard but you get that in Marrakesh :) I really recommend this place to everyone who travels there. Not the cheapest but it is truly beautiful.

Review_Title: Central, cozy, amazing rooftop & so friendly
Review_Text: We just stayed at the Riad Andalla for 3 nights.  The staff there is amazing they even taught us how to pour the traditional marrocain tea!  The rooftop terrace is one of the best ones we've been to. The view over the Jama el Fna is incredible and even though it's so central your almost always alone there.  The rooms are cozy comfy and typical.    We really loved our stay there!    Ah and don't forget to eat dinner there the Tajine was so delicious!

Right in the centre you can’t be better situated if you want to be near the Djeema el fna. It was great to go on the roof terrace and watch what was going on In the main square. The staff are all super friendly. Our room was a great size with a lovely bathroom. Breakfast was delicious and different every morning and served on the roof terrace. You are within walking distance of so much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David Downes wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for 1 night whish we had booked more nights. The hotel is very traditional and very clean the staff were first class we had booked an evening meal on the terrace. They made this a very special evening and the food was first class. The rooms were very clean comfortable. I would not hesitate to rebook a stay here. Thank you for looking after us and making our stay perfect.

Location is super! Kindness and availability of the staff is above average! Wonderful terrace and breakfast!  But..... rooms are far too small for 2 persons (less than 10 m2) and ours hardly had natural light! No room at all to keep your clothes or luggage even if you're staying only 4 days. Tiny bathroom (1 person at the time) and shower with very low water.  It was my 4th time in Marrakech always staying in riads and this was the one I liked less only due to room confort. Pricey for what you get!

Review_Title: Super convenient and clean Riad in the Medina
Review_Text: I really enjoyed the location and staff at Riad Andalla. The location was perfect for accessing the old city (Medina). We had the rooftop meal which was also great.  The bed was a little too hard/firm for my liking but I was able to get a good night's rest.Thank goodness their rooms were air-conditioned which made a huge difference in summer.  Overall I think this is a great choice for those wanting to explore the old city and be close to all the action and night bazaars.

We stayed at the Riad for a few nights whilst visiting Marrakesh. The location is right in the heart of the medina which was perfect for a quick trip. The Riad and the rooms are just beautiful. The terrace is lovely with views over the square. Which is where breakfast was served which was very nice. The staff are really helpful and accommodating and even ordered in a pizza when my son was ill thank you Moundrim! Overall I would highly recommend a stay

Review_Date: Ricard Arderiu wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I love this Riad! Beautiful place really quiet just to be relaxed near the gran place!  Perfect ubication you can see Jemma-el-Fna from tha Andalla's beaufiful terrace.  Comfortable rooms and the most important thing: a perfect and lovely staff.  You'll meet people like Karim or Mustapha. Very good people the best!!  Hoping to come back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel P wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this Riad. While it was a bit tricky to find it is actually perfectly situated with a nice view of Jemaa el-Fna square from the rooftop. Breakfast was included and served on the rooftop each morning and for an additional €20 you can have a 3 course home cooked meal for dinner. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the hosts were top notch! Be sure to ask them to book ground transportation for you if you are arriving by air. I booked my own transfer which is what made finding it so challenging.

My husband and I stayed here for a couple nights and we will be coming back twice in the coming weeks. This Riad is a perfect stay due to the fantastic location and extremely friendly and helpful staff. Seriously the loveliest people! When we stayed here I was 28 weeks pregnant and everything was comfortable and nice. The rooms are exceptionally clean. Very comfortable beds and the shower is so nice. The breakfast is delicious and served on a roof top patio that looks over the main square. We booked an evening meal (highly recommended) and it was so delicious. A great introduction to Moroccan cuisine. Highly recommended place to stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed in Riad Andalla for a week extremely close to the big and busy loud markets. But well hidden in a labyrinth of alleyways lays an Oasis. For my first time in Marrakech this was a perfect retreat and well worth the stay.    The staff is very nice and gives you full attention and help when you need. The breakfast was really nice and big served with a complimentary view of jemaa el-Fna at the roof terrace.    The rooms are beautiful decorated with Moroccan details and colors.    Close to the riad you will find a lot of restaurants shops and markets to keep you busy for some days.    A calm oasis in a bustling city with a nice touch of Moroccan hospitality.

Familiar Riad with excellent staff always available to help beautiful place very clean pleasant breakfast.  Karim Moustafa and Mouraim are very kind and professional. We also met the owners that are excellent hosts

Review_Title: Came here with my family. Loved the service, bedroom accommodations, and the food was amazing!
Review_Text: Monaim and Karim were very hosipitable hosts they are very funny and kind. The cook creates amazing food for breakfast and lunch. They really make you feel like home and they know where to find anything you need around Marrakech. The bedrooms are well maintained and you can control the temperature. We will definitely stay here again. Thanks a lot!

Pros: Extraordinarily helpful and accommodating staff - could not have been more welcoming pleasant and diligently tried to resolve any issues. Great location near the market. Reasonable price. Very good food. Cons: Limited options for single rooms. The two singles I saw were directly off of the central lobby\courtyard seating areas with nothing but a door between your private bedroom and every person that opts for socializing on the comfy sofas and in my case  use it as a meeting point at 6:25AM as they embarked on their tour. Probably worth considering paying for a double room even if you're on your own. Also FYI the photos on the website are nicer than the actual place. And in general: I haven't stayed in a Riad before. It reminded me of something sort-of like a B&B. Again I had a single room. The room quality was rustic-don't expect anything like a western hotel. If I.based my rating solely on the room It would have been 1-star.

Review_Date: Bruno S wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Andalla was absolutely wonderful!  We stayed 4 nights and from the moment of our arrival to the moment we left we truly felt at home! The approach of the owners and the Riad staff to the hospitality is completely different for much better than usual. From the moment we arrived we truly felt like family.  The Riad is very beautiful and its rooms are clean cared for and very quiet. Comfortable beds powerful air conditioning (which with the heat we had during our stay well over 40 degrees is a real gift) Moroccan decor even in the bathroom where the painted washbasin is a work of art.  It is a true oasis in the chaotic Medina. The view over the Jemaa El Fna Square is truly incredible and allows you to get to know the rhythm of the square by day and night without having to go to the confusion of the terraces of any café.  Breakfast and dinner are served with this spectacular view and the Koutubia Mosque and Atlas Mountains.  Breakfast is excellent. Varied with very good pastries and a freshly squeezed orange juice which is a delight. Dinner is well worth booking. The cook is a home cooking that is not found in any local restaurant! Strong and intense flavors of true Moroccan homemade cuisine. Absolutely delicious!  The staff at Riad Andalla offers the best conditions for local tours and tips for everything we need and want.  We just have to thank all the awesome host we had and we will definitely return to Marrakech and always to Riad Andalla! You are in our heart and in the great memories we have of the city! Definitively the best in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris V wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: The amenities and cleanliness are up to par with what the majority of the reviews have been saying. I came a little earlier and my room was already ready. Moreover its a PERFECT location -- extremely close to the action but far enough to have a peaceful calm rest from it all.    Everyone was extremely helpful --- not to mention of the employees who went ABOVE and BEYOND his job description by driving me and my luggage by motorbike to the airport after I had a mix-up with my flight times (due to Ramadan -- BE AWARE!) --- once he learned that I may be late for my flight without hesitation he set down my breakfast items ran down the Riad started his motorbike and off we went. I made it on time and he was as safe driving as he could. Outstanding Indiana Jones-esque. Bravo Riad Andalla bravo!!

I spent a week here at the end of a month exploring Morocco. Loved it. Karim Aziz Moustapha & Mounaim were wonderful really helpful and very entertaining. It is a beautiful Riad with a lovely rooftop space it is a couple of houses back from the square and has a fantastic view of it. We ate at home a couple of nights and the food was delicious. The rooms are a little on the small size but you will be out exploring Marrakech anyway. Would definitely stay here again. I was sad to leave.

Review_Title: Great place near Gamma El Fna
Review_Text: Great staff Great hospitality Great location  Pascal & Karim Thank you very much for everything  The place is very clean.  The staff is very kind.  All the area is beautiful.  We had a good time in Riad andalla

Review_Date: Barbara F wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: No frills riad in a strategic location
Review_Text: A very quite riad with a fantastic terrace overlooking the main square where you can have dinner and breakfast. The dinner especially was very generous and good. Our triple room was simple no useless frills of overwhelming deocrations but it was very nice clean and pleasantly cool on a very hot day. The bed was for the first time during our trip to Morocco not too hard! The ladies who work there are extremely polite and friendly and the manager (who however is there only for a few hours a day) organised for us a taxi to go to the airport.

Review_Title: Nice riad right next to the big square in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Great Riad very very close to the big Jema el Fnaa square in the city center of Marrakech. Nice views over the square from the rooftop during breakfast. Very elaborate breakfast and friendly staff! Good price for location
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good place, great location, nice rooftop terrace with amazing view
Review_Text: I can recommend this place. I had a good stay. Got a room in the secondary building but found it to be good although it was missing many of the features that I got in my booking confirmation when I booked through a booking site (such as a work desk). Room was cozy and clean breakfast was good and the staff friendly. The view from the terrace is really good and the location of the riad is good. The nearby streets feel secure and has many good eats and you are minutes from the big square. It might be a bit hard to find the riad the first time if on your own but it's quite easy and few steps from Cafe France (actually just behind it but you need to turn a few times to find the house). Taxi from the airport was charged 15 Euro through the riad which is fair considering the waiting time and the comfort of having someone show you all the way (you still need to walk a bit though as the alleys are too narrow for cars). Not the cheapest of riads around but worth the price.

This Riad was charming and very comfortable. We booked dinner there for our arrival and enjoyed every bite. The rooms are comfortable the staff is very helpful and entertaining the owners stopped by often and checked in with guests and you are very close to the square and souks for interesting sights and street food. A great place to enjoy Marrakech and base for touring. Definitely recommend this oasis!

Review_Date: Kimberly P wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Six of us just got back from an amazing tour of Morocco. Our first two nights were spent at Riad Andalla. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We had our first taste of delicious Moroccan mint tea here. Our rooms were beautiful clean and very comfortable. The roof top terrace was very nice and a peaceful place to enjoy Marrakesh and watch the market area. The view of the city and the Mosque was perfect. We had breakfast both mornings on the terrace. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. One night we made arrangements to have dinner on the terrace. The food and service were wonderful. The Riad is perfectly situated to enjoy Marrakesh and it is not difficult to find your way back after an outing to the market. When we were dropped off by our driver after leaving the airport we had to walk through the market area to get to the Riad. There was someone there to meet us and cart our luggage to the Riad. We really enjoyed our visit and if we make it back to Marrakesh we will stay here again.

Review_Title: Great location, friendly staff, very good value for money
Review_Text: I stayed here with my cousins and sister for a weekend trip. The location is fantastic and just off the main square. The staff were extremely friendly and the manager so was helpful arranging transfers for us plus a trip to the Atlas Mountains with a private taxi. The room was a good size for myself and my sister. The riad has a beautiful terrace where breakfast was served. We also had dinner here on the first night which was delicious. I would definitely recommend the riad.

Review_Title: Absolutely amazing Riad in the center
Review_Text: I've stayed at the Riad Andalla with my mom and sister for about 10 days. A super friendly man picked up us at the airport and brought us to the Djemaa el Fna where we're picked up and lead to the Riad . The ride was about 20 minutes and great to crash a first look at the city.  The Road itself is absolutely gorgeous. It is a very beautiful place where you feel home from the first moment. Everywhere are little accessories pictures and flowers and you can find nice Moroccan furniture the relax.  On the one side the rooftop gives you a perfect view above the whole market place. On the other side you can see the impressive Atlas Mountains! We loved to recover from the hectic city during daytime and have seen beautiful sunsets in the evenings.  You can reach everything "touristy" within a short walk!  The whole staff was just amazing. They always had a good energy and helped us out in so many ways!  We booked a trip to Essaouira and to the Atlas Mountains. That was possible the evening/night before - thank you Andalla for being than uncomplicated! :)  The rooms have been petty quiet even that close to the marked you couldn't hear anything inside the sleeping rooms. The first night we had dinner at Andalla and ate Tajine. They've been the best ones we are at Marrakech! Yummy!    We will definitely come back to see the people again. It was just a perfect time and I recommend this place from my heart! Thanks to the team for letting us have those amazing days at your place!

Riad Andalla is located right off of the Djeema el fna square. It has an amazing balcony overlooking the chaos that is the market at night. The riad itself was perfectly fine. The room and bed were comfy and bathroom spacious. Breakfast in the morning was generous. Dinner at the riad was authentic and very good. Overall you are staying here for the wonderful location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shawn L wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: A very quiet room minutes from the square.The room was clean and riad provided a nice continental breakfast . The staff was always smiling and laughing. They were willing to help with any tour and transfer arrangements.

Review_Title: What a wonderful place to stay!
Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakech with my Mum and it was our first time to Morrocco. Abdul and all the team were so friendly and helpful. The room was clean and tidy and the decor throughout was in the traditional style. We enjoyed the breakfast and evening meals at the riad and sitying on the terrace watching the sunset.

Review_Date: Chris D wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: It's a little hard to find and the taxis can't get near it due to restricted traffic in Jemaa el Fnaa. The room was a little small but comfortable. And fair for the price.    It is the staff here which makes the Riad a special place. Abdul with his ready smile abundant energy is the embodiment of hospitality. Mureen Ahmed and Aziz who seem always to be there when you need them. The ready smiles of all the rest of the staff keep the feeling of warmth and hominess that you would hope to find in this type of accommodation. But here they take it to the next level. I have had the good fortune to stay in some amazing 5 star hotels around the world all of whom have had excellent hospitality. Not one of them can hold a candle to Riad Andalla.    It's not fancy. But it feels like home. Or like visiting close friends. The dinners are also fantastic. Truly the best food we had in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Great Rooftop View and Friendly Staff
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Andalla was a delight. It started when the Riad sent someone to meet us at the airport. What a convenience! The breakfasts were wonderful and we had two dinners at the riad. Those evening meals felt like we were more like guests in a private home and someone's mom had made us a home-cooked wonderfulness. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The location was perfect. And everyone from the Riad treated us like royalty They even did a small load of laundry for us. And best of all... The view from the roof lounge was incredible.

A little hard to find behind a locked caged door (ring the bell) at the end of an alley close to the Medina Spa. Lovely little oasis with roof top terrace view of the square with quaint small rooms all beautifully and uniquely designed. Charming and welcoming staff. Generous fresh breakfast and the afternoon sweet treats was a nice touch.  Thanks for the vote if you found this review helpful.

Review_Date: Rui Nobre wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Hands down the best Riad I've been to in MARRAKECH
Review_Text: Location : Amazing  Amenities: Excellent  Staff : They treat you like family (Royal Family) the level of service is beyond outstanding they go out of their way to meet all of your requests nothing is impossible here.    If you desire a true Moroccan experience with excellent service at good value please check this Riad I recommend it strongly.

Review_Date: Sharat S wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 days with a trip to the Sahara in between. Our stay here was great! When we arrived we were greeted with tea and the staff sat down with us for a half hour and explained best practices and where we should go. They were very helpful and accessible during our whole trip and gave us plenty of tips for our stay. The room was clean and decorated nicely and the location is conveniently near many of the main attractions. The breakfast is amazing (especially the corn bread) and more than enough to start the day. They also allowed us to leave our things there between stays which helped us immensely as we traveled into the desert. Overall a wonderful experience and we would STRONGLY recommend to our friends and anyone else looking for a place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for three days following our arrival Marrakesh and it has been a wonderful experience. We were given the upper room in the left riad which was clean and very well placed as the only room on this floor. The bed is very firm which is what we prefer. If they have availability ask for this room. It appears to have its own terrace area as well which is very nice.    The friendly attitude of all staff members - from cleaning to management - is remarkable. We even spend a day cooking with the staff and got a couple of tips for better couscous and chili sauce.    We payed around 700 MAD via booking.com which we find very appropriate for this level of Riad.    Riad Andalla - We Will Always Love You.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cecilia G wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is a little gem in the very heart of Marrakesh. Just few steps from Place Jamaa el fnaa but in a very peaceful and safe small street so you can sleep very well!!! View from terrace on the roof is amazing because is right on the Place  it seems to touch it with your finger  The Riad and all the rooms are very well decorated  moroccon style very good size and impeccably clean. Beds are very comfortable .Breakfast is very very goodlots of choice high quality and abundant .You can have dinner at the Riad if you want( I higly recommend) as food is really tastefully. But what makes the difference with other Riads and makes it a little gem is the atmosphere you can breath in it you feel really at home!The owners Cristophe and Andrèe are really friendly as well as all the staff. They all are always ready to solve any problem or any curiosity and they will give you good suggestion about the city. Thank you Abdul for spices I will cook great tajine tonight thinking of you!!! Grazie my dear friends I'm looking to come back as soon as possible!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a must stay in Marrakech!  The rooms are really nice and clean. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly as well as entertaining. We had the best meal here on our last night. I would defiantly recommend this riad and would stay here again.

Manager Eunice was extremely helpful in providing directions to restaurants and sites. Ground floor area was quite beautiful. Breakfast very nice. Room on top floor was good size for a riad and next to patio. Wine and beer available. Call to prayers at 6:25 each morning will surely be heard but that is likely an issue at many riads in or near the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mehdi G wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I stayed here 2 nights travelling with my father:    PROS;  -the location is amazing just right not too far and not too close to all the action.  -the staff is friendly and they are willing to always help  -the breakfast is very good and filling  -decent wifi    CONS  -there was a smell of sewer in the room - even after closing the bathroom door and opening the windows  -the shower and the sink plugs up and needs to be fixed  -there is lots of stairs to walk up and they can be a hazard  -the cleanliness is average it would have been better - saw some pubic hair on the floor

One of the best travel experiences I’ve had. Staff are friendly and we learnt so much. Really helped us get the most out of Morocco. The riad can be noisy at night - especially when American guests come in drink at 3am. Meals overpriced but delicious. Overall this is a quality lace to stay. Luxury in the middle of the city.

Review_Date: Simon W wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: A really authentic Riad found down a few winding alley ways but very safe and secure a super welcome from Abdul the manager mint tea to welcome you in and a host of different size rooms mine was cosy but acceptable for a 4 night stay strange staying in a hotel with no room keys but all very safe - doors bolted inside. Evening dinner on the roof terrace overlooking the Square was top quality with very friendly staff - Thoroughly recommend for a short stay in the medina..

On the recommendation of a friend I booked Riad Andalla for three night stay in  Marrakesh. The property is literally a block from the Jamaa El Feena square and from the rooftop terrace you can see everything that’s going on down there without immersing yourself completely in the craziness of it. Can’t say enough about the excellent service that was given by each and every one of the staff members. While the decor and comfort of the Riad was top-notch it was outshone by the wonderful nature of the staff always happy and always willing to help. Abdul was very helpful in organising anything that you want to do. He organised for me to have a massage at their partner property which was undoubtably one of the best I’ve had. I was met nearby the Riyadh and transport to the airport was also organised without a hitch. The property office half board and the dinner is worth truly excellent. Can’t recommend this place well enough for a comfortable stay in Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Holly K wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I would have given the Riad a five star rating except that as a single female traveller the staff crossed a cultural and professional boundary by being too keen on forming relations which made it uncomfortable to want to return to the hotel each night.    Aside from this the hotel is well situated and close to all the action. The rooms and the entire venue is clean and serviced regularly. The air conditioning works well and is a welcome relief.    The view from the terrace is spectacular. You can see all the action of the vendors setting up shop as the sun sets behind the mosque.    I’m guessing this is the same as other riads but when others are speaking in the atrium the noise travels up into the rooms. Also to note is that the doors do not lock except with a bolt and you cannot lock your room when you leave.

You will not find a more fabulous Riad in the Marrakech Médina. In the midst of the all the hustle and bustle is an oasis of comfort quiet and luxury. This home-away-from home is run by owners and staff with care and professionalism. Be sure to inquire about having dinner on the rooftop. We had our most delicious dinners there-better than the famous places we tried.  Our rides were all arranged for us our events confirmed and our reservations made for us by the delightful staff. Without fault. Simply the best stay we’ve ever had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julie P wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: A really lovely typical riad. Although very near to the Jemma el Fna square it was surprisingly quite. Breakfast and dinner on the roof terrace were great the views fantastic. We had ordered a meal for or first night and it was truly delicious. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. The only very small downside was that there was only a curtain between the room and the bathroom.

Review_Date: Raqib K wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: This riad was a massive part of our experience in Morrocco. Breakfast was great staff was amazing and Abdul was so accommodating. Abdul helped with our excursions and got us everything at a cheap price. We can’t wait to come back!!

Absolutely stunning riad. Very clean and amazing customer service. Abdul made our stay very special and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed and booked excursions etc. Very good location it’s very close to everything and new city is only a 15 min taxi drive. Can’t wait to go again!!

Everyone goes to Marrakech to experience the buzz of activity in the medina - the intriguing mix of souks touters peddlers scooters animals and more all crammed into a disorientating maze. However it is precisely because of this that Riad Andalla really stands out. We stayed during a quiet period and only ever shared the riad with a handful of other guests and found it to be the perfect oasis to retreat to when everything outside became a little too much to handle.    We enjoyed the warm welcome the lovely mint tea the two relaxing inner courtyards (Riad Andalla occupies two buildings divided by a common footpath) and the tastefully decorated rooftop garden - the views over the Jemaa el-Fnaa were fantastic day and night and we never grew tired of having breakfast there every morning. Our room was equally interesting with lots of Moroccan elements built into its design. The air conditioning was powerful enough to keep the room cool (though we've been told that it's been an incredibly mild summer there) and the beds were comfortable. The shower had reasonable water pressure but it was evident that the plumbing can only handle so much - an average length shower can take an hour or two to drain. For those looking for hotel-style bathroom amenities you should reset your expectations. Unlike older reviews all of the rooms we saw could be padlocked for security.    The service was always friendly- Abdul seemed to be everywhere always ready to help book you a tour or point out some places of interest Mounim always polite thoughtful and happy to chat and Salua kind courteous and evidently a great cook as we thoroughly enjoyed the delicious (but comparatively pricey) tagine that was served (remember to book this ahead of time). Location wise the Jemaa el-Fna and the souks are both a 3 minute walk away and most of the major attractions (palaces and gardens) are all within walking distance.    Of course those who are less adventurous can stay in the new city. However we can't help but feel that it misses the point of being in Marrakech. So for those willing to experience staying in the medina we don't think it can get much better than Riad Andalla.    Some final notes: be aware that unless arriving very early in the morning there is no car access allowed around the Jemaa el-Fnaa (and the riad). Your best bet for navigating to the riad is to be dropped off as close to the square as possible near the Koutoubia mosque. There are two main paths near the mosque leading into the square - follow either head diagonally across the square to Cafe de France. On one side of the cafe is a street leading away from the square - follow that and turn into the first small open air alleyway on the right take the first right down that alleyway and walk to the end turn right and walk to the end again turn left and you will hit a metal gate - press the buzzer on the wall and someone from the riad will come and open the door for you. The journey down the alleyways only takes a few minutes but does feel long when you first attempt it. Try not to look too "touristy" as some locals will either (1) try to take you on a scenic journey and ask for a handsome sum at the end (2) tell you that the path is closed/for locals only/give some other conceivable excuse that will make you doubt yourself. Be confident and alert and you should be fine. For navigation the Maps.Me map is more accurate than Google Maps. As the roads are narrow give your GPS some time to triangulate before moving into the alleyways.

Review_Date: Karley-Rae B wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Oasis in the heart of the Medina.
Review_Text: This Riad does not disappoint. Abdul and his team cannot do enough for you whether it's giving directions arranging henna art or airport transfers.    The rooms are clean beds are comfy wifi fast and it's a very peaceful environment. I stayed here for 2 nights. My friend had a scheduled departure after the first night and I felt very safe and well looked after staying here solo.    The rooftop garden has a fantastic view over the main square and is a lovely place to escape the craziness of the main square.    I emailed Christophe in advance and he sent very clear walking directions from the main square. We found it no problem. This place is located only 3 mins walk from the main square.    Breakfast is yum and you can preorder dinner which is absolutely delish! Would definately stay here again.

Review_Date: Jesper Ø wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Nice relaxing place close to everything
Review_Text: I have been ti the Riad Andalla a couple of times by now and I always enjoy comming back. Rooms are nice and clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal and you are in walking distance from most sights in marrakesh.

Review_Date: Marion M wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Little Riad fabulously situated a stones throw from all the action in the square of Jemaa al fna. A series of narrow alleyways brings you to the door. Inside there are several little sitting areas and inner courtyards with decorated doors and walls. Great welcome with mint tea a map and lots of sights suggested to see. Lovely rooftop dining area where we had a first class set dinner three courses for 20 euros. Room was adequate with shower and mosquito net on the windows just be careful when climbing the many irregular and often very deep stairs to the rooms.

Review_Date: Scott T wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Fantastic Riad Right Next to Jemma el-Fnaa!
Review_Text: Riad Andalla was a great place to stay while in Marrakech. The location is fantastic and you can have breakfast and dinner overlooking Jemma el-Fnaa square on the roof! The manager Abdul and and the other staff really go out of there way to make sure you are happy by delivering on any requests you might have. The riad was clean and we really enjoyed staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A friend booked three of us into Riad Andalla. I hadn't checked it out. What a wonderful surprise! I arrived exhausted to be met with a very warm welcome. Abdul can't do enough to help.  The decor is beautiful the sheets are crisp and the rooftop garden/eating area is delightful. We had a "tarzine" (traditional Moroccan meal) cooked inhouse and it was yummy.  Riad Andalla is very centrally located. Abdul gave us advice about what it is appropriate to pay for things like horse carriages barrow boys and snake charmers.  It's worth going to Marrakesh just to stay at Riad Andalla.

Review_Date: Zhe C wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I visited the the city with friends in July and we stayed one night in Riad Andalla. The owner was very friendly and helpful also are his sons. The rooms and tidy and nice. The owner also helped us a lot with getting our luggages from the parking place near the mosique. If I visit again I would stay here again.

Riad Andalla was the first riad I stayed at during my one week in Morocco and it was far and away one of the best! Arriving after a long time traveling they were so welcoming and helpful! The owners spent time answering any questions I had and showing me the best ways to get around. (about a 5 min. walk to Jemaa el-Fna square) . The room was nice and clean and the breakfast each morning was delicious served on the nice terrace with a view of Jemaa el-Fna square.

Review_Date: Ibrahim N wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Arriving to this beautiful and charming guesthouse after a long and a tiring journey the housekeeper Abdel Kader made us feel at home offering great hospitality and decency. We were served mint tea and he explained for us about the great landmarks and places to see. He always made sure that we are fine and was always ready for helping us booking tours. The location is fabulous overlooking at the amazing Jmaa el Fna square. The ambience was also quiet and relaxing. The rooms were always kept clean. We stayed at Riad Andalla for 5 nights. It was our first visit to Morocco and we actually planed to stay in marrakesh for 3 nights. If you ask me what is the epitome of my experience at Riad Andalla i would say the best of the best! Thank you.

Review_Date: Amir W wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: A friend and I booked riad andalla for 3 nights but eventually we fell in love with the city and this place and ended up extending for 2 more nights. Location is as close as you can possibly get to the amazing Jamaa el Fnaa rooms are spacious and clean and are equipped with new air conditioners breakfast is good but by far the biggest plus is the people running this place especially Abdul Qader who was like a big brother to us constantly offering a helping hand - he took care of e-v-e-r-y-t-h-i-n-g from providing us with a map recommending places changing money booking tours (we took 2 tours: ourika and ouarzazate) and he even arranged our transfer from marrakech to chefchaouen and in the process asked for nothing in return! Thank you riad andalla... you made life easy for us in Marrakech!!

Review_Date: Cynthia M wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I stayed in Andalla for three nights and it turns out to be a great choice. This is my first time traveling in Africa. I was somewhat anxious when I just arrived in Marrakesh especially I'm coming alone. However Andalla has given me the sense of safety I need. It's hidden in the quiet street near the square so no need to worry about the noise. I like the Moroccan style of the place. I like the great breakfast on the rooftop every morning. I like how close it is to the square so that I could simply come back to take a break whenever I found the heat outside unbearable. I also like how friendly and helpful the staffs are. The boss even took the time to help me print out my boarding pass which was a big help for me. Next time I'm coming back to Marrakesh I will definitely come back to Andalla. (For the first time to find the place you need to use the map. Don't trust google map here.)

Review_Title: We were satisfied to stay here
Review_Text: We stayed only one night here but we really enjoyed our staying. The location of hotel was amazing just right in the middle of jemaa el fina square. Breakfast was terrific so my parents could eat very well (since they are quite picky that means a lot) overall we had luck to stay here ;) highly recommendable 안녕하세요. 7 명 가족으로 여행하고 있습니다. 광장에서 굉장히 가깝고 광장을 바라보며 조식을 먹을 수 있어서 굉장히 좋은 위치입니다

We can’t thank enough the staff at Riad Andalla Spa— Younes Karim and Mustafá— for their warm hospitality and genuine kindness. I’ve never stayed at a hotel where I felt like a family and I’ve been to more than 50 countries! The riad was immaculately clean and beautiful even if the outside street seemed to imply otherwise. We are already planning to return to Marrakech in a couple of years and we will definitely stay at this riad to visit our new friends.

Review_Title: The epitome of a dream morrocon hotel
Review_Text: This was my first time in Marrakesh and I stayed at Riad andalla. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The AC worked amazing. Breakfast was always delicious and the staff there is some of the friendliest people you'll ever meet. They were willing to arrange excursions and food and entertainment if needed so. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful as well as the rooftop Terrace which I spent a lot of time. It has a direct view of the square in the market. And is just overall an amazing place

Review_Date: Daniel G wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: I stayed 4 nights in Riad Andalla and that was awesome. Abdull the owner and Monaim responsible for breakfest and dinner were super prestative helpful and friendly we wouldnt be able to enjoy Marrakech the way we did if it wasnt for them (if you havr any doubts need some information on where to go what to do need a dinne reservation somewhere a reccomendation or anything at all just ask them and they will hrlp you). Besides that the place is really beutiful and comfortable an actual quiet and fresh refuge in the middle of the busy Medina just a few meters from the El Fna square wich is very helpful since its near to almost everywhere a turist would like to go. And if not you can grab a taxi in the square or ask Abdull to book you a driver. I will never forget this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Evija A wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Traditional Style Riad Near Jemaa el-Fna
Review_Text: I had booked my stay at this riad for 2 nights to extend my tour through the country. My friend was staying at a different hotel however she came with me when I was checking in. It was slightly tricky to find the riad but once we did we both fell in love with it even after having been traveling through Morocco for a week. Everything looked and felt authentic and very beautiful to the smallest details. We were greeted with some tea and biscuits and some warm smiles. Once I saw my room I was even more impressed by the designs. However I had my suspicions that the roof terrace is going to surprise me even more. And it did! What a view all around it! And a great place to watch the empy square in morning seeing it getting busier in the afternoon and finally full of crowds at night. I even managed to see part of Berber culture festival which was amazing! Be aware though that you might hear a bit of the hustle and bustle from the square in your room too.  The hotel staff were truly friendly and helpful and always available for whatever you might need. Even if it is just a conversation in evening on the terrace while enjoying the fantastic views.  The breakfast was very good and delicious and rooms were cleaned every day.  I definitely recommend this riad and would love to return there myself!

This air-conditioned riad sits minutes from the main square. The decor is lovely the price is excellent the rooms and beds are comfortable and adorable. The owner that was managing when I was there (Abdul) is completely charming and helpful. Email correspondence before was prompt and complete. The only things I would change would be: more consideration from support staff in morning (or workers coming in too early?) being noisy breakfast of mainly different breads could be improved toiletries are minimal and cheap. These are little things that keep me from giving the best score but they are just little things! Come here and you will be very happy.

Review_Date: Noelle H wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Abdul made us feel instantly welcome. The riad is a calm oasis with a gorgeous rooftop terrace where we enjoyed the most beautiful tagine. The room was lovely and we had a fantastic experience. Must stay here if visiting Marrakech.

Service was fantastic-more than I could have imagined.  Location is amazing-right next to market.  price was great  dinner was delicious  basically everything I could have asked for was taken care of by this place.

Review_Date: K h wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Lovely rooftop terrace and friendly and helpful staff.    I had some issues with internet connectivity (sporadic in my room always seemed OK in the foyer).    Finding it the first time was a little harder than it should have been - the turn off the main street has a sign post but it is first right right left after that and they were not labelled. You should be able to find it easily if dropped off at Jemaa el-Fna; a 2 minute walk.

Amazing Riad. Perfect location not even 3 minutes walk into the main square. Walking distance to all main attractions. Staff could not have been more helpful went out of their way to please us every day really made our trip. Breakfast was lovely on the roof top terrace every morning rooms were spotless. Would not have wanted to stay anywhere else cannot fault it! Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent only one night in Riad Andalla but next time we will stay longer!  Riad Andala is litteraly only a few steps away from the big square. Rooms are clean and on the rooftop they serve a perfect breakfast and nice rosé.

Review_Date: David S wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Good quality, good location and friendly staff
Review_Text: Warm and friendly reception useful tips and assistance with visits and local information. We spend a very pleasant 4 day break in Marrakech. The room was clean and comfortable though no locks on the door and a little noisy at times.  Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful.  Overall we would highly recommend this hotel.

A very hospitable og service-oriented staff made our stay in Marrakesh a highly memorable one. The breakfast was way beyond our expectations.Indeed a perfect place to recuperate after a hard but enjoyable 5-day trek in Sahara.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aileen Y wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Location is good room is clean staff is friendly and the owner responds quickly through email. Abdul was particularly helpful in letting me know how much I should negotiate for taxi etc. I asked for airport pick up and it would have been better if a staff come to collect me from the car drop off. A friendly neighbor was able to direct me to the riad but I have seen other false tour guides that demand money from tourists. It happens a lot in Morocco but if the hotel staff can come and collect the guests at the car drop off it would be much easier.

Review_Title: Ideal location but too noisy for us
Review_Text: Cons: Sound travels easily in this lively riad. We’ve preferred other places that managed to be in the midst of medina life yet retain a peaceful ambiance. Breakfasts are average. Rooms do not have locks and the front door is often left ajar. The riad spanned across the dead end of an alley which meant that staff wasn’t always in both sides of the guesthouse. Abdul the affable host said there are cameras everywhere and they’ve never had a theft since opening 10 years ago.    Pros: Location was ideally close (3min walk) to the Place Jemaa El Fna and the handy landmark Cafe de France where the taxis drop you off. Great rooftop terrace view over Place Jemaa El Fna to photograph both the morning calm and evening chaos. Meals are served from 8pm with a prearranged dining request. Wine is available onsite. Hot showers with good pressure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at Riad Andalla and we couldn't have chosen a better location than this. Room was nicely decorated somewhat dim and cold however. AC was a bit noisy but this is an old building after all. Hot water in bathroom was always available - keep the drains closed to keep out the smell of old plumbing. The staff are extremely welcoming friendly and helpful. Top marks go to breakfast on roof-top terrace the view of Jemaa el fna is awesome. A suggestion I would like to make is for management to put up a couple of signs in the leading streets to indicate the way to riad - being first-timers in Marrakech is was not easy for us to locate. Would recommend this accommodation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent location just few steps from the main square but in a quite little street. Also check out the rooftop that has a stunning view to the square.  Very friendly and helpful staff. Delicious breakfast. Clean rooms. Wifi works very well.  The only con was that in the room it was a bit cold.  Definitely worth staying here when in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Erica J wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Absolutely loved staying at the Riad Andalla! Great experience and management was AMAZING! Treated us like Queens:) Beautiful Beautiful place! I would definitely stay here again. The breakfast was amazing as well!

Review_Date: Helen R wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We stayed in this Riad as a family for a three day break and have to say it was the nicest experience.It was spotlessly cleanthe staff were extremely friendly and helpful with any requests we had .We had dinner here and the food was superb along with the amazing breakfasts every day.Its location just off the main square was perfectas it was a quick walk to all the interesting sited but a peaceful retreat after a hectic day! Definitely a good choice !!

Review_Title: Good location for medina & jemma el-fna
Review_Text: The location is good for medina/jemaa el-fna and you can experience traditional riad. Roof top has a nice veiw and could relax there. Breakfast was nice. Staffs were really friendly and they helped to book for the desert tour and kept my luggages during the tour as well.

Review_Date: jake s wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Exxcellent Riad close to Jemaa el-Fnaa
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is perfectly located near Jemaa el-Fnaa with a easy route in the confusing streets of Marrakech. The staff was friendly nice and accomidating answering to our every need without hesitation. The main floor of the riad was beautifully designed and was very relaxing. WiFI was realy fast and our stay here made the ending to our moroccan adventure worth while and relaxing.

Review_Date: Corona Shines wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad and amazingly friendly staff. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful worth including in rate. Atmosphere is authentic and serene. Location is right in old town by souqs down the alley. WiFi in room and fast included. Rooftop terrace gorgeous. Please note that Riads were previously homes so the guest room did not have a way to lock the room from the inside; the room door had a slide bolt from the outside that can be padlocked to secure the room during the day. Staff is present 24/7 and plenty of cctv for security.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Definitely the riad location is superb.  Pros: location very close to the main square; communication via email is really good; staff is very friendly and helpful; nice breakfast and delicious dinner (must be reserved in advance).  Cons: our room was on a floor above the kitchen not in the main building and it was noisy; Wifi internet was not good in our room; little water in the shower (no way to wash my hair) and the smell in the bathroom; there’s no hairdryer (in the winter it is hard to wash your hair and go out).  Be aware about the taxi: what is combined via riad is a transfer from the airport to the riad. The taxi driver tried to let us near the riad just two minutes from the hotel. He wanted us walk alone to the front of the hotel no signs (just an initial one) no maps in our first time in Marrakech a tough task! We said no and he took us til the front of the riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lesli W wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: An oasis just blocks from the square!
Review_Text: I've just returned from a whirlwind week in Morocco - one night at Riad Andalla 3 nights on a tour then another 3 nights at the riad. This was my first trip to Morocco and the first half I was travelling alone so I wanted a place I felt comfortable and that was close to the Jemaa el Fna and the souks before my companion met me later in the week.    Riad Andalla was terrific from the hospitality (warm welcomes and always smiling faces from Abdul and the staff) to the food (the best tagine we had the entire week!!!) to the tea to the decor (the stonework is lovely as well - the baths are all tadelakt) and the comfortable beds!! ...I'd definitely stay there again. And the location: you can't really get any closer to Jemaa el Fna without being in the middle of the square!    Christophe was super-responsive when I emailed him to make the reservations answering my barrage of questions without delay. He arranged the airport pickup (HIGHLY recommended as the riad is hard to find your first day) and my desert tour (the tour company needs to work on its communication and meal options but that's not Andalla's fault) so all I really needed to do was drop my bags and have fun...Christophe is a dear (as is Abdul) and you can tell they really love their jobs!    Riad Andalla is actually two buildings: the main riad and a smaller guest house/riad across the street. Both have roof decks but from Andalla proper the view of the square (and the Atlas mountains) is exceptional! Do make time to take in the views and the atmosphere up there as it is like an oasis - inside the riad it is so quiet you'd never know so much chaos was going on just a block away. Yes you can hear the street if the windows are open but that didn't bother us a bit.    I stayed in two different rooms: my first night was a double on the 1st floor (one flight up) and it was clean and quiet and had a small but nice bathroom. When I returned from the desert and met my friend we were in a room in the house across the street - a double on the 2nd floor (two flights up - quirky stone steps) with a really big bed (this was a must as C is ~190cm and Abdul made sure we were comfortable) and a lovely bath. It was cool at night and my only negative about the rooms was that the heating didn't quite reach where the bed was so I felt bad that I had to turn it up to 24.    This was a perfect place for us to stay and everyone on the staff went out of their way to meet our needs (big bed eggs and yogurt at breakfast a late dinner one night making change getting rid of a jerk who lead me to the riad and tried to extort money from me when I got lost...)    This isn't a luxury hotel so you won't find cute bath soap or fancy shampoo nor do they advertise to be anything but what they are: it's clean and safe and the staff works very hard to ensure you have a nice stay. The other guests seemed to have the same opinion.    There was a slight miscommunication on the day we were leaving - the marathon had snarled traffic and we should have left earlier for the airport - this caused some temporary stress (and necessitated walking part of the way) but no flights were missed.    A note about the tours: there seems to be only one company that operates group tours from Marrakech. If you're looking for a more personal experience or a less frenetic pace then I'd recommend working with Christophe to create a private or semi-private tour. The group tours are something of a racket shuttling tourists as quickly as possible from points A to B to C. It wasn't terrible but if I did it again I'd try a different option or drive myself.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: trev w wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Perfect location, wonderful friendly staff, comfortable room and evening meal home cooked to order and very special.
Review_Text: My sister and I ( in our seventies) stayed here for a week . This was our first trip to Marrakesh and we chose this Riad because of its position - very close to the main square but off of the main streets.. We also wanted a roof terrace as we enjoy sitting with a glass of wine watching the sun go down. It was a very good choice.  What we didn't expect was the warmth of our welcome . Thank you Abdul Ahmed and the four wonderful ladies who laughed with us and tried really hard to make our stay comfortable and memorable. Moroccan hospitality at its best. We had two evening meals cooked to order by the ladies and they were the tastiest we ate all week.  Abdul efficiently arranged our transport to and from the airport  my hamman my balloon trip and our day trip to the mountains. Not only that he gave me a lift on his scooter to the hamman while his young son guided the other ladies through the alleys to get there.

Review_Date: Sharon C wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We have just returned home from a trip my husband arranged for my 60 birthday. We went with two of our friends on a weekend break.    None of us had been to Marrakesh before so we weren’t sure what to expect. A friend had recommended the Riad Andalla so we knew our accommodation would be ok.    When we got out of the taxi we were all a bit worried the narrow alleyways that we had to walk through to get to our Riad were a little worrying but when we arrived at the Andalla the welcome we received was lovely. The Andalla is a peaceful haven from the busy Souks filled with colour and sound!! Abdul was both welcoming and helpful nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was a colourful array of fruit bread pancakes just what’s needed before a trip to the souk (market) to haggle for any amount of trinkets leather goods scarves etc!!! a big thank you to Abdul and his team for making it So special ❤️

This place is great! Everything about it was perfect. The room and location.    Most of the tour groups that pick up in the Medina are at a restaurant practically around the corner.    The Riad offered paid meals if we were interested. The first night was so good that we at there every night. Real Moroccan food with a different menu every night. The best!!!    Abdul ran the place and helped us tremendously. He said they offered several trips for 50 Euros which is very inexpensive compared to tour companies but we’d couldn’t cancel our paid trip.    The owner Christophe was great too and suggested if we ever come back to book a room and optional tours directly through him for a lower price.    Regardless this was a highly memorable trip because of our stay at Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great value, ideal location, fantastic warm hospitality
Review_Text: We spent five nights there over New Years with our grown sons. Riad Andalla is located right in the Medina (walled medieval city) a few minutes walk to the main square - Jemaa El-Fnaa. The riad consists of 2 small converted homes with central courtyards and rooftop terraces and decorated in typical beautiful Moroccan design with tiles fountains lanterns etc.    All the staff were amazing and went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. A special thank you to Christophe André Abdelkader the young servers the ladies in the kitchen and everyone who made us feel as we were part of their family. Every day they went out of their way to go to the only gluten-free bakery in the city to make breakfast for our gluten-intolerant son. The delicious breakfast included freshly squeezed OJ pastries baguette yogurt 2 kinds of Moroccan pancakes with honey and jams. Dinner was very good too - tagines and other traditional Moroccan fare.    Rooms each have unique decorations and ours was spacious with a comfortable bed. Thank goodness they're heated (AC in summer) because December nights in Marrakech are cold. It was too bad the temperatures weren't high enough early in the morning to have breakfast on the terrace. At night we spent time up there to watch the activities in the main square.    Due to the location off small streets in the medina cars cannot drive to the door of the riad. You need to find a porter next to the main square with a cart to take your luggage. (It's part of the adventure!) When checking out Riad Andalla staff get a cart to take luggage for you.    The only recommendation is to book ground floor rooms if you have trouble with steep uneven stairs (remember it is the old medina).

This riad had a good and safe locationfriendly staff simple tasty breakfast ( quantity alot! ) . Special thanks to friendly Abdul and his team. Always made me feel welcome and furnished me with good information. The riad was right behind the jema el fna ( famous square) . Lots of shops and cafes on the way to the riad. Safe for solo lady travellers. My friends who came to meet me at my riad were impressed too. With the service hospitality and the dinner on 25 december!

Review_Date: Fernando C wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I just can say that our experience at Riad Andalla was really really nice.    This beautiful riad is placed close to place Jemma el fna around 5 minutes walking from the terrace you will be able to enjoy a beautiful view of the square and Marrakech.    All the staff is amazing every morning are ready to begin the day with an impressive breakfast with a smile.    Regarding the trips they arranged to us an amazing trip to Ait Ben Haddou with a really good price this trip is 200% recommended it is incredible!    I recommend this riad to everyone since it is the best way to enjoy this amazing city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of peace in the medina
Review_Text: Fabulous location with a perfect view of the Koutoubia mosque from the terrace. Seconds from Jemaa el Fnaa square and a maze of souks. Lovely riad lovely room kind and thoughtful staff and great food. Abdul was great at finding spices and giving bartering advice for the souks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thierry K wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Unfortunately very short to enjoy it fully
Review_Text: My family and I had a chance to spend a night at Riad Andalla What an amazing time we . What set them apart is the customer service from the minute we booked Christophe was already in contact with us trying to sort out our transportation to the Riad our meals.. etc Upon arrival Karim's beautiful smile and friendliness was there to guide us around and in the evening Younes there for any support. André and Christophe did an amazing job with this place it's very beautiful spacious family friendly and very close to the Square. I really recommend this gem especially if you are looking for attention to details and specialized treatment.

Review_Date: Claudio D wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Amazing place Amazing people Amazing stay.  We spent four days in Marrakech and stay at Riad Andalla was the best decision that we made. I recommend it to anybody: taste the special dinner in the Riad and follow every suggestions that they give you. And it turns out... those have been some of the best choices we have ever made.

Review_Title: Truly a hidden treasure in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is a true gem in Marrakech. The room is perfect location is just in Jemaa El Fna- you do have to go through some narrow corridors but it's perfectly safe. But the biggest thing about this Riad that I am superbly thankful for is the service you get from the staff- from Cristophe Abdel Ahmed the two ladies etc. all of them were really great! They make you feel at home they will do their best to help you- special mention on Ahmed who accompanied me to top upmy sim card late night cause I couldnt figure out how to. The dinner they prepared was really really good too. Lastly. I'm superbly thankful that they kept my big luggage while I was out in a 3-day desert tour. Really recommend this- specially for solo female traveler like me!

Review_Date: Karen R wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We stayed at this riad while in Marrakech for 3 nights and then back for 1 before we left Morocco. It is in a great location right next to the square so very close to everything you need. The place is very clean and we were welcomed with mint tea and lots of advice from our host Christope a very happy French man who was so helpful. He gave us suggestions where to eat as well as advice on prices we should pay etc. He was very friendly. We travelled to elsewhere while in Morocco and Christope was happy for us to leave some of our luggage which was a big help. The rest of the staff especially Abdul were very helpful and always greeted you with a big smile. The rooms are good airconditioned and the bathrooms have amazing tiles. The breakfasts were good mainly bread jam and pastries orange juice and coffee and a couple of times Abdul served us outside hours to fit in with our days and travel plans. The view from the roof is amazing you can see how the square changes at different times of the day. We would recommend staying here if you want somewhere that is a central location and is laid back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Federica F wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad for 3 nights it has been great! The location is one of the most suggestive of the city the rooftop looks directly at the main square and you can reach easily the souks taxi stop and all you want. Abdul and the guys of the Riad have been delicious helpfully friendly polite and available in any moments at any hours... I really suggest them perfect kitchen dishes goods that is difficult to find in Morocco and room clean and nice! Thank a lot I will come back again!

Review_Date: Linh T wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We found Riad Andalla for 2 night stays in Marrakech (Monday Friday only since we are staying Tues-Thurs in the desert) via Booking and TripAdvisor since the soaring reviews are hard not to trust. We arrange airport pickup and was brought back to the Riad easily. Here we were greeted by Abdoul (my apologies if I have your name wrong) and Chris who had nothing but bright smiles and charisma and hospitality at all times. We were given warm welcome and a pot of coffee on roof top before receiving the key to our room which was beautifully decorated had AC and nice bathroom. Riad Andalla is a guest-house with many floors and they have another building across from the original one with even bigger room and bathroom all top notch. We were given tips on navigating around town and a map and we had lovely homemade dinner in the lobby (since it was gonna rain on rooftop so :( ) and it was delicious and fulfilling! Finding our way back to the Riad from the main market isn't too hard but definitely you wanna watch around in the dark small alleys. They have breakfast early in the morning so that's also great! They let us leave after the first night to go on with our desert trip plan and come back for the last night before paying for both nights which to me never happened before! That says a lot about the low key atmosphere that our hosts and this great gem is! Highly recommended!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mamoun I wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: This hotel has a fantastic location near Jema Elfena. In fact you can see it from the roof or the terasse. The place is clean and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The owner made the impression of a friendly guy after a chat with him during the checkout. The only thing I’d find difficult is to spend a long vacation there. In my opinion it’s suitable for short trips. The reason for saying so is the lack of daylight in the room and there is no TV. Also I had the impression before arriving there that the place is more spacious after seeing its Fotos online. The breakfast is really nice but the range is limited to sweet pastries jam honey and cake. Nonetheless it was a great experience and big Thank to the team there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My friend and i stayed at riad andalla for 4 days. We had a wonderful time. The riad was beautifully decorated. Very clean. The staff was super attentive. Abdul and Karim made sure we were taken care of during our stay. They go out of their way to accomodate us. We loved Morroco so much my friend and I decided to extend our trip and luckily we were accomodated. It is in the perfect location near the main square. I definitely recommend this riad to anyone staying in Marrakech.

Our rooms were very nicely decorated and were very clean. We were also very well received by the owner who always had good advices for us. In such central location we had everything around accessible by foot bus or taxi. I highly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: oliver c wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: If you are visiting marrakech at any point then this is the riad you should stay at.  I can't recommend the place highly enough the location is perfect for access to the main square about a 30 second walk from the front door.  The riad itself is easy enough to find and inside is absolutely beautifully decorated and arranged the food that they cook is extremely tasty and the meals are very reasonably priced for the portion sizes but the best thing about the riad is the staff they can't do enough for youand this continues throughout the duration of your stay.  Every one of them is so kind and welcoming and pretty much make you feel as though you are part of a family. Anything that you need help with they will give you with a warm smile.  If I come to marrakech again this would be the only place I would stay as this week was the best customer service experience I have ever had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After time-consuming review of many riads (it was out first time in Morocco so we were a bit thorough in screening reviews) we opted for Andalla and it was an excellent choice. After booking we received great immediate feedback from the Christophe and he arranged the transport to riad which I strongly advice! He was absent from Riad but Abdoul Karim and ladies did marvelous job!!!
