Location is splendid close to El Fna square view is gorgeous breakfast outstanding super clean Riad and truly memorable experience!  We felt well taken care of!  Abdoul organized day trips for us - all were good helped us with many useful suggestions - especially for shopping and bargaining :))  We could't recommend this Riad enough!!  Thank you for everything!    Our rooms were on first floor Fanida i Zouina. Rooms are inside oriented.  Just couple of observations:  Bathroom is separated with curtain.  As in many other riads there are no keys - you have inside and outside lock - meaning that when you are in room you can lock the room but outside lock has no real purpose - still do not be bothered at all we felt completely safe (there is always someone in the riad and it is locked you can't get in without buzzing first) and our belongings as well off course lock on your suitcase will probably ease the mind of those more cautious.

Review_Date: Carolina R wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Best location and the perfect moroccan feel-like home place to stay
Review_Text: The best location to stay in Marrakech near Jemaa el Fna with a rooftop with an amazing view over it where we could enjoy dinner and a wonderful breakfast.  But this was not all about the location after walking through the narrow streets I was amazed once I cross the Riad Andalla door.  I found out the most warming reception of all with an amazing Moroccan decor that will dazzled me. All the details are carefully care the rooms are super comfortable and although it's located 2 min from the main square inside it is super quiet.  Recommend the traditional dinner and breakfast for sure!  Definitely the best place to stay and we could't find better hosts to have thanks guys!  Hope to be back soon!

Review_Date: burt s wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: A terrific place just half-a-"block" from the Jemaa el Fna
Review_Text: Riad Andalla was one of he most enjoybable riads we stayed in in Morocco. Abdul & Kareem out hosts (Christophe is another) were more than kind always in good spirits. The location could not have been closer to the Jemaa el Fna--while remaining apart & super-quiet. And yes the rooftop terrace was special with a killer view of the plaza.  You will at first wonder about the winding alleyway to Andalla but it makes the riad even more alluring & serene after the festy Jemaa din. Enjoy...

The Riad although hard to find at first turned out to be in a fantastic location close to the main square. There is a roof top terrace that is very relaxing and with a view of the Jemma el-fnaa Square. You can book to have your evening meal up there and it was delicious with local and seasonal produce. The staff were all very kind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A gorgeous place to be in Marrakech
Review_Text: The staff is really professional warmfriendly and welcoming.  The room is very confortable. The food is very traditionnal with a extraordinary taste and Andrée and Christophe are helpful. They are two perfect hosts.  I'll comeback!!!!

Good location clean rooms friendly and helpful staff trustful owner with good advices good food good terrace etc.    Highly recommended was there 4 years back and was very satisfied will be back next time.

Review_Date: Angeles R wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We are three Spanish friends who for our stay in Marraketch chose the Riad Andalla for the views and proximity to the Yemaa square. And it has indeed met our expectations and has surpassed them. The human and personalized attention has impressed us above all we want to make special mention to Abdoul his professionalism attention and sympathy has captivated us. The breakfasts were unbeatable.  Congratulations  Chicas lindas

I stayed 3 nights at the Riad Andalla at the end of April.  The Riad had a good location in the heart of Marrakech.  The breakfast on the rooftop with a view over Jemaa El Fnaa is great.  Very friendly staff and Christophe is very helpful.  Thank you Christophe and all your staff for a lovely stay.

Review_Title: Two nights stay at riad andalla
Review_Text: My two friends and I stayed two nights at the riad andalla and had a great time! When we arrived in Marrakech main square we were met by one of the ladies from the riad who led us to riad - on arrival we were given tea biscuits and wifi.  The riad is very traditional clean and modern with very friendly and helpful staff! Breakfast was great didn't have dinner there but it smelt unreal! The location of the riad is about 200m from main square - great location!! And it is a very cost effective place to stay! Would highly recommend!!!!

My two friends and I stayed two nights at the Riad Andalla. Airport pickup was easy and took us straight to the riad. Whole riad very traditional and beautiful.. The terrace had a great view of Jemaa el Fna and surroundings.. Our room was in the building opposite very easy to move between the two. Room was spacious and very nice! Breakfast was great- assorted pastries bread roti and fruit!  Definitely will be coming to stay here again next time in Morocco

Review_Date: Saloshni M wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We spent four nights at the Riad in the second week of April. Hats off to Christophe Abdul Karim and the ladies for their service and hospitality. I had a room on the first floor (Laroubia) which was a fine size for one person. There are couches on the landing for you to lounge on if you wish. The bathroom was small but fine for me: nice shower. A curtain separates the bathroom from the bedroom.Great having the A/C to cool down the room. Please note that there are no locks on bedroom doors here. This was not a problem.    Breakfast consisted of a variety of breads and pastries with jam and honey. We asked for eggs yoghurt and cheese to be included and they were happy to oblige. Thank you for that. We ate dinner here on our first night. The Tajines were delicious. A lot for two people.    Great eating on the roof terrace with the views of the square. It does get hot in the morning so you might want to look for a spot with some shade when having breakfast.    The location is great to wander around the square and other tourist sights. Christophe and Abdul are ever ready to provide information. We took bus number 15 from the square to visit Jardin Marjorelle. We walked everywhere else.    We enjoyed our stay and readily recommend the Riad. Book directly with the Riad/Christophe. If you are a traveller with deep pockets then check out the newer property Riad Andalla Spa for an exclusive/upmarket option!

Review_Title: Good location and super friendly staff
Review_Text: The location is excellent. It is 3 minutes from the main square.    When you arrive it's a little strange to walk between the houses to find the riad. Seems complicated but it was easy to find after the 1st time :) I recommend ordering the transport from the riad as they will bring you directly to the riad. I can imagine it being very hard to find by yourself (as are most other riads as well). Most of the riads are located in between the buildings.    The staff was very nice and were really good to our 2 year old daughter which they called Nina :) (which is faroese for 'sit')    Breakfast is fine and the evening dinner was great :)    Keep up the good work! Recommended! :)

Review_Date: Helgi M wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Very good location and friendly staff
Review_Text: The staff were very friendly and the riad was close to the main square the food was also very nice and the view from the roof was beautiful.  I recommend you try the dinner option as the food was VERY good

We are a family of 4 with two children that are 14 years old and almost 2 years old and we had a great stay! Riad Andalla is a very nice place and has a good location BUT the best thing about this place was the staff - They were simply AMAZING! SO friendly and helpful! :)

The staff is really nice and helpful. They took their time to explain us everything we needed to know. They offered us a welcome tea. The room is spacious and comfortable. The AC worked perfectly. We had to go to the next house where they serve the breakfast. The next house is right in front of the one in which we were. The very nice breakfast is served at the terrace where you have a good view of the jemaa el efna square but sadly it's not the highest terrace. Even though we only stayed on night the price is really worth it. You won't find this place on your own because it's in a narrow street so forget about the GPS. We were close to the hotel so we asked for help and didn't pay for the help. The thing is i speak arabic so it helps a lot. You should ask a local and say right away that you won't pay them for their help. Pity the guesthouse doesn't have a sign outside of the narrow street.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Review_Title: Fine location and very helpful staff
Review_Text: Placed at the big square in Marrakech means that many of the city's sights are close by. The very helpful staff will tell you where to find them. Breakfast is very good and served on the roof terrace. They also serve fine traditional meals.

Review_Date: Thiago S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: The service was exceptional fantastic if you want to stay in the medina of marrakech and looking for a riad with great location and price this is the place ..  O atendimento foi excepcional fantástico se você quiser ficar na medina de Marraquexe e procura um Riad com ótima localização e preço este é o lugar ..

We spend three nights in Marrakech and Riad Andalla was awesome! The staff was so personable. They had great suggestions and took really good care of us. We even got lost on our second day in the souks and ran in to one of the gentleman who worked there and he showed us how to get home. The rooms are small but very pretty. I loved being so close to the square and the souks. Truly in the heart of everything. It's wonderful to hear the call to prayer in your rooms. However if you are a light sleeper make sure you bring ear plugs or download a sound machine app on your phone.. that helped me a lot.  The riad is very safe. There is no handle on the door so you have to be buzzed in to even get in to the riad. Strangers cannot just come in. Also one thing to note that surprised me was that the room doors do not lock. The staff is always around so it is safe. But I was thankful I had a lock for my suitcase.

Two houses one riad run by the friendly Christophe and friends. Rooms in two buildings beautiful rooftop terrace overlooking the central square.    Staying here you'll feel more like you are staying with family than in a hotel. After a lovely but sweet breakfast they will send into the souks with some good advice and a smile.    Advice: If traveling together but booking separate rooms make sure you have rooms in the same building.    ALWAYS take a map you will never find this place on your own!

The riad location is perfect: just two minutes from Jemaa El Fna square and very close to other main attractions in Medina. The breakfast is extra sweet (jams pancakes yoghurt breads...) but delicious; it is served on a terrace where you can enjoy the view of the city Jemaa El Fna square and Atlas mountains. Christophe is an excellent host sharing his knowledge on where to eat to go or to buy something.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: As good as the first time
Review_Text: Ideal location close to the square. Christophe is a great host full of wit charm and a fantastic knowledge of local restaurants and where to go.. Super breakfast and evening meal. You will be hard pushed to find a better Riad in the centre of the Medina. Thanks Christophe see you next time!!

My wife & I spent 4 days in Riad Andalla with Christophe & his team what an amazing place. After reading the reviews before hand I thought this needs to be a special & it lived up to its reputation! Excellent value for money great rooms clean & tidy - we stayed in the "Chems" room over looking the famous square. The breakfast is fresh bread fruit yoghurt orange juice coffee & pancakes more than enough to set you up for the day exploring Marrakech. This takes place on the roof top garden whereby you can see the snow capped Atlas Mountains while over looking square. All local sight seeing venues are close to the Riad so a great location too. Hope to come back again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Second time at Riad Andalla and just as good as the first. Best location available and staff can't do enough. If you want Hilton type fixtures and fittings it's not for you but if you want to stay in the heart of it all in a proper Marrackech Riad where you feel like one of the family then this is the place.

The location is excellent. Next to Jemaa el Fnaa and very easy to find after all day walking around markets. The roof terrace has amazing view of square. Large breakfast was served there and we enjoyed every sip of coffee. Rooms are very nicely decorated and bed was really comfortable. WiFi was excellent. And the staff are all amazing very friendly and helpful. Perfect Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paolo B wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: Very nice atmosphere and hosting, with an outstanding terrace (and breakfast :-))
Review_Text: Perfect place to stay in the old part of the city.  Very friendly staff with whom to have interesting conversations about the city and not only.  Very elegant atmosphere furniture and riad details: really an immersion in the rich buildings of ancient Morocco.  And most relevant a wonderful and unforgettable terrace on the worldwide known square; having an outstanding breakfast there has no price :-).  Unfortunately the staff was not able to reserve good weather for us for all our days but gievn their kindness and friendlyness we can forgive them.

Riad Andalla is located in the city center and therefore the perfect place to explore Marrakesh. All sights are reachable within a 10-15 minute walk. The breakfast on the rooftop with a view over Jemaa El-Fnaa is great! Staff is very helpful and nice with good recommendations (local food attractions..) and rooms are clean. Dinner is optional and can be recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thiago S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: The service was exceptional fantastic if you want to stay in the medina of marrakech and looking for a riad with great location and price this is the place ..  O atendimento foi excepcional fantástico se você quiser ficar na medina de Marraquexe e procura um Riad com ótima localização e preço este é o lugar ..

However if you are a light sleeper make sure you bring ear plugs or download a sound machine app on your phone.. that helped me a lot.  The riad is very safe. There is no handle on the door so you have to be buzzed in to even get in to the riad. Strangers cannot just come in. Also one thing to note that surprised me was that the room doors do not lock. The staff is always around so it is safe. But I was thankful I had a lock for my suitcase.

Advice: If traveling together but booking separate rooms make sure you have rooms in the same building.    ALWAYS take a map you will never find this place on your own!

Review_Title: As good as the first time
Review_Text: Ideal location close to the square. Christophe is a great host full of wit charm and a fantastic knowledge of local restaurants and where to go.. Super breakfast and evening meal. You will be hard pushed to find a better Riad in the centre of the Medina. Thanks Christophe see you next time!!

You will be hard pushed to find a better Riad in the centre of the Medina. Thanks Christophe see you next time!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: wonderfull location terrace and amazing breakfast.  really really great.  absolutly clean. Andre and Cristophe and ll staff are perfect.  help us fo everything.to discover in Marrakech.  thanks a lot.  alberto

Review_Date: Daniel R wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: For sure we will be back!    Thanks Christopher and staff for everything! What an amazing stay!    We lived everything from the room (very comfy and clean) to the private terrace (yes! Almost private! With incredible view of the Jamaa El Fna).    Great breakfast! Great staff with lots of love an great tips!    For sure we will be back!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I've been staying at this Riad for 7 nights already and have enjoyed my time here. The Riad feels like someone has welcomed you into their perfectly decorated private home.It's not high end or fancy but it's full of character. The rooms have traditional tiles and furniture and the bed is quite comfortable. The entire staff here treats you with genuine warmth and friendliness. I was here on a business trip to attend COP and one of the guys even offered me a ride on his motorbike on my first day which was appreciated as I hadn't orientated myself yet.    The rooftop is great too especially in the morning light with the music of the square emanating from below.    The only complaint I have is that the doors do not have locks. Otherwise this has been a thoroughly enjoyable stay in a well located Riad next to the square.

We had a great time in Marrakech. We stayed for three days in Riad Andalla. Very confortable clean close to the main sites and with a great breakfast with the fantastic view of the beautiful square Jemaa el fna. All the people working there were very kind always helping and giving very good tips. Very good!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: wonderful riad in heart of medina
Review_Text: fabulous place fabulous staff fabulous view....would definitely recommend and stay again. Rooftop terrace overlooking jemma el fna on one side and the atlas mountains on the other. Thank you Christoph and all your staff for a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this lovely Riad for 3 night and feel just like home soon we enter the place. The Riad was in perfect location to explore Marrakech and the room was clean and comfy. All the staff and the owner are all awesome and very helpful. We had a perfect first dinner in the roof top over seeing plaza Djemaa El-Fna and it was an incredible view. Christophe has drawn us his secret map that very help us to go exploring the surrounding area of Old Medina.  Highly recommend this Riad in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Selman U wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Riad Andalla was the best hotel of our holiday. Its location hosts and our room was perfect. Strongly recommended for couples. They even gave us a much bigger room than our reservations room without any charges. Thank you guys 😊
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Harrison T wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Hi  Stayed here for 4 nights for a wedding. Welcomed in a lovely and friendly manner! Informed about the place and what's local. This felt more like a place for family to stay in and not a hotel. Breakfast was served individually so felt special. Was recommended local places for lunch and dinner. They went out of their way to find tour guides. Even when I was sick with food poison they helped there. The only thing I would suggest to change is nothing!  Oh and lovely view of the city. Thank you. See you guys soon. Your humble guest Harry

We stayed as a group of 5 friends in this riad. We were all made to feel welcome from the moment we walked in till we left we were made to feel like VIPs. The staff really work hard to make the stay memorable. Really comfortable bed and a super breakfast served on the balcony over looking the main square. I would recommend this place and if we take another trip to Marakesh will stay here again.

You're looking for a home away from home? Right in the centre of the medina but still away from hectic djema el Fna? Andalla has lovely rooms and super fun hosts and staff. They will make sure you have a good time and they have tons of tips to share with you...from restaurant recommendations to spas and where to buy a rug.  I have been visiting pretty much every year for the last 5 years.

Review_Date: Lukas J wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Everything just perfect about this place. Staff IS very friendly and helpful. The place have good vibes and atmosphere :) Location is strategically very good in the heart of Medina 10 min walk from Grand Taxi. Good food combined with view from roof top. And last but not least they have beer :)

Review_Date: Anna P wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights with my 82 year old mother who couldn't walk too far. Excellent location as so close to the main square. Food in the Riad was excellent we loved having breakfast on the sun terrace and being able to watch the market come alive without being hassled. The room was lovely in fact everything was great and Christophe and his team couldn't be faulted. So friendly nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend staying here and hope to come back with my husband.

Very nice place to relx yourself after a hard day in the trips!!    I really enjoyed os this riad.  Thanks to every workers they are very friendly all the time and the good advices i did recive from them¡!    See you soon guys i will come bk!!  Marrakech was so amazing    Lola xx

Review_Date: Nick K wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed a few days at Riad Andalla in the beginning of October. I worked in hospitality in my young age and traveled the World - this was probably the best experience I ever had. Staff at this place is excellent and great example of customer service. All starting with pre-arrival communication helping us to get excursions transport from airport great breakfast and location is the best with roof view on big square that is the center of Medina in Marrakesh. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Centrally located and we felt like at home!
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at the Riad Andalla and really enjoyed our stay there. Christophe was very friendly and gave us really good tips for Marrakech.  Some rooms were bigger some smaller but we stayed most of the time on the amazing terrace with a perfect view on the big square Jemaa el-Fnaa.  Breakfast was nice as well with different pastries bread and fresh fruit.

Review_Date: Daniel X wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: You know that friend that you don't see for years and when you are together it's perfect.  That's what we felt in Riad Andalla Christophe is like an old friend in a friends reunion super friendly with a great sense of humor and he can make yourself feel at home he told us what to visit and good places to eat even draw us a map (awesome map ;) ).  At first look the entry to the riad is a little hard to find ( we're saved by the guy of the transfer (booked by Christophe too) to tell us the way but after that it's very easy to find  The dinner and the Breakfasts were great the room clean and climatized sometimes the wi-fi was poor in my room but not big deal (I was in the room in the terrace i loved it (next time i'm gonna ask the same room). and all the staff is AWESOME.  2/3 minutes from the jemaa el fna in the center of everything.  If you want a traditional way and live the city to the max that's in Riad Andalla

Review_Title: Fantastic Location, Great Service, Great Value...Amazing Stay!
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is approx. 25 minutes by taxi from the airport. You can get either the grand taxi which will cost 100 dirham or the petite taxi costs 70 dirham. Alternatively there is a coach which costs 30 dirham per person from outside the airport. Be aware taxis cannot take you all the way to the riad as it's located down a very narrow alleyway. There are also certain times that the taxis can drive into the square so during busy hours you will need to walk approx 10 minutes to get to the riad.    I chose this property because of it's location and it really doesn't disappoint. You are right in the centre if el fna square but secluded enough from all the hustle and bustle and all the chaos for a good night's rest.    I stayed in the moon room which was decorated all in blue. Room is small but comfortable. There is no door separating the bathroom to the bedroom or tv (but why would you want a tv when it's so beautiful outside?). It was a little dark but once you opened up the windows it was ok.    The best feature is the terrace. It's got an amazing view of the fna square and the mosque. You could spend hours relaxing there just watching people go by and watching the beautiful sunset. Breakfast is served there every morning which consisted of fruit pastry bread tea/coffee and preserves.    All the staff here are absolutely amazing! Really welcoming and friendly. I had great recommendations from Younes for local restaurants and nightlife. Abdul was also so helpful and helped in organising our tours. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone visiting Marrakech as it ticks all the boxes for location cleanliness hospitality service and a traditional Moroccan riad!

My mum and I stayed in the Chems Suite for 3 nights. The room was nicely decorated and had a couple of windows which helped to provide some natural light. The riad itself is in the perfect location with only being a 2 minute walk to Jemaa El Fnna. We had no issues with the wifi and the breakfast was more than enough to start the day. The owners were very helpful with giving directions and also recommended a lovely (and cheap) hammam called Isis. We would definitely recommend this riad to anyone wanting to be close to the main square yet far enough away to be able to sleep at night.

Review_Date: Raees A wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad for two nights. The location of the Riad is brilliant only metres from jemaa el-fanaa square. Breakfast is served in the roof terrace with an excellent view of the square. The staff are friendly and extremely accommodating. Our flight left early yet the staff woke to ensure we had a good breakfast before we left. The only negative is the poor wifi. It was extremely difficult to connect and I found myself wandering the corridors whenever I wanted to send a whatsapp message. All in all and great place to stay.

Review_Date: Mary T wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: My husband and I decided to splurge in another city on $200/night hotels so we opted to save a little money while in Marrakesh for 3 days since there were many low prices options.  For only $37/night it was very clean very well located with beautiful terrace and great view and most importantly everyone was very nice!  The cleaning staff reception and owner were all lovely.  Although I'm certain all the staff are trustworthy that there are no locks on the rooms or safes in the rooms did make me a little uncomfortable. You just never know and the staff although trustworthy certainly don't know all the guests. I figure its better to not tempt the devil! We locked out valuables in our suitcase but I would have liked a lock of some sort.  Also arrange the train/airport pickup from hotel for first day to make arrival easier as it's hard to find the riad at first.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Samantha D wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: We stayed two nights and had a wonderful time. Christophe Ja a wonderful host and offers brilliant advise about the best places to eat. The Riad is centrally located close to the main square but it is peaceful and quiet! Would highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: "My home is your home" these are the welcome words that Cristoph the manager said when we arrived at this amazing and delightful Riad.. Confort silence elegance high quality of breakfast and Dinner (out in the terrace directly over Jema El Fnaa) and always kindness in everything you need.  Unforgettable holiday.. Thanks to all of you hope to visit your home back soon

Great little escape from the world. Tucked nicely behind the main square in the medina.    Take a walk up to the roof terrace and look down on the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. You can hear snake charmers and the markets from this vantage point.    Head downstairs to your rooms and it's a quiet cool oasis. Made daily and always clean and well catered for.    The staff helped me everyday to decide on what to do or to check in on how the day prior went.

Review_Date: Carmen C wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Stayed 3 nights with family group of 8. Perfect location 3 min from main square. Excellent accommodations clean comfortable AC. Great meals. Breakfast was wonderful. We had dinner in the Riad twice we couldn't get enough of the amazing food!!! Meals are served on the terrace roof overlooking the Plaza sunset and night view are breathtaking. Portions of the meals are very generous.  The best of the Riad is Christophe and his staff. Everyone makes you feel as if you are in your own home. They were all very welcoming and helpful in getting around the city. On their recommendation we went on a day trip to Atlas it was a wonderful experience.  We highly recommend staying here and we hope to return one day soon.

My friends and I have just spent a long weekend in this beautiful jem in the heart of Marrakesh. We were five girls looking for beautiful places to visit good food good atmosphere and nights out. We had all of this. It has been a 360 degrees complete experience from any point of view.    The Riad is situated just 2 minutes from the main square in Marrakesh. All the main attractions of the city are at a walking distance from the Riad. If it is too hot for you you can grab a taxi and in 10 mins you'll be anywhere.    I have only positive comments about my experience as follows:    - The rooms are really lovely in their Moroccan interior design and architecture clean tidy and spacious.    - The Terrace where you'll have an amazing fresh daily made breakfast (and dinner if you book it!) faces the main square and you can decide whether to sit at the table or on an elegant lounge area. Go to the terrace to enjoy the beautiful and colourful sunsets Marrakesh offers. An extra point of beauty and atmosphere is during the first evenig pray (around sunset time).    - Food is simply perfect: we had filling wonderful breakfasts (fresh juices home made bakery jams honey Moroccan yogurt etc) and a sumptuous Moroccan dinner where I had the best tajine ever in 4 days in town! So book at least one dinner (I suggest to have it on the day you arrive) and you will not regret! If you are a fun of wine don't miss Moroccan white wine out because it is really good and resfreshing after a day under the sun!    - The staff: nothing to say apart from a big big thank you to Christophe first of all because he helped me in organising this trip and all the activities we did and provided us with maps and detailed info about what to do where to go and where not where to eat. Following all the other guys working there always available present helpful and happy to talk everytime we meet them! A special thank you to Abdul because we woke him up early in the morning and late in the night to let us in :)  A big hug to all the lovely ladies who looked after food and cleaning!    I think this is enough information for you to pick this homely place to spend a great time in Marrakesh!    Elena

Just got back from a 3 day break in Marakash. We stayed at this riad it was just perfect for our needs. The rooms had air con the place was a two min walk to the Jemaa del Fna. The staff were all very friendly nothing was too much trouble.Anything you need to book ie.massage Hammams camel ride or a belly dancing show this hotel are more than happy to book them for you.  The hotel is decorated beautiful there is a super roof top terrace. They can serve alcohol so at the end of the evening you can relax up there with a glass of wine last thing at night if you wish.  Our group of 6 friends all commented on how comfortable the beds were.  Also there's hi speed wifi in the bed rooms and down stairs in the reception areahowever didn't work on the roof terrace but as we had wine and great company didn't need time!  Breakfast was one of the best I'd ever had lots of choice. We asked for eggs one morning and the next day we received them coked beautifully. I'm planning another trip and I will go stay there again.

Review_Date: Jill v wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: So close to the action but still distance from the crowds!
Review_Text: The most challenging for us was trying to orient ourselves after driving from Ait Ben Haddou to be able to find the close parking area. Christophe had been wonderful on email- very helpful but it was difficult. Nevertheless we figured it out and with the help of a cart man found our way to the Riad.    We were greeted with mint tea which was very welcome and refreshing! Being a group of four we had two rooms which was just great for us.The bathroom was- shall we say- intimate... But it was fine for us- nice hot water! Complimentary soaps etc.  It was a bit odd not to have locks on the doors but it caused no problems. We dropped off our things and made our way up to the terrace to see the action and then back down to join it!    We met Christophe after our dinner and he gave us a great recommendation for ice cream. He seemed to be a wealth of knowledge and was very flexible and open when it came time to pay our bill. We ended up paying in 2 currencies which was a very good way for us to use up our dirham.    Breakfast was served up on the roof terrace and was enormous with Moroccan pastries French pastries freshly squeezed orange juice a bowl of tangerines and Moroccan crepes.    It is a lovely place to stay- I would recommend it! Thank you Christophe!

Review_Date: S G wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: This Riad has a perfect location situated in the middle of the center.its very personal and you feel at home from the start.  Very nice small roof terrace for drinks and breakfast.  Staff feels like family and has a great atmosphere.They care and help with whatever.  Rooms nicecleanwe had a junior suite with Windows facing the big square.  Highly recommend this place.

Riad Andalla expresses well the soul of Marrakesh. Smiley warm charming and different. Andre and Christophe the owners and their staff Younes Abdelkhader Hayat Rhizlaine et Salwa love to see their guests happy. We loved our staying the room was spacious with a good bed. The dinner was a lovely experience well served and great tagines!! The location is perfect very close to Jema´a Al Fna which sight we could enjoy from the terrrace. Highly recomendable!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect way to start a vacation
Review_Text: Good location Helpful staff to answer questions charming nice rooftop terrace and near by Jema'a Alfna square. The view from the rooftop is beautiful especially at sunset you can see the whole square and activities but the riad itself is nice and quiet. Buy your juice at cart No 14 is the best.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve R wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: The perfect place to stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: The accommodation was simple but immaculately clean and well presented and the decor is comfortable homely Moroccan. The beds were comfy and the shower was hot. The location is secluded but so close to the square. Breakfast (and afternoon lounging) on the terrace couldn't be better and the foyer and lounge is a great space. You will not find friendlier and more helpful hosts and the evening meal was exquisite. I felt completely at ease and welcomed.

Everyone that works at the Riad were so friendly and helpful. As soon as we arrived and were offered tea and cookies we started to understand why the reviews are so great. The people the location and the food were all amazing and the Riad itself is full of charm and very cosy and the roof terrace is a great place to relax and watch the sunset. Thank you all hopefully we'll be back one day :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We were looking for something conveniently located as well as traditional and comfortable. Riad Andalla exceeded ALL our expectations starting with the traditional decoration of the place its cleanliness the view of the medina and the finesse of each employee to cater to every need we had made us feel like we never wanted to leave!...everything absolutely flawless! An amazing stay from beginning to end. A fantastic staff made of our stay the best experience ever! SUPERB! Merci Christophe!

Review_Date: steven c wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Christophe and his team will make sure your visit to Marrakech will be memorable. The location is perfect the rooms are beautiful and the rooftop terrace provides a great setting for breakfast or dinner (highly suggested). Although all rooms are nice recommended are those on the second floor as they receive the most light.

Review_Date: Mohammad A wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Staying here was very comfortable staff very pleasant and was very quite and peaceful.. The owners were really great Christophe gave a very good breakdown of Marrakech provided maps and suggested places to visit. It was a pleasure to meet everyone they sure made me feel at home.

Review_Date: Eva G wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: Excellent Riad in the best location
Review_Text: We spent 6 days in Riad Andalla. It is a small Riad with excellent views to the square and the Atlas. The rooms are not very big but very comfortable. The staff and the owner are really very nice and kind people. I recommend to have dinner in the Riad the food is very very good.

Review_Title: excellent location, excellent riad, excellent staff
Review_Text: spent 4 nights at Riad Andalla. It has a beautiful roof terrace which overlooks not only jemaa el fna but also there is a good view of the snow capped Atlas mountains. The main square is just a couple of minutes walk away so really close to souks but also great to walk around at night and see all the performers. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace. It varies each day and is delicious Christophe and all the staff are efficient and very friendly and helpful. Cant recommend it enough. Would love to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I'm so happy that I stayed in Riad Andalla. The interior design is flawless every single detail is beautiful. The offers a good breakfast in a beautiful roof garden and you can look to the main square and Atlas Mountains. The staff and the owner had a great attitude which is difficult to find in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My stay was perfect and very pleasant. An unforgettable experience.  The owners and all the staff know how to treat clients they actually made me feel like a princess. I was welcomed in a warm and nice way they told me everything I needed to know about Marrakech and I felt safe and like at home.  They know how to deliver excellence to clients and they do know what customer service is.  The riad is very beautiful clean charming and comfortable.  The terrace has a view on the Djema-el-fna square and it's nice to stay there both in the morning and at night.  The breakfast is included and is really good.

Review_Date: Jesper Ø wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Spent 2 nights at riad andalla in February of 2016. The place is perfect for both business and pleasure. The location just of the Djemaa El Fnaz is perfect for shopping and sightseeing. The staff are all delightful and can't do enough to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I will surely return to Riad Andalla - next time I will bring the family.

Review_Date: Mayank Agarwal wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Near the Square & Friendly Staff, Budget place to stay in the Medina
Review_Text: This is the place to stay in Marrakech for a day or two but if you are in city for more days look at accommodation outside the Medina at GueIiz.    The Riad is in the Medina tucked away in the end of a narrow lane this keeps the noise away and you are still just 3 to 5 minutes walk away from the main square. The roof top has a decent view of the square the main tourist attractions of Marrakech are just 10 minutes walk away.    The basic rooms were small & bare the toilet was separated with just a curtain the bathroom accessories & towels provided were not of high quality. Initially was skeptical of the room but got use to it after the first day. One of the big plus of the room is the lighting they actually had bright lights all the other riads i had stayed at had only decor lights. By the way the doors have no lock first day we used our own padlock but on the advice of the management left it open for the next three days without any problem.    The breakfast was always good the quality & variety of breads was among the best we had in Morocco.    The staff were always friendly ready to help with advice in anyway they could. The only place i have booked at where we got emails from management before we arrived preparing us for our travel. Christophe the guy who speaks English in the Riadadvised us on a Spa & it was among the best massages i have ever had. Provided us with directions to the attractions & advice's on which ones to see. When i requested for a English guide arranged one at cheaper rates than others. Although to be frank the guide was among the most useless i have ever hired basic English & little knowledge. I hope Christophe reads this and avoids the particular guide in future.    I would recommend the Riad for a day or two as its located in the center of medina where you would end up spending those days anyways but know that the rooms are small & basic.

Review_Date: Jana V wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: The plan was to stay 2 nights but the atmosphere and the service at Riad Andalla was so great that we stayed there till the end of our trip to Marrakech. The owners and the staff were such great people very helpful know the do and dont's of Marrakech really well you can pay by credit card etc. It was such a great experience this stayment that my boyfriend and me are definitly going back to Andalla when we will visit Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed here in November 2015 while extending a business trip to Morocco. The Riad is right off the Djema Al Fena square so you are in the heart of Marrakech in a prime location.    Rooms are small cosy and clean. The bedroom doors do not lock but it is safe to leave your belongings there I was there for 5 nights and did not once have a problem with belongings. Ask for a room with a window when you book.    Breakfasts are served on the roof and is wonderful. You overlook the square and can see the Atlas Mountains and Koutubia while enjoying a breakfast of fresh juice coffee fruit and bread/ pastries.    Yunus and Abdul Kader are wonderful managers always willing to help and offer advice. One morning I had overslept for my tour to the mountains Yunus came to knock on my door and asked the tour operator to pick up the other guests and return for me so that I wouldn't miss the tour. One word of advise book your tours through them it is cheaper than booking them online.    I would recommend staying here to experience the heart of Marrakech.

Two nights at Riad Andalla and we felt like part of the family! Welcoming kind helpful interested funny all the staff couldn't do enough to make our stay an absolute joy.  Well worth booking dinner in the riad for €20pp for 3 courses as it was absolutely delicious.  Accommodation was perfect - spotlessly clean quiet but with that amazing terrace where the perfect breakfast was served.  Wouldn't hesitate to recommend Riad Andalla to anyone that will listen!  Merci shokran thank you. XXX

I must admit I was sceptical in staying at a RIAD I will probably incline towards a hotel experience but as my wife insisted on experiencing an authentic feel i reluctantly agreed. We stayed for 4 nights and to my surprise I thoroughly enjoyed the stay the place is done beautifully and feels warm the rooms are clean has heating as most riads I read may not has a door to the bathroom you may laugh but a lot of Riads dont have doors on the bathroom. Its so close to the main square you just end up staying really late just soaking up the atmosphere not having to worry about a long walk back. The breakfast is nice on the roof not a super wide selection but ok. Noise from outside corridors may be problem in the morning but Riads are not meant to be sound proof and the shower pressure may be a little on the slow side.    You dont need to worry about dragging your luggage through the square either as an authorised taxi takes you pretty much right to the door steps.    Christophe and all the guys were so welcoming friendly and super helpful made my trip memorable even organised flowers and a personal card at my wifes request so I do thank them and look forward to visiting again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Magical stay at Riad Andalla for 2 nights
Review_Text: Me and my wife had a lovely stay at Riad Andalla for a couple of nights for our holiday in Marrakech following a couple of nights in Agadir. The riad was a fine example of the great Moroccan hospitality and attention to detail in the homely riad was excellent. Location was great as its just a couple of minutes walk from the famous Jemaa El-Fnaa square. Christophe was very helpful with email correspondance even before arriving at the riad and while we were there he gave us lots of vital advice on places to visit and eat out he gave us a local map of the medina as well and showed us the routes to take so we dont get lost in the tiny streets and souks of the medina. Yunus the manager during the nights was very kind as well and gave us crockery and guided us to a nice cakeshop nearby so we could celebrate my birthday at midnight. Breakfasts on the roof top terrace were sumptuous with a spectacular views of Jemaa El-Fnaa and Abdul who used to serve the breakfast was so kind. Our room was very comfortable and we were allowed to leave our luggage after check out on the last day because our flight was at 8pm hence we had peace of mind to explore a bit more of Marrakech before coming back in the evening to collect our luggage. We would strongly recommend staying at Riad Andalla and would definitely come back again to stay on our next trip to Marrakech :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barbara R wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: great atmosphere very nice location and a wonderful team that try to fulfill your wishes with pleasure and a very good sense of humor. I felt very welcomed and comfortable - that´s a great feeling when you travel alone.Thanks a lot for this wonderful time with you and I definitely come back!

Pros-one of many good locations to get to the souks within a minute simple yet good spread for breakfast great checking in experiencevery helpful and friendly staffs and managers we met Abdul and he had us booked for Hammam and dinners. Cons- nothing premium about the hotel we felt we overpaid for the rooms as we booked through one of the online website the rooms are old with no tv and hair dryer. Our room has no window for fresh air. Conclusion- No magic lamp in this old inn. A little tip- book directly with them and skip all online sites. That's what I call a good deal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best location, awesome service, caring owners
Review_Text: My wife and I recently stayed at Riad Andalla during the portion of our honeymoon in Marrakech. We arrived late at night due to a held up train but paid a few dirham to a local to help us find the riad. At first you'll probably need someone to show you where it is but as it is literally right off of the Djemma el F'na (the main square in the medina) once someone shows you the first time you'll easily find it again.    After some much needed rest in a beautifully blue-tiled room we awoke to an awesome breakfast of fresh squeezed orange juice coffee and breads/pasteries on the rooftop terrace. The view over the medina and the Djemma El Fna is second to none. The location is superb and allows you to easily access anything from restaurants souks cabs or anything else you may want to do in Marrakech.    Christophe the owner took time to give us a map and tell us about the medina and Marrakech in general. He gave us some good tips on what to see and do and even helped us set up a camel excursion for a very reasonable price. You can see that he has pride of ownership in his riad and he works with his staff to ensure customer service is excellent. Both of his employees Younes and Abdelkhader were kind and professional.    The riad itself has is excellently decorated and makes you feel very 'Moroccan'. Due to the location the pride of ownership the customer service and the views I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Marrakech! Thanks to the team at Riad Andalla for our awesome stay!

Review_Date: Ernesto M wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Best spot in Marrakesh with the best staff!!!
Review_Text: Unbeatable experience at the Riad Andalla. The rooms are comfortable clean and cozy. The location is excellent for getting to know the real Marrakesh. But above all the staff was extremely helpful kind and trustworthy. Definitely the best choice when visiting this city! Will be back!    When we arrived we were greeted by happy faces and were immediately made comfortable with some delicious mint tea at the reception. We were then showed to our rooms and advised where to go for the evening. During breakfast staff helped us plan our trip and even booked our tours to the Three Valleys and Essaouira both with a local company that took very good care of us at a very good price. For dinning they recommended the best places in town and made the reservations for us. They even helped us get around the market and gave us excellent advice to avoid getting ripped off by merchants. On the day of our departure they helped us clear a misunderstanding with our taxi company. When we arrived at the airport we noticed we had left our travel money behind and when we called the riad they helped us find it and sent it back to us!! (Thanks guys)    It is difficult selecting a hotel in Marrakesh and it can be stressful not being able to trust the people but with Andalla it was all good! Book it!    P.S. The food in the hotel is home-made make sure you dine there at least once!!!

We visited marrakesh for 4nights in total and we couldn't be happier with riad andalla. The location was perfect and the food amazing the tour to Essaouira that they arranged for us was very good and at a very good price. The food was great and we had the friendliest and nicest hosts and staff from the hotel. The riad exceeded our expectations and the trip wouldn't have been the same in any other hotel. The next time we are in Marrakech will definitely be in the riad. We couldn't have been more happy with riad andalla.

Review_Title: 2 nights in Marrekesh with good experiences
Review_Text: All staff are very friendly and helpful. Christophe replied my email quickly gave a good briefing for my stay hamman spa referral.    Abdou is nice and strong to help my wonderful breakfast at the rooftop (perfect view on Jemaa El-fnaa).    Although the entrance is in a small alley that I need help to get there with my big baggage it doesn't affect at all for my high scores on this nicely decorated riad.

My wife and I stayed in Riad Andalla in the middle of november for one week. We can only agree with former reviews in that the place is exellent in so many ways especially location and the friendly and caring hosts. Transport and other services at the Riad were exellent as well. Our room was the red one clean cosy and not very big no window but then we spent all day outdoors anyway. Up a stair and you were at the terrace with view of the Djemna el Fna. Next time in Marrakesh will be at the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited marrakesh for 3 nights in total with a trip to the atlas mountains in the middle.  We couldn't have been more happy with riad andalla. Location was perfect best meal we had on our trip beautiful accommodation and the friendliest hosts we have encountered! I don't think our trip would have been the same had we not stayed here. Thanks to everyone x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John T wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: If you want a feel for life in the Medina Riad Andalla is the perfect choice. Reading the reviews below I see mentioned all the of good things we enjoyed. The great location right in the heart of things the beautiful and calm interior an oasis and the rooms each uniquely decorated with great taste and flair. The roof terrace is a dream floating above the square but somehow peaceful metres away less fortunate tourists haggle for seats on the much less pleasant cafe roof terraces. All of this at a very good value rate. But the best thing about Riad Andalla? Christophe and his crew with that rare mix of superb professionalism and genuine warmth. Abdul (the sweetest soul you could meet) presented us with a beautiful meal when we arrived probably the finest and most sumptuous we had in Marrakech. Christophe was never too far away and responded to our questions and requests with efficiency and good humour all of the staff provided excellent service but were never intrusive.    Riad Andalla is part of the Medina and this makes the trip to Marrakech a more complete travel experience. We met a few different travellers/tourists who were staying in the newer hotels outside the city walls. I guess they get keycards flatscreen TV and a minibar but they looked wistful when we told them where we were and most wished they had booked a Riad. They ought to have and they missed out. And which Riad to book?Riad Andalla of course!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is right in the heart of Marrakech's medina just two minutes from the the main square Jemaa el Fna but is also incredibly tranquil and welcoming. Its best feature: a rooftop terrace overlooking the square where the owner Christophe and his excellent team serve up hearty breakfasts of pastries pancakes yoghurts and fresh fruit. The views here are fantastic. Service is attentive and friendly but never overbearing.  We ate one evening meal at the Riad. 20 euros a head more than in the restaurants and cafes around the square but far far better quality. The Riad staff served up fabulous fresh tagines and cous-cous in the tastefully decorated patio courtyard at the Riad's heart.  The Riad is up narrow alleys and would be hard (but not impossible) to find for the first time without a guide. We booked a ride from the airport with the Riad taking a lot of hassle out of the experience. This was 20 euros for four people and well worth the cost for peace of mind.  We stayed in an annex - a second Riad essentially - opposite the main base of the Andalla. Rooms were comfortable clean and had an authentic feel. There was no TV but why would you want to watch TV when you have Marrakech's ever entertaining main square on your doorstep?  Stairs were steep in both Andalla buildings. This I understand is typical of riads in the medina but anyone with children or anybody with mobility issues should take care.  Staff at Andalla were really helpful and welcomed us with mint tea and a really helpful orientation lesson in how to find your way around the medina and its fabulous sights. In short Andalla offered tremendous value and service for in our case 75 euros a night.

The only place to stay if you will be in Marrakech. Beautiful Riad with an amazing rooftop view of the main square that you can sit at in the evenings and enjoy the beautiful lights sights and sounds of the night market. They also serve breakfast on the roof to enjoy the morning sun and fresh air. It is located directly behind Cafe France on the corner of the main square and takes all but 3 minutes to get from the main square to the Riad. You will never be able to beat location of this Riad. The management is excellent as well. Christophe is AMAZING and takes the time to make sure that you have everything you need/want.    I would also like to personally note that should you choose to book excursions into the desert for camel trekking or ANYTHING else for that matter - Contact Christophe or the Riad and they can make all the arrangements for you. I made a HUGE mistake by booking my tours myself thru a company called Moroccan Nature Trail- and it was a COMPLETE nightmare! I chose that company because of the positive reviews it had on Trip Advisor- but it is NOTHING like they promise or describe. They are out to get your money while you get back VERY little for what you paid for. So book with Christophe at the Riad. I will do this next time I am back in Marrakech in April and will book my stay at this establishment again as well.

Review_Title: if in Marrakech you must stay here!
Review_Text: It was our first time in Marrakech and from the moment we arrived at the airport to the time we flew out again Christophe & his team made this a most memorable stay. The driver who collected us from the airport arranged by the Riad was so welcoming & friendly provided us with some local info & pointed out highlights during our trip into the Riad. When we set foot inside the Riad door it was like arriving home! We were greated with genuine smiles of happiness & made to feel immediately comfortable with a serving of delicious mint tea & biscuits. Never having experienced Riad style accommodation before we were not sure what to expect but definitely not disappointed. Our room was very comfortable & tastefully decorated. It was cleaned daily beds made & fresh towels... It's the small things that make your stay comfortable! The view from the terrace over the main square Drama el Fna was brilliant.. You could watch hear & enjoy all the happenings but be in a completely relaxed atmosphere! The terrace is also a fabulous social meeting place particularly at breakfast time to get chating to other travellers & hear their experiences. Christophe the owner makes each & every guest feel like part of his family. He provides excellent information on what to see and do where to eat & where to shop. He will arrange what ever type of tour/trip you want to do. For us it was a walking tour of the souks & a day trip out to the Atlas Mountains - both thoroughly enjoyable. I think what stands out the most about this accommodation is the team Christophe has selected to look after you during your stay. Lots of fun lots of laughs & nothing was ever a problem for them... Whether you wanted a tea or coffee on the terrace after a day out & about or an early morning pick up due to a flight change  they took care of everything & always happy to do so. A peaceful & tranquil place to stay with the added touch of wit & humour! If you like to travel Marrakech is a must do - even if only once in your lifetime.. & Riad Andalla is simply where you must stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Izzy M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Riad Andalla has a great location; a 2 min walk from Djema el Fna but far away enough to admire the main square from the amazing rooftop terrace.    Staff are amazingly helpful and friendly and gave us great recommendations for tours and trips as well as steering us in the right direction when it came to picking dinner locations!    Rooms were clean tidy and nicely decorated and gave a great riad experience as they are based around an open atrium.    It's a great riad for booking with friends as there is a nice social atmosphere and the rooftop terrace is ideal for tea drinks and nibbles as a group.    Overall Riad Andalla was the perfect place to stay with great rooms lovely staff and amazing food! Highly recommended!

So - first time in Morocco. It's hard to find any Riad that has a below average rating in this city as it's always so busy. But I settled on Riad Andalla because of it's very close proximity to Djemma el-Fna square - thus giving me the capability to be fully immersed in all that Marrakesh had to offer for the 3 nights I was staying.    I loved the first impressions of Riad Andalla even before I arrived - all individually and tastefully decorated rooms which were all very different in their style.    Upon arrival I was warmly greeted even before I got to the door after the taxi the Riad had arranged kindly dropped me off close by. A pot of refreshing mint tea and some gorgeous small biscuits followed whilst I was given a welcome introduction some useful tips and some maps of the area - most useful and instant relaxation.    I was shown to my initial room which happened to be across the road at the Andalla Jdid part of the Riad. Unfortunately it was on the 3rd floor (roof) and up some very steep stairs. I wasn't comfortable being totally exposed on the roof so I immediately asked to be moved to another room.    That wasn't a problem - other rooms were available so I got the white and blue room (Kamar) on the 2nd floor of the main Riad for 2 nights followed by the room next to it for the last night - no hassle at all.    The breakfast on the room terrace was lovely (and so was the roof terrace even when breakfast wasn't being served) Great views of the Atlas Mountains Djemma el-Fna square and the Koutoubia Mosque. Not forgetting being able to soak up all the sounds from the calls to prayer drumming from the snake charmers and the hustle and bustle of it's business. Yet somehow you still notice the peace the roof terrace affords you - even at such close proximity. The breakfast changes every day. Sometimes it's a bit -bready' but not always.    Although Christophe was away Younes and the crew took great care of me - you are made to feel as though you are their only guest whether they are busy or not. there is no hustle or shouting or fuss in the Riad everyone communicates and it runs like clockwork. No disturbances nothing. Tea coffee can be provided any time of the day/evening for a small charge.    Riad Andalla also arranged for a guide at my request who guided me around the Medina and the main attractions for 7 hours on my 2nd day - another sign of their helpfulness before you even arrive.    In short - I am definitely coming back to Marrakesh - and I am definitely staying here again. It was absolutely one of my best city breaks the memories of Marrakesh and Riad Andalla will stay with me for a long time for all the right reasons.    Your hospitality care and service are immaculate :)

Review_Date: kimanzi c wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: The Best Staff and Views in Marrakech
Review_Text: I was blown away by the view from the top of the riad but the staff outdid the view. They were amazing the food was good and I felt at home. Very real feel of Morocco. I would highly recommend this riad to anyone. I am an American who was a little nervous about Morocco they made me feel at home and safe. The owner Christophe is funny informative and cares a lot about his guest. Very glad I chose this place.

Review_Date: Katka J wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: The Riad Andalla a nicely decorated place in Moroccan style where you feel so welcome. The riad and our room were always clean a/c working very well which was important considering outside temperature +48 Celsius. A lovely breakfast on the roof terrace with a view on the Djemaa el-Fna square. If needed it was served early in the morning so we could go on our trips which were kindly booked by Christopher on our request. I would like to thank to Abdel and Youness who always smiled a lot were so friendly kind and helpful. And special thanks for their hospitality:)

Riad Andalla was the first Riad we stayed at and we had no idea what to expect. We have booked the taxi from the airport as Christoph suggested and this proved out to be a very good idea. Due to the huge ques at the passport control at the airport it took about 15 hours to get out. Despite all this our taxi was there waiting for us. We have initially reserved the small room at the ground floor but after the first night we have received a free upgrade. The breakfast on the terrace was also very good and every time we needed to leave earlier we were offered the breakfast at the time we needed to leave - even at 6.30 am instead of 8 am!  Christoph and his team took their time to help us organize our visit no only through Marrakech but even our whole tour in Morocco. We booked the 2 nights-3 days desert tour recommended by them and we had a very nice experience. We would definitely recommend it.  They also made restaurant reservations for us and bought the train and bus tickets that we needed - just like a 5* concierge.  Our overall description of our stay at Riad Andalla: WOW!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ms S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Fantastic hospitality, felt like staying with family
Review_Text: We'd recommend everything about Riad Andalla. From the wonderful breakfasts to the beautifully decorated rooms the friendly and helpful hosts to the excellent location. It was clean and comfortable and the staff could not do enough to help make our trip special. We will definitely be back!

Why come to Marrakech? My wife and I decided it's to experience some Moroccan culture hence staying in a Riad as opposed to a typical hotel. With well over 1000 Riads across Marrakech it was hard to choose one especially to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. After so many excellent reviews on the Riad Andalla we are glad we made this choice.    Christophe and his team made my wife and I feel so welcome by organising airport transfers advising us on the tours they provided and recommendations for restaurants and spas.    The staff are all very warm and full of smiles and part of the fun was communicating in French and Arabic.    The Riad is well decorated with a homely design and authentic feel a lot of detail in a small space. Again another taste of culture we wanted from the mosaic tiles wooden window shutters the random artwork on the walls to the light shades and candle holders.    Our bed was nice and firm with clean sheets and towels daily. The rooms are basic with no TV and the wifi varies depending where you are in the Riad but we didn't come to Marrakech to watch TV or sit on our phones all day. The en suite shower/ toilet was always cleaned and the AC unit worked well.    Being ideally situated just off the main square it was away from the majority of the noise but you could still hear the snake charmers and the drummers from the square which went on most of the day not too much off an issue if you are out exploring as we were. Our daily 5am alarm came in the form of the first prayer of the day being so close to several mosques it was surprising at first. However we felt this added to the charm of the Riad and encompassed the cultural experience we were searching for. The sounds soon fade into the background. This also meant from the roof terrace you get an excellent view of Jemaa El Fna square especially at night enjoying a nice Moroccan tea. You can also catch the Atlas Mountains in the horizon too.    We had also prearranged for an evening meal before we had arrived where we shared a freshly prepared chicken and vegetable tagine over candlelight which was fantastic.    To conclude a lovely stay in a charming Riad with its quirky and wonderful staff it ticked all the boxes we were looking for on our trip to Marrakech. All the small personal touches made a big difference and If this is the style of holiday you are looking for I would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Martina Gandolfi wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: THE PERFECT PLACE AT THE PERFECT TIME WITH THE PERFECT HOSPITALITY WELCOMING.
Review_Text: Willing to try the real Moroccan experience my friend and I decided to spend our two nights in Marrakech at this typical Riad.  As agreed by e-mail with Christophe a private taxi driver was waiting for us at the airport and with a warm smile he welcomed us to the city. He walked us to the Riad where Christophe and Abdelkader were waiting for us. The entrance of the Riad has revealed itself as a great surprise leaving us fascinated by the clear differences and peculiarities of the Moroccan culture. Impressed by the thousands details and objects in the hall we immediately felt like home. While waiting for our room we were offered to take a sit on the terrace and rizlan and rchida prepared a hot and intense mint tea for us accompanied by some crepes with butter and honey. All of a sudden Abdelkader showed up with a map of the city showing us all the interesting attractions and the typical experiences he strongly suggested to embark during our trip. We really appreciated the truly warmness of Moroccan hospitality and we shared with passion our desires and opinion.  As soon as the room was ready we took a decision about the places we wanted to go to and Christophe took care of all the reservations.  They recommended to try a Moroccan restaurant with local belly dance shows and music (dar essalam) and a wonderful and cheap hammam + massage center (Isis). Every time we came back at night younes greeted us with a friendly smile and asked us about our day. Such a pleasure to share and interact with the people of the Riad such a great feeling of comfort and ease.  Strongly recommended for the strategical position just 5 min from Jeema el Fna.

First first to Marrakech and we decided to stay in Riad Andalla. I'm glad that we didn't pass on this opportunity! Beautiful riad and the service was fantastic. The owners sat down with us on our first day and give us a map/some information which was really helpful and they organised our day trips. Considering we were close to the Jamaa el Fna when you were in your rooms it was quiet and the rooms are all decorated in traditional moroccan decor which was exactly what we were looking for. Plus the view from the rooftop was exceptionally beautiful with the square and the mountains in sight. Chrisophe and Andre were incredible hosts and Yousef and Abdul were also lovely. They treated you like friends and were always seeing how you are. All in all if you're looking for a place that reflects the true hospitality of Marrakech then stay at Riad Andalla you won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Third visit in that place i like to call home!  Situated on the edge of Jamaa el Fna Riad Andalla is ideal if you enjoy being among the hussle and bussle of the market  souks and street life(yet once in the room it is peace and quiet).  The rooms are very comfortable and decorated in traditional Moroccan style with confortable beds and en suite bathrooms however what makes this place really stand out is the incredible staff all of whom speak French English and Arabic. Christophe is a super star host and will take the time to explain the high lights of Marrakech how to negotiate the market sellers and do's and don't of Moroccan culture. The staff are more than happy to make bookings and organise trips and take care of tipping porters and drivers on your behalf (included in the price). ChristopheAndreYounesAbdelkaderHayatRachida and Rhizlaine enjoy their jobs and shine as "people persons" who enjoy helping and socialising with their guests. All have a great sense of humour too.

The location of this Riad couldn't be better. It's just a few steps away from Jemaa el fna and from the terrasse you have a great view on the square. Christophe and his team were very friendly and extremly helpfull with all their recommandations.    If we will come back to Marrakech we will for sure stay again here.

This property has had so many excellent reviews that I nearly did not bother to post but I think maybe a little more information about the property rather than the hospitality might help.  At first I was really concerned about the location - we arrived quite late and I felt somewhat inhibited about having to go down deserted alleys to get to the property but in fairness while we were there I had no concerns about security anywhere around the square.  Effectively this is a B&B with an evening meal option.  Unlike an hotel there are no 'extras' in the rooms ie no tv telephone hairdryer bath robes and only soap and a sachet of shampoo. As is traditional with a riad there are few external windows with most of the windows in the rooms overlooking the central court. There is however effective aircon. There is outside sitting space on the rooftop terrace. The accommodation is spread over 2 buildings with the 'annex' being across the alleyway - the wifi is not as good in this building.  I cannot improve on the favourable comments made elsewhere about the service ambiance and cleanliness.  If you are looking for a riad close to the real action this property would be excellent value and hard to beat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roddy M wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I absolutely loved my time here. Christophe and his staff were just great. They are more than willing to arrange things for you and help and advise you in whatever way they can to help you enjoy your stay.    The accommodation was great comfortable and clean rooms every day. The breakfasts were great more than most would eat in one sitting.    The Riad has a central location which is great for suoks and restaurants in the old city of Medina. Perfect place to get around and enjoy yourself and do your tours. Even enjoyed bartering in the end.    I recommend that you book a cab from the airport to the Riad. They will take you to the door in a bustling.    I would definitely come back to this Riad again if I ever get the opportunity to come back to Marrakech.    Thank you Christophe and thank your staff for me please.

Review_Date: Ted R wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I had an amazing time during my stay at Riad Andalla. This place is just a few minutes walk from the square and yet you still feel secluded and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Christophe André Younes Abdelkhader Hayat Rachida and Rhizlaine made sure that my stay here was comfortable and totally relaxing. I ended up staying another night here and I did not mind paying for another night because it was worth it. And more. Would be back soon. Inshallah!

Review_Title: A true Hidden Gem... What a Find!!
Review_Text: I Booked this Riad (a hotel in a traditional Moroccan Building) as i wanted somewhere near to the Magical Jemaa El fna and you honestly cant get any closer without being in the square itself!    I have truly unearthed a hidden gem which is very very good value for money. The Riad is a very short and safe walk from Jemaa El Fna. You are welcomed by the ever so nice and accommodating staff and nothing is too much for them.    The Riad itself is very well kept and the rooms very traditional Moroccan beats any standard hotel all day long. You truly do feel like you are in another world. The room was well equipped with a nice power showera/c and a great wifi signal.. that is all you need.    Breakfast on the terrace with a view of the square is priceless... and in the evening you can enjoy a lovingly prepared meal with the square lit up and its just magical.    The staff will bend over backwards for you and the owner Christophe is the Host with the most. He ever let me keep my luggage there after i had checked out and gave me a room to freshen up in before my late night flight.    He arranged door to door transfer from and to the airport for a very reasonable price and it was well worth it.    I have nothing bad I can say about my whole experience apart from the fact I had to leave... A true home from home book it quick before everyone else does!!

Review_Date: Alberto A wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I Was in Marrakech for short time but I had great time on this place specially the good attention of Christophe and all tean of Riad Andalla  Christophe the best !  Excellent location near Jemaa el Fnaa plaza

Review_Date: Steven I wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I have nothing but good words for Christophe and his team. The location was perfect the breakfasts were amazing the staff were friendly Christophe himself was especially helpful and a font of knowledge. The Riad itself was clean with a lovely and welcoming and homeley interior. As other have said - no lock on your door (a bolt from inside) but a small padlock would work. We never bothered and never felt unsafe.    I would advise anyone in Marrakech to stay at Andalla

Chose this after reading all the reviews and decided to stay our 2 nights here! Hosts Christophe and Abdulla (hope i spelt it correctly) were very welcoming! And Abdulla was great at explaining the local area and activities- so good in fact we signed up to the 2 day desert trip there and then (something I wouldn't necessarily advise doing - it was a fab trip but see my review of Imzi tours for details)  We actually didn't stay in the Andalla but a riad just opposite which was very nice clean but had a terrible sewage smell emanating from the bathroom. After a few mind you got used to it but it wasn't nice.  On returning from our desert trip we stayed here again because it was convenient but we did ask to stay at Andalla which they accommodated. The room was fab and we enjoyed staying here much more than the apartment opposite.    Breakfasts were great! And the view from the roof terrace was beautiful!    It worked out a little more expensive than we anticipated with the 5% fee added for card payments...which we thought was excessive considering other riads we stayed at didn't.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eric C wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Excellent riad located right around the corner from the Jemaa el-Fnaa the rooftop terrace even overlooks part of the square. The room was small but comfy and the staff couldn't have been nicer. Abdullah helped sort out lost luggage with several calls to the airport and the owner Christophe called our desert tour to make sure they knew where to pick us up. We loved being so close to the big square with all its action at night and we weren't far (within walking distance) from the souks palaces and other landmarks of the medina. One small note the door to our room didn't have a lock (many riads are like this) but we were able to secure the door with a small baggage lock. It probably wasn't necessary to even lock the door we had no qualms about the staff it's just one of those things that makes you more comfortable. Beer and wine are available upon request (a pleasant surprise as alcohol can be hard to find in Morocco). Would highly recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
