Review_Title: little and great treasure in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Our stay at the small hotel opposite the Riad Andalla was a pleasant surprise. Excellent location 2 minutes from the Plaza. The attention and confidence of Christopher and his team was excellent. We were 10 women and we were very comfortable like at home. I recommend it without any doubt!!

Review_Date: Farah Z wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Exceptional place, lovely people, adapted to everyone !
Review_Text: I spent 10 days in a magic place where each guest is welcomed by the kindness and generosity of the whole staff.  Ideally located and adapted to every type of traveler the Riad Andalla offers an excellent customer service for such an exceptional price.  This Riad is just unforgettable and I will definitely go back !

Review_Date: Ansis G wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Riad Andalla with it owner and staff made our stay in Marrakech even better. Riad has a perfect location with views from some rooms on main square and the roof terrace was a great extra. They serve breakfast on rooftop and you can have any meal there or just take a book order a beer or wine and have a time chilling in Morocco style sofas with umrbrellas. Nearly fell a sleep there for couple of times :)    Its location felt very safe and in short walking distance from main sites in medina. Rooms were clean well decorated and comfy. The whole riad Andella it self is a very beautiful place.    We surely will choose riad Andella visiting Marrokech next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorena Y wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Always welcoming with a warm smile
Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad during four days and felt very welcome. The staff is amazing very friendly and always ready to help you. It was our second time in Marrakech and the location is perfect. Without a doubt we recommend this Riad and we will go back.

Review_Title: Exceptional Customer service and Very Friendly
Review_Text: Had a traditional stay at the Riad. Central location and close to the Jama el Fena square which is really convenient. Stayed with my two sisters for 7 nights and found the staff very helpful (Adil Younus and Abdullah).

Review_Date: Louise R wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: Great View of the square, Lovely people and a brilliant breakfast!
Review_Text: Only stayed in Marrakesh for 1 night but the Riad Andalla was brilliant I stayed with my family so we had two junior suites both rooms were clean and comfortable with a great Moroccan feel. The square was at the end of the street and was amazing a must see experience and sitting on the terrace at night was lovely. Breakfast was also lovely lots of choice and very fresh. We were made very welcome from the minute we arrived. I would happily recommend this Riad to my friends.

Review_Title: Great location and view of the Square
Review_Text: Great location having a terrace overlooking the Square. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Adil got us Supratours tickets for our Essasouira bus trip. Rooms small though. Had a "suite" but very small. Just enough room for another single bed. Not bad value and great location. Would use again.

Review_Date: Tom T wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: Recently returned from a trip to Marrakesh and felt compelled to write a review on how impressed I was with this fantastic Riad. Firstly the rooms were very clean and comfortable with excellent air conditioning I travelled with 2 other friends and we all had a good nights sleep here. Worth mentioning is the excellent roof terrace with views right over jemaa el fna which at night lights up the whole area. Lastly but most importantly are the staff who were absolutely great and made us feel so welcome that after we left to visit essaouira we decided to stay there again when we returned to Marrakesh a few days later.

Review_Title: What a wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle...
Review_Text: We stayed here for two nights and I have to say it was absolutely fantastic. Amazingly friendly and helpful staff along with great comfortable rooms.    The Riad was a little bit difficult to find at first mainly because it's so close to the main square. But that just means that it was super convenient for doing everything and they have a roof terrace overlooking the square too!    All in all a lovely trip with great staff and a really nice relaxing atmosphere. Thanks for looking after us guys!!    Definitely worth a visit :)

Review_Date: Seif E wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: lovely authentic place... Do not worry about the small aleys.. Once in the Riad and welcomed by Abd Alqader you will know that u made the right choice. Abd Alqader is the best host you will feel he is ur friend. All the staff are nice.  The Riad is very clean and in the middle of everything. Great rooftop.  Thanks a lot. And special thanks to Abd Alqader he speaks many languages and made communication easy.

Review_Title: You are missing a trick if you don't stay here!
Review_Text: What a place! This Riad is in an excellent location and the staff are fantastic.  We felt like it was a home away from home within no time at all.  Abdul is the most positive and friendly person who helped us with everything. He really made our trip special and was star of the show. I stayed here with two friends for a few nights and we decided to return at the end of our trip because we had such a lovely time here. Al the rooms were as good as each other and really comfortable.  The staff at Andalla arranged us taxis and recommended great places to eat and see. The views over the square are fantastic and when you go to your rooms there is no noise at all. This was a clean tidy and very friendly riad that we will definitely be returning to.

Review_Date: Hassan B wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: Besides the inherent advantage of being so close to the Jamaa Lfna Square Riad Andalla is is great place to be with clean rooms and a nice terrasse. The staff are so helpful and pleasant. The booking was painless and the replies are fast.    Rooms cannot be locked but belongings are safe.

Our stay here was lovely. The staff are very friendly and always cater to your needs. Abdi ( forgot his name ) was very helpful and always had a smile on his face he pays attention to the little details and is always enthusiastic about whatever you talk about. The Raid is beautiful from the inside and peaceful... the view from the rooftop of the square is amazing!. The fresh fruit provided at breakfast was nice ( watermelon ). The staff made you feel comfortable and Christophe was very informative and honest. Thank you for a lovely stay... We will be back soon in a few years ...memorable experience... ! See you soon..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Camille M wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: I must confess after following our friend through the main square in Marrakech and asking for directions then being led through narrow winding walkways I had my doubts about the cleanliness and upkeep of our restaurant. However as soon as we stepped through the door my reservations fell away. The place was beautiful with a fountain in the middle of the lobby and couches with cushions. While we filled out our customs report the guy who checked us in brought us Moroccan mint tea and cookies–despite it being Ramadan. Our rooms were along the sides of the building and there was an open area in the middle that opened up to the sky. The rooms themselves were delightful clean and cozy not to mention beautiful. There was a rooftop area with tables and chairs that looked out onto the market where we had our included (and delicious) breakfast. The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the area giving recommendations for outings and eateries. The place they recommended for dinner was phenomenal and they even called ahead for us and placed a recommendation. A delightful charming experience. Would repeat in a heartbeat.

Review_Date: Chris G wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: 3 nights in this "out of time" place right in the City Center;  Would quite recommend it ! Thanks to Sandrine & Jean Michel for their trustworthy advices to enjoy Marrakech !  All was perfect ): We'll come again

We stayed three night at this Riad and found it really nice. It's super close to the square and all the souks. It was also an easy walk to all the historical attractions we wanted to see. The staff was super helpful and always available for advice and directions. They were very helpful in setting up excursions etc. Christophe the owner was most gracious. We ate on the rooftop two nights and it was wonderful very reasonable and delicious. The breakfasts were very filling and there was way to much food. Overall I'd return here it was great.

Review_Date: sandra c wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Magic place special kindness and lovely RIad!  Good location in the center of Marrocco!!  the manager help to the customer a lot!  Thanks Cristhoper!  I want to go to this Riad in my next trip to Marrocco.....I hope it will be soon!

Perfect locationexcellent roomslovely roof terrace.  Christophe and all stafffantastic.Would reccomend to everyone.  Does not have free parking as booking.com states.But a taxi can get within 20 metres of the address.  Beer and wine available at good prices.  15 mins from airport taxi 100 mad

Review_Date: Saurabh K wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Really nice place quite close to the main square with a rooftop terrace.....perfect for morning breakfast or just to relax in the evening.  The place is pretty cosy and the staff is very friendly.  The owners are great and very helpful. Organised camel ride hammam appointments recommended food places and gave us a good Marrakech experience. Very responsive to any questions we had and were a good laugh to chat with.  Would definitely stay again.

Review_Date: Maciej G wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: I stayed with two other friends at the Riad Andalla for two nights recently and we had a great time everything was fantastic. Christophe and staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful.    The Riad itself along with the rooms were decorated tastefully and in a traditional Moroccan manner. Everything was clean wifi worked everywhere (including the rooftop terrace) and breakfast was delicious. The views from the roof were great and the terrace was a pleasant place to just sit read relax and pass the time.    Proximity to the main square was also a big plus just a minute or two away yet far enough to avoid the hussle and noise. Would highly recommend staying here.

My husband and I stayed here for our Moroccan trip. We were really amazed by this place. It was affordable so clean and the location was perfect only walking distance to the Jemaa el Fna souk and many restaurants. The breakfast was so yummy with freshly squeezed orange juice everyday. All the staff were very nice friendly and trustworthy. The owner Christophe was lovely. He helped us book our transports day trips and restaurants. He even considered his staff as his family. I highly recommend Riad Andalla. The best place for me to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marcus C wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Riad Andalla was a wonderful experience for us in Marrakech. As we arrived at the Riad we were kindly welcomed with a tray of freshly made Moroccan tea and a sit down with a staff member to tell us about the city things to do and answer any questions we had. Our room was absolutely amazing and beautiful. We were on the fourth floor the only room on this floor with a terrace which was practicaly ours. We spent hours on the roof enjoying the night breeze and sky on the couches. Breakfast served daily on the terrace whic overlooked the main square and Mosque. Absolulety beautiful view. One night we had a romantic dinner on the roof with delicious traditional moroccan cuisine and wine. Staff washed dirty laundry i had overnight at no charge. 100M from the main square food and shopping but completely cut off from the busy streets and sounds! Staff always had a smile and something to coversatr about. Thank you Riad Andalla for an amazing time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Still looking for the downside... Dont hesitate, go there!
Review_Text: My friends booked 2 rooms at the riad for my bachelor party.    We arrived very early with first flight from Paris. It really looked like the owner was waiting for us. Warm welcome a place to drop our luggage a few explanations on the house and hop direction the roof top for an unexpected breakfast.    The staff is great very helpful and friendly... Treat them well and you will feel like a king in the riad. They are really exceptional.    The rooms are cosy clean ( the ones at ground level slightly fresher yet all very comfortable and with effective air co so dont worry about the heat outside). We had booked 2 rooms but got a third one because there were tall guys in our group. That's the style of the house...    The restaurant is very very good (make sure to ask the veggie tagine and the morrocan salds). Actually the best food we had in the city. Make sure to book first thing in the morning as Abdel is going to the market fordinner in the morning and buys fresh products only in the right quantity (to ensure fresh products every day).    Did I mention already the terrass provides a unique view on the famous placej ama efna (sorry bad spelling)?    The owner will also provide good advice on what to do and see in the city and around.    Seriously I am usually pretty critical in my reviews but this one would get a 6 on 5 if it was possible.

Review_Date: Laurent T wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Amazing experience: Great Location, Great staff
Review_Text: We stayed with friends at Riad Andalla for a short stay at Marrakech and the experience was amazing! First the Riad is very well located in the heart of the Medina on the Jamaa el Fna place. It is a traditional Riad very typical but also very comfortable with an amazing terrasse with view on the main place.The staff is also perfect so welcoming and friendly. When we arrived at the Riad at 8.30 am we received an superb breakfast this was the best possible start.  It is also possible to have dinner at the riad I will recommend it as food was delicious!  I will surely come back to this place in the future highly recommended!

Review_Date: Hungate Cottages wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: A wonderful stay at Riad Andalla
Review_Text: We stayed here during our first (but not last) trip to Marrakech. Ahead of our visit everything was organised for us by Christophe and his wonderful staff. We were met at the airport and taken right to the riad. Dinner was ready for us on the roof-top terrace with a sensational view of the Jemaa El Fna.  Christophe later helped us arrange bus tickets and a taxi to Imlil. The staff could not have been better. We had two rooms during our stay - both spotlessly clean and welcoming.with en-suite aircon and wifi.  This is simply the perfect place to stay to sample the real Marrakesh. We cannot recommend the Riad Andalla highly enough. Thank you to all concerned.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing location and fun staff .. will visit again
Review_Text: It was amazing experience vising Marrakech and staying at Riad Andalla hotel; its located in the heart of Medina and one minute walking to the souq and activities.    The staff at Riad Andalla are knowledgeable and recommended good restaurants in the Souq with nice places to see .. they made it seem like home.    I would love to visit again .. to experience the souq and livliy Medina of Marrakech ..

I stayed at this riad for 2 nights at the beginning of my trip to Morocco. I was met at the airport and taken to the square and shown where the riad was located - literally a couple of minutes around the corner! The staff were amazing friendly and helpful. I particularly enjoyed the breakfast on the roof terrace from where you can see the Djemaa el Fna. If I'm back in Marrakech I'll definitely stay here again. Thanks Christophe! (The owner)

Review_Date: Jari S wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: This hotel is a real pearl in the heart of Marrakech. Friendly an funny stuff makes your stay easy and memorable. The hotel itself has some authentic personality and a perfect roofterrace with a sight to main square.

Really welcoming relaxed and very helpful.Rooms very authentic and breakfast on the rooftop was special.Location was perfect walking distance to the main areas. Quiet hotel so no problems sleeping. Will be visiting again

Stay here - it's great!    Firstly the location is fantastic - literally two minutes from the main square and yet it is calm and quiet.    Secondly the welcome is also fantastic - the two owners are great hosts and are on-hand to ensure everything runs smoothly and are generous in making suggestions as to how to enjoy your trip in Marrakech.    Do consider eating in the Riad - we had a lovely meal there with some excellent Moroccan wine.    The rooms are very well-furnished lots of space and everything is as it should be.

We have just returned from a ten-night stay at the lovely Riad Andalla in Marrakech. It is in a perfect location at the heart of the medina with beautiful views from the rooftop terrace across the square. The rooms are comfortable and clean they serve a lovely breakfast and provide free wifi. Christophe helped us with booking two excursions both were amazing experiences. All the staff make you feel special from the moment you arrive. We highly recommend this Riad for its authentic feel fabulous location and attention to detail.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our party of 12 had a fantastic time! Everything was perfect! A big thanks to Christhope and his staff. Christophe give us great information and suggestions to get the best from our 3 day break. We had lovely meals on his rooftop terrace overlooking the square. Look forward to our next visit. Would definately reccomend this lovely riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect for location & authentic Moroccan charm
Review_Text: Just returned home from a wonderful stay at Riad Andalla.  It's location couldn't be better as it is just a stones throw from the hectic square but far enough away to enjoy a peaceful stay.  It is has a tasteful and authentic charm and Christophe is the perfect knowledgeable host providing personal genuine recommendations for placed to visit & eat etc.  All of the staff are friendly and attentive and nothing is too much trouble.  Breakfast on the roof terrace really was one of the hi-lights of our trip.  Would definitely return.    I recommend the following:  Organising a taxi transfer on arrival as we would never have found the Riad on our own.  In hotter weather the rooms on the lower floors are naturally cooler.  Towels are provided but I'm glad I bought extra.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John G wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: My wife and I had two fabulous days at the Riad Andalla in Marrakech. Super-friendly welcome by Christophe the owner. Very clean and typically furnished rooms in Moroccan Riad style as is the entire Riad. The first night was in the new one on the other side of the tiny street. The second night in the original Riad. Both were truly perfect. Abundant breakfast on the roof (!) and a 2 minutes walk from the main square of the Medina and a step from all the little Medina roads to get to the Riad. Hard to find a better location. Highly recommended. Our son and daughter also stayed there. They loved it too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maria J wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: This was the perfect place to stay especially for first-timers like ourselves. Centrally located to restaurants and souks the Riad provided a perfect starting point for exploring the city. The welcoming and generous owner(s) and staff made it very easy to sit back relax and take up all the recommended sites and adventures available through the Riad. Breakfast was superb the riad itself was tastefully decorated and the people there were simply the best!

Review_Date: Marco R wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Great location all the characteristics of the typical Moroccan riad plus the perfect service. Everyone treats you at best giving advice about what to see where to go booking any trip or service. Summing up my experience at Riad Andalla: I felt at home!

I just had a 10 night stay at this lovely riad in Marrakech. It is in a perfect location in the heart of the medina with beautiful view from the rooftop terrace. The rooms are very adequate they serve a lovely breakfast and the wifi works very well. The owner Christophe helped me with booking excursions and many other recommendations. His staff especially Abdel and Younes make you feel like family the minute you arrive. They work hard to accomodate every request and need. I will always remember them and when I go back to Marrakech this is where I will stay again.

Review_Date: Anna A wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Lovely Riad with fantastic roof terrace
Review_Text: We arrived very late in the city and Christophe the owner had arranged for a taxi to pick us up. Upon getting here we did not have any local currency and Andre joint owner of the Riad gave us some local currency for our dinner and recommended a restaurant close by.    The next day Christophe talked us through how to stay safe on the streets and which areas to avoid at night. He also recommended various restaurants that we tried. Pepe Nero being the best!! Him and his lovely staff made us feel at home throughout our 7 day trip. We even enjoyed the roof terrace on the last day after we checked out.    Our room was the largest in the Riad with a good size bed. The room and the bath was very clean. The only downside of the room was that there was no window but we spent majority of our time on the roof overlooking the square. The breakfast was served promptly with fresh orange juice.    The location is great and 1 minute walk to the square and not far from the souks. We would stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simon B wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We had a fantastic time in Marrakech this Riad was clean friendly and close to the square. Christophe your staff are a credit to you Abdul thank you for your help with directions bookings and where to shop. Thank you Christophe for arranging your driver to take us safely and in comfort an excellent journey up and over the Atlas Mountains to Ait Ben Hiddou and beyond. Breakfast was prompt fresh and nothing seemed too much trouble lovely sat on the terrace looking out across Marrakech the view across the square at night from the terrace is amazing. You are so close to the square you can hear the hassle and bustle to the early hours. I will happily recommend this Riad to all and will stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fabiana K wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: In February 2015 we took a 4 days vacation at Marrakech. It was our second time in family. We really enjoyed ourselves at Riad Andalla. The location is perfect: close to the Jemaa el- Fna Square and the souks. The service is also great: we feel at home. But the comments from other guests are more important and they are true: André Christophe and all the staff are very kind and helpful.
Reviewer_Location: Sao Jose Do Rio Preto, SP

Review_Date: Suzanne P wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: A wonderful 4day break. All the arrangements pick up from airport trip to Ourika valley restaurant bookings directions to local attractions all ran smoothly thanks to the wonderful Christophe! A host with the most charming and courteous manner. This was also true of all staff who made our trip one of the best. Our triple room was delightful decorated in Moroccan style with an en-suite . The roof top terrace was wonderful allowing us to breakfast as the Jamma el Fna came to life and dine to the drums snake charmers and vibrancy of the square at night. Visitors would just need to be aware that the morning call to prayer takes a little getting use to and the stairs are quite steep but with suitable hand rails. Stepping in from the street really is entering an oasis of charm.  We would have no hesitation in recommending Riad Andalla to friends.

Riad Andalla is ideally located next to the Jamaa el Fna but is always quiet despite its close proximity to the square. It is beautifully decorated and looks distinctly more Moroccan than some other Riads. The rooms are great and breakfast was always delicious but what makes this Riad particularly special was the staff. Cristophe was so helpful helping us book a three day trip to the desert as well as a trip to Essaouira including booking a great hotel there for us. Nothing was too much trouble and he even took us to the coach ticket office because he thought it was quite hard to find. Having stayed in two other very nice riads in Marrakech I still feel that this is the best. If coming back to Marrakech wouldn't stay anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Situated on the edge of Jamaa el Fna Riad Andalla is ideal if you enjoy being amongst the hussle and bussle of the market  souks and street life. The rooms are very comfortable and decorated in traditional Moroccan style with super king size beds and en suite bathrooms however what makes this place really stand out is the incredible staff all of whom speak French English and Arabic. Christophe is a super star host and will take the time to explain the high lights of Marrakech how to negotiate the market sellers and do's and don't of Moroccan culture. The staff are more than happy to make bookings and organise trips and take care of tipping porters and drivers on your behalf (included in the price). Christophe and his family truly enjoy their jobs and shine as "people persons" who enjoy helping and socialising with their guests. All have a great sense of humour too and it was very reassuring to have someone so happy to go to for advice or help when surrounded by a completely foreign culture.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would like to say thank you to Cristophe and his staff for making us so welcome. We stayed for 4 nights and were made to feel very much at home. From the guys serving and preparing our food to the girls who tidied the rooms we could not fault a thing. We were celebrating my sister's 60th birthday and she had the best time with advice from Cristophe this helped us immensely. The Riad is only a couple of minutes from the square - no chance of getting lost! The terrace has a lovely view over the square one way and the other to the snowy Atlas mountains. There is a great atmosphere on the terrace you can hear the music and drums from the square but once in your room it is quiet and peaceful - except when there is a call to prayer - but you soon get used to that. Air con was a great help. And bed was comfortable. Wi-Fi everywhere in the Riad - unbelievable! We ate here a couple of nights - food was excellent - love the crockery!  We would thoroughly recommend this Riad - try not to be temped to stay outside in one of the grander hotels - we tried and were bitterly disappointed!  One thing I would say is that if you take the trip to Ourika valley - be prepared for a climbing expedition! wear sensible shoes and make sure you are reasonably fit - it was hard work - but worth it for the views and the sense of achievement!

Review_Date: Rosa F wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Nice Riad made perfect by staff
Review_Text: The location is absolutely perfect. A minute away from the square. The staff is amazing. We were travelling with our one-year-old son and they were all super kind with him and really helpful with us and everything we might need. We booked the airport transfer with them and they sent a car with a chair for the baby even though I had forgotten to ask for one. They also had a high chair and a crib for him. Breakfast was always nice (the bread was delicious) we had dinner twice at the Riad and it was also pretty good although you can find a few cheaper places really close at the square (Christophe will recommend you a few).  As a downside They should invest in bigger better towels. We had only three sometimes four middle sized towels for two adults and a baby. Also the crib needs a better mattress. The one it had was super thin and uncomfortable. I used the blankets they gave us (didn't need them in this time of the year) and folded them to put them under the sheets and the baby turned out to sleep pretty comfortably.  All in all it was a good stay made perfect by the quality of all the people working there.

We stayed here for 4 nights and everything was perfect. Christophe and the rest of the team could not have been more helpful and the Riad is in an excellent location with fabulous views of the mountains and the square from the roof top where breakfast and dinner is served. Christophe organised our transfers for us and is great at drawing maps to get you to where you want to be! He also arranged a fabulous Hammam at Les Bains de Marrakech. The Riad is comfortable clean and all of the staff were friendly. Other things to recommend are a day trip to the Atlas mountains and Café de L'Arabe!

Review_Date: Julio C wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: First let me say I was traveling with my two girls (16&22) and this was our last stop after three other Riads desert stays and nearly 2500kms of driving. Never did we feel unsafe or more welcomed then in all of Morocco and for sure Riad Andalla. It was in Marakesh that we finally understood the term "welcome". In the west we use the term in response to thank you. We finally understand that in Morocco this has a second and primary meaning of welcoming you to try and to experience Moroccan hospitality. This was for certain the case with Marakesh and Riad Andalla.    Christophe the owner and his "family" staff were spectacular.    This is a lovely Riad with terraces overlooking the main market and souks and with the Atlas Mountains as a backdrop for morning breakfast. It does not get better.    Each day's breakfast was better than the last and left you wanting for nothing to start your day walking through the thousands of shops and artisan manufacturers.    Christophe provided great recommendations for places to venture with personal guidance for restaurants and spas and even took this guy direct to the spa on the back of his moped when he realized I may be late. No one can beat this type of service.    The rest of the staff were very accommodating and always friendly.    Let me suggest little tips to make your journey easier.    First if you are driving yourself as we did you cannot drive up to the Riad. Don't even try. The best parking and completely safe is the 24 / 24 parking associated with the Koutoubia mosque in the medina. Look for the blue P parking sign that also says 24/24. Once parked walk through the mosque gardens through the main gate into the medina main square then follow Christophe's email instruction to the Riad. It's very simple with one notable exception. What many people in the west would call an alley or laneway are called streets. So keep Cafe France on your right then right at the first street alley right again right again right again and a left to the end.    Second tip. In the medina area and shops walk with a sense of direction even if your lost which is just part of the experience and learn to be firmer than usual about "No thank you". It's completely safe and to the point where my daughters went shopping on their own but you have to be firm about where you are going and when you don't want help or about buy anything. It's really that simple. Be firm but pleasant and most times some form of joke is the worst you'll get in response. Oh and download triposo or streets from tripadvisor. Big time works inside the markets all over Morocco.    This Riad was fun perfectly located and would repeat it in a heart beat if we went back to Marakesh. Enjoy. Julio from Toronto Canada.

Review_Date: Henry B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Excellent hospitality! If you want to know where to get the best Moroccan spices where to go for a traditional Moroccan Hammam or how to make best an investment in Marrakech or what are the prices of … Just ask Christophe. He knows everything a tourist may ask or is looking for in this beautiful chaos of Medina the old city of Marrakech. We enjoyed our stay in this pleasant Riad with its comfortable breakfast at the roof terrace and the nice views from there over the surrounding roofs and the nearby place Jemaa El Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here in jan 2015. What a wonderful calm oasis. Nestled in the back streets off the main market square this riad is homely and stylish. Christophe is a wonderful and entertaining And very charismatic host. Thoroughly enjoyed out stay it was hard to believe how quiet it was but only a few meters away from the busy square. The roof top terrace provides wonderful views of the mountains and the square and is a wonderful place to relax on an afternoon we went in January so had it to ourselves in an afternoon and evening. It's chilly at night in jan so we were able to use the fleeces to keep warm. Have great memories on a wonderful time ranging from the sights and smells of the markets to the calm fragrant stylish riad. Fabulous wouldn't have changed a thing

Review_Date: James F wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Really Friendly and helpful staff in excellent location
Review_Text: Close t the main square of jemaa el fna. Great views of square and Atlas Mountains from the terrace. The staff couldn't have been more helpful . The breakfast is good and plenty of it. We also had dinner here on one evening and food was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel has friendly personnel and very good position in old city. From there you can walk to old city. We got information about what to see and where to eat from hotel owner. Hotel is built in oriental style and this was for me coming from Europe a very interesting experience. Would visit again. Highly recommend.

Review_Date: Elena L wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: I recently stayed at the Riad Andalla with a friend and we had the most amazing time.  This was not my first time and for sure it will not be my last .  The location is perfect just few steps away from Jeema El Fna square the Riad is not too much into the Medina and therefore there is no risk to get lost.  The roof terrace will leave you speechless at any time of the day; but during the evening is almost surreal.  Christophe and the rest of the Andalla's family are amazing. They bring happiness to the place and they are always ready to help.  Highly recommended.

Riad Andalla is an oasis in the middle of Jemaa el-Fnaa. Super friendly staff impossibly large and nice breakfast great roof terrace cozy interiors and a very cool Owner. Totally recommended!! Christoff and the Riads personnel will help you make your stay in Marrakesch a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would definitely recommend this riad to anyone going to Marrakech.  The location is great! It's only a few minutes walk from Jeema El Fna. Guests can see the square from the roof terrace. But don't worry about the noise - inside the riad it is quiet.  Christophe and the other members of staff are all very friendly and we felt at home right away.  Nice breakfast and clean rooms.  /Anna and Niklas Sweden
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rebecca J wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Just the best place and hosts we had an amazing few days here couldn't ask for more!! all the help and advice of where to go and see the souks only moments away loved sitting in square watching the organised chaos take place    thank you to all at Riad Andalla highly recommend

Review_Title: Amazing place, maroccan experience par excellence!
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is located just behind the vibrant square Jeema El Fna in the Medina but very easy to find once you have been shown the route however I strongly advice to ask the owner of the Riad Christophe to organise transport from and to the airport their drivers are very reliable and I doubt we would have found the entrance on our own.  Although the Riad is adjacent to the busy square once inside the door it becomes a oasis of calm and relaxation. The tastefully decorated interiors and the characteristic layout of the Riad gave us that authenticity feel we were looking for. We undoubtedly felt we were in Marrakech. Breakfast is served on the fabulous terrace which look over the Square and from where you can admire the snowcapped atlas peaks Breakfast is a delicious mix of speciality breads and pancakes served with Jams fresh fruits and yogourts. What really made our stay special was the staff. All of the staff lead by Christophe made us feel at home. They remembered our names what we liked and adviced us accordingly. Service was flawless. Can t recommend this Riad enough if you want quality service and a real feel of Marrakech life.

Having chosen Riad Andalla after reading its reviews on tripadvisor I wasn't disappointed.  First of all the map provided on riad's website helped us to find it without any problems.  The riad is very conveniently situated close to Jemaa el Fna it was safe to come back to it in the evening.  The interior is cosy and beautifully decorated with the ambiance of a typical moroccan house. Clean bright and fresh everywhere.The roof terrace is definitely a strong point of this riad - large comfortable seats and amazing views 24h a day.  Christophe made us feel welcomed and provided us with a map of the city some advice and recommendations for local reastaurants which turned out to be very nice.  We would definitely go back to this riad. And as we tried some other places in Marrakech I know this riad is a good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kjell A wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights from 18/2-21/2. Superb service very nice Riad  good breakfast and calm. Just 2 minutes walk away from jamaa el fna:).  Christophecis a brilliant host who is very good in getting the guests to feel good:). The same to the rest of the staff:)))

Review_Date: Emmanuel P wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: The welcome heating in the bedrooms if needed the terrace for breakfast with views of Marrakech and Jemaa el Fna place good advices and assistance of Christopher the central location of the Riad in the Medina.

Review_Date: Cristina C wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We spent two nights here. Perfect location high quality on the room (with heating good to know if you travel in winter). Perfect and plenty of delicious Moroccan breakfast on the roof terrace.  Christophe recommend us the perfect place to have lunch and he was right. He and the staff was really helpful. Thanks a million for your kindness.  See you soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Christophe and his amazing staff make for a great stay in Marrakech! Nothing is ever a problem and the team go above and beyond to make your stay in Marrakech an enjoyable one!    Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Review_Date: Tekisha A wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: Best places to stay in Marrekech!
Review_Text: I loved this place! The location was perfect. It's in a central location. You're in the middle of everything. The people that worked at this Riad were awesome. Very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious as well. I would recommend this Riad to anyone looking for the perfect place to stay while visiting Marrekech.

If you stay in Marrakech you must stay in a Riad in the centre and you will find no better than Riad Andalla. The location is perfect and the view of Jemma el fna square from the roof terrace is exquisite. What stands out however and makes this place so wonderful is the owners and the staff. From the moment you arrive you feel like you are visiting friends who will do anything to make your visit special.  Thanks Christophe Andre and all the staff. I have a feeling we will be back.

Being an avid globetrotter I have visited well over 50 countries and stayed in a plethora of hotels hostels and guesthouses. Riad Andalla would unquestionably feature in the top 3 places I have stayed it. Words cannot truly describe the unforgettable experience we had at the Riad!  We were picked up promptly from the airport and taken to the Riad. We were given an extremely warm welcome at the door by Younnes who took our luggage and offered refreshments. He advised that Cristophe would be with us shortly to go through with the finer details of things.  Cristophe arrived in due course and advised us we had booked the cheapest room in the Riad however as the Riad was fairly quite he would upgrade us to a larger room at no extra charge. He then sat down with us and advised on a schedule of activities.  Cristophe along with Younnes are the best of hosts. Both have a uniquely innate ability of making you feel welcomed and at home. They are always available and on hand to help and any request is never too big for them. We were given significant advice on every aspect of our itinerary from places to visit to how much taxi fares should cost. Between them they must have spent 3-4 hours going over travel plans with us.  We arrived in the evening and wanted to go straight out. As we had no dirhams Cristophe gave us 400dhs to spend which we could then give back once we had exchanged our money. He told us which place would give us the best exchange rate. This kind of hospitality you don’t find in any other place. Normally the hotel exchange your money at a poor rate!  The Riad itself has a homely feel to it. The ladies Atika and co are always happy to help and have a smile regardless of the time of day. At night Younnes is the main man. He makes sure everyone is in at night and is always up for a little banter.  The hotel is perfectly placed and is literally a stone’s throw from Djemaa-el-Fna. From the roof terrace you have a clear view of the square the Koutoubia mosque and a beautiful backdrop displaying the snow-topped Atlas Mountains. Wifi is free and is available throughout the Riad with good connectivity speeds.  I will definitely be returning to this place again in the future! I cannot recommend the Riad and the staff highly enough. A big thanks to Cristophe Younnes Andre and the rest of the Andalla family for a refreshing and unforgettable stay.

Review_Title: A great finish to our trip!
Review_Text: From Christophe and Andre to Younis and the girls this place is phenomenal!    We were spending our last night much closer to the Medinah in Riad Andalla. Greeted instantly by the two owners Christophe and Andre we instantly felt at home. We were sent up to the roof to enjoy some mint tea (the best I had in Morocco) on the roof and instructed that Christophe would be up to explain a bit about the area.  What a gentleman Christophe explained everything from how much things should and shouldn't cost how much to pay for taxi rides so we weren't ripped off and other vitally useful info such as where to eat.  The room was fantastic very traditional with all of the collars you would expect to see in Morocco. Very safe very friendly atmosphere and the staff couldn't do enough for you!  At night Younis comes to the Riad. The key guy when Christophe and Andre aren't around Younis will stay awake at night until everyone is back into the road as he has to answer the door he then is up to serve you a brilliant breakfast!  One night isn't really enough and we are already planning our next trip to see the guys!  A real nice touch is Christophe and Andre ask you to send a photo to them so they can put it up on their wall in the office. They really appreciate everyone who stays and to them it really is about welcoming people into their home.  They do it all brilliantly! 10/10
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A perfect location from which to enjoy Jemma el Fnah and explore the souks and greater Marrakech. A roof terrace that provides fantastic views and a spot to soak up the night atmosphere a wonderful setting for breakfast or just lazing to recoup after a day's exploring..  Christophe could not have been more helpful in his determination in providing information so we could get the most out of our stay.  I would certainly return and do recommend this Riad without hesitation.

My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights on our 2nd trip to Marrakech. The riad was comfortable and clean and Christophe and his staff could not have been more helpful. We felt safe and secure and would definitely recommend this riad. It is very close to Jemaa El Fna square and the souks and Christophe will arrange a taxi from and back to the airport for you which is well worth doing. Breakfast was basic but substantial and we had an evening meal one night that was delicious. Thank you Christophe Younes and the girls for making our stay so special.

Review_Date: Jesus L wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Enjoy the magic of Marrakesh and feel like home in Riad Andalla
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is in such a perfect place to feel the real and original atmosphere of this wonderful and special city. It's only a two-minute walk to be in heart of everything.Just behind Cafe de France one of the most popular and emblematic places in Jemaa el Fna.  The hospitality given by Christofe and his staff is nice and kind. They are very helpful in whatever you need. The place is tidy nice and pretty. When you get there after having been walking at any time of the day in the souk noisy narrow and crowded alleys full of smells tastes and colors which make your senses work and enjy everything you get to Riad Andalla and feel relaxed and well. I sincerely recommend this place if you go to Marrakesh.  Jesús Celia and Marta. January 2015

Superb riad with warm welcome from Christophe and Younes. Rooms are very nicely decorated and comfortable.  Breakfast is very nice on the terrasse with a view on the Atlas mountains and the Jemaa el Fna square.  Although extremely close to square Jemaa el Fna the place is very quiet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Cosy riad with the best location in Marrakesh
Review_Text: The riad is very cosy with good atmosphere. The people there are like one big family. The location couldn’t be better and the terrace on the roof is amazing. Cristopher is very charismatic nice and funny. He knows the city very well and can suggest good places to eat buy stuff etc. We really enjoyed our stay in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Nice riad good facilities and a lovely roof terrace. The staff were very friendly and helpful for all of our requests. The location is brilliant as well only a couple of minutes walk from the main square where everything in Marrakech is.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: There is no other place in town with such a great atmosphere
Review_Text: You can rely on all the previous positive comments about this place: Riad Andalla is truly like a private home warm welcoming and charming. Christopher is a great hosts who tries to share like a friend his love for this city and his experiences about this country. Follow all his suggestions and you will discover nice city views and you will eat great local food. The location is unbeatable just on top of the main square where everything goes on from sunrise until midnight. You can spend hours on their terraces looking at the square life and contemplating the city roofs the Koutoubia the Atlas mountains and the panorama. Every hour is different. The riad is very well furnished pleasantly warm in winter (not all riads are well heated) and with several comfortable corners tables couches and nice details.  I stayed 3 nights in Suite Bachahamou and 1 night in room Kamar and I found them bigger than in pictures. You can find more luxurious riads in town but no one will give the same atmosphere and for sure will not offer the same terrace city view.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was my first time in Marrakesh and I have been astonished by the spectacular colors the sounds the tastes and the great atmosphere of the town. The Riad Andalla is a jewel in a jewel an intimate hideaway right in the heart of the town. The terrace offerers a terrific view of the town and the Jemaa el Fna. It is a perfect spot for morning breakfasts or lazy afternoons over Marrakesh roofs. The rest of the house has a great and romantic atmosphere with its colored and warm rooms has been definitely our moroccan home. Last (but not least) the owner is a perfect host. Always enthusiastic and friendly (as his gentle staff) helped us with tips recommendations and reservations for hammams and restaurants. We also enjoyed a real home-made moroccan dinner (upon request). Amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mei Z wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: A hidden perl in the Medina to relax and explore
Review_Text: An authentic Riad in the heart of the Medina with warmhearted owner and staff. Helpful and honest are they and you can always count on them. Efficiency is another house specialty they offer - let alone the delicious food. Clean room and tasty breakfast on the sunny terrace brighten your day.I can't think of any better way to spend time in Marrakech! Highly recommended!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ursula P wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Feeling at home in this beautyful Riad
Review_Text: After so often been in a Marrakech Riad Andalla is surely the most homely and cosy one. Situated so near to the Djemma el Fna with the phantastic view from the wonderful roof terras where we could enjoy every day a perfect breakfast this Riad and its rooms full of marrocain atmosphere  let you immediately feel at home.The house is wonderful and it lives from his owner Christophe and his perfect team who gave us from the first moment a feeling of warm welcome. Christophe is the best host you can whish and gives helpful advice for enjoying Marrakech on the best way. His team is so friendly and helpful. There is nothing you will miss. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner acompanied by Christophe and his team the last day of 2014 with the best homemade couscous I ever had.  Christophe go on the way you do and every guest of Andalla Riad will surely come back the next stay in Marrakech like I can promise from myself too.  Christophe please keep on running your Riad this way and every guest will surely come back the next time he visits Marrakech.

just one block from the square this Riad is an excellent choice to stay.    The booking and questiones asked where answered fast and really helped. A taxi was arranged to pick us up in the airport as requested.    The welcome was perfect including mint tea Christoph can not be a better host apart from his friendly attitude he gave us the best recomendations to visit eat and hammam.    The Riad is really nice authentic super clean and the staff really nice.    The rooms are a ok nice decoration enough for resting although a door in the bathroom instead of a courtain would have been nice...but it is Morroco style.    The terrace is beautifull and having breakfast every morning there is a great way of starting the day. some tea in the afternoon is really nice to to watch the mountains and the fna.    The breakfast really good too.    I would definitly go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alex E wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay at the beautiful Riad Andalla. Christophe is a fantastic host and a mine of useful information. The breakfasts were plentiful and delicious and the service was lovely. An excellent place to stay.

Review_Title: Couldn't be more to indulge in the madness of Marrakec
Review_Text: So sorry this review is so late but I just got my TA legs.  Stayed here May last year and what a great time it was. RAID was intimate but not over bearing. Christophe n Co were great attentive but not overly so. Riad is a spit from main throw. Lots around. Great little roof terrace for mint tea or wine. Christophe you were helpful and friendly to me and Kev. Sorry for late posting. We will be back to the Andalla for sure.

Review_Title: Nice place in the center of Marrakech
Review_Text: This nice comfortable riad is in the heart of Marrakech. Overlooking the Djemma-al-Fna square and the Koutoubia Mosque situated between the souks to the north and the palaces to the south this is a great choice. Christophe and his friendly team are there to help whenever needed and provide a great breakfast full of Moroccan breads fruit and orange juice- served overlooking the square on the terrace. The riad itself is beautiful inside with lovely decorations and many places to relax comfortably both inside and outside on the lovely terrace. Rooms are on the small side but beds are comfortable and anyway you have the run of the riad so you have plenty of space. A highly recommended spot.

Review_Title: Really nice riad, helmed by the very capable Christophe
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is a very value-for-money kind of accomodation in Marrakech. Rooms were rather small and there was no TV but then again who needs a huge room and TV anyway if you're meant to go out and experience what Marrakech has to offer?  The riad is near the market square breakfast at the top floor was amazing and the manager Christophe is a very good host who can recommend and tailor an itinerary for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the first second you feel at home in Riad Andalla with Christophe and his "family". The whole team is really friendly and helpful and always cheerful. It was a pleasure. Riad Andalla is located perfect in Marrakech. Close but not to close to Djemaa el Fna with a fantastic view to this amazing place. Christophe gave us lot's of information what to do in Marrakech this was very helpful. Breakfest is also good. If we were visiting Marrakech again one day it will be Riad Andalla. Thank's to Christoph and his little family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Piotr I wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is a very special place. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel exceptionally welcome with a lots of advice and information about things to do in Marrakech and how to get around. The staff were polite helpful and available at all times nothing was too much trouble. They took the time to answer questions and make suggestions where appropriate.  The hotel has a beautiful terrace which is a welcome retreat from the madness of the Djemaa El-Fna  We stayed in the most basic room which was small but clean. The breakfast was pleniful and amazing we didn't go hungry.  We were lucky enough to spend 2 nights in this amazing riad - it made our holiday so incredibly memorable and special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard A wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Had a wonderful three night stay at this beautiful Riad in an excellent location overlooking Jemaa Fna from the roof terrace. Chistophe the owner was very informative and helpful and ensured any transport we needed was organised and on time. A lovely presented Riad in typical Moroccan style. Excellent accommodation and somewhere I would return to.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Riad Andalla is a little gem in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Located close (but not too close) to the main square it is easy to find and comfortable with very charming staff who go out of their way to help you with recommendations and bookings. Don’t expect super luxury but for a homely and welcoming place to come back to after the chaos of Marrakech this place is perfect!

Review_Title: Amazing riad, excellent location, brilliant staff
Review_Text: When looking for a riad in marrakech you are spoilt for choice. The most important criteria is location charm and a friendly atmosphere. Riad Andalla has it all. We stayed for 3 nights and it was such a pleasure. Every time you step inside you get a warm greeting from Christophe or one of his staff the place is clean colourful safe with an awesome rooftop deck overlooking the Djemaa El Fna and the location rivals any riad in the medina. Nothing was too much trouble for Christophe who phoned around to make hamman and restaurant bookings to satisfy 4 demanding women and a Luuuuuucky man! Thank you for everything and we will definitely be back.

Review_Title: Best place to be close to the action
Review_Text: I spent 5 nights at this excellent Riad after some other places left me always somewhat discontent. Of course the main point is the incredible location: From the roof terrace you have a bird´s eye view on Djemaa-el-Fna the Medina and the snow-capped High Atlas. Other people have to queue up in order to get a seat at some of the (mostly mediocre) restaurants facing the square - here you can have it anytime you like. Dinner at Riad Andalla is home-cooked by the invariably friendly staff you pay a bit more than at the tourist restaurants but the quality is beyond compare. We had a sumptuous vegetarian couscous (yummie...). Christophe and Andre are very helpful for all sorts of questions and tips. The rooms are bit smallish (like in other Riads it´s a historic building after all) but very good value for the price. So next time there is no need to lokk around for us anymore...

Review_Date: Mike K wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Having stayed in Marrakech before and fallen in love with the city as a couple we were keen to introduce our parents and my daughter to the delights of the city. We wanted to stay in the Medina in a traditional house and the Riad Andalla proved to be the perfect place. We booked based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews we had read on Tripadviser. Seven of us arrived at the door of the Riad Andalla and we were treated as honoured guests from the moment entered the courtyard. Christophe told us that we were to treat the riad as if we were staying in his home and the whole atmosphere created by Christophe Andre and his friendly team made us feel like we "part of the family".    The rooms are compact but beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The beds are comfortable and having air conditioning was a boon given the heat we encountered. The roof terrace is comfortable and stylishly furnished and offered fantastic views of the Jemaa El Fna square. Watching sunset behind the Koutoubia Mosque was a particular highlight.    Breakfast is traditional and delicious and the dinner we ate on the roof on our final night at Riad Andalla was exquisite.    We are already looking for our next opportunity to take up Chrstophe's offer to come back to Marrakech and we would not consider anywhere other than the Riad Andalla.

Review_Date: Catherine S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is THE place to stay in Marrackech. Close proximity to the Souks and Jemaa el-Fnaa facillitates an amazing cultural experience. Christophe Andre and the staff have created the perfect accommodation encounter. Each room is unique comfortable and self-contained. The terrace is an oasis ideal for soaking up the sun or watching the awakening face of the city over breakfast. Nothing is too much for Christophe whether it be advice on the best place to have a henna tattoo the best exchange rate how to get to a particular attraction or arranging a farewell dinner on the terrace. The breakfast at Riad Andalla was amazing.....as was the farewell dinner. I can't wait to go back to Marrakech and stay at Riad Andalla again. Thank you to Chrisophe Andre and staff for creating a memorable first experience of Morroco.

Review_Title: Gem in the middle of the Medina
Review_Text: Keep coming back to this place for the warm welcome from the managers and staff great location as within 5 mns walking distance from Djemaa Al fnaa but yet very quiet .  Super clean and great breakfast !  Very good quality for the price would strongly recommand!    Anne( London UK)

Review_Date: James C wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: best hotel for jmaa el fna
Review_Text: Stayed for the second time at Riad Andalla and won't be the last. The Riad Andalla is not to be faulted.Pleasant comfortablevery friendly atmosphere. The management is excellent.Very goodt breakfast.

Really good location for the main square. Everyone was very helpful and friendly and the terrace was perfect for relaxing on with a book. Even though it's almost on the main square it's very quiet and I did not get woken up at 5:30 by the call to prayer! Only comment would be that if there had been three of us in our room it could have been a bit snug but definitely recommend.

Picked Andalla because of reviews and was not dissapointed. From the booking process airport transfer and dinner on arrival it couldn't have got off to a better start. First morning after breakfast Christophe spend an half hour with us giving us very useful advice. All staff were equally friendly and helpful. Location is brilliant overlooking the madness of the Medina yet perfectly quiet. I now see why people keep returning here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Christophe is a guy who enjoys good food and relaxing in Spa's. This makes him an exceptional host who can recommend all manner of places in and around the city and has great links with the owners. We had an amazing cake arrive at pepe nero to surprise the GF for her birthday thanks to his quiet word with the owner!    The Riad itself is in an excellent location I recommend the airport transfer for peace of mind as although the Riad 2 mins from the main square in the medina like most of marrakech you need to wind down a couple of side streets to get to it so the first time it would be tricky to find on foot.    Everything else was great comfortable bed clean rooms aircon wifi + large breakfast each day.    If you are looking for a few days to hit up the sites and souks this is perfect.    Thanks Matt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: sarah k wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Just back from 1 week in this wonderful Riad right in the heart of the Jemaa el Fna. Everything about this Riad was perfect from the owner Christophe who was so helpful and friendlyall the staff who never stopped smiling and always willing to help the rooms amazingly quaint and spotlessly clean the rooftop terrasse ideal for an evening meal/drink while taking in the atmosphere from the square.The location only a few minutes walk from the main square .. a perfect base for all your adventures. It really felt like a home away from home and will definitely be returning. So for us its the only place to stay when in Marrekesh.. thank you Christophe and all your staff
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: She S wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: The room was very clean. Extremely low noise level great overall experience. Good breakfast and the staff is great. Close to everything especially from the famous place Jamah el Fnah. When I go back to Marrakech again this will be my place to stay.

Review_Date: john A wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Guarantee you will love this place!
Review_Text: Cannot think of a better place to explore Marrakech. Location is perfect you can see the square and hear the beating of the drums from the rooftop terrace. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful but also allow you privacy. We felt right at home here. The breakfast which is included is served to you on the rooftop and it is delightful. The rooms are big enough and comfortable and very clean and air conditioned. The owner sat down with us for 45 minutes giving us tips upon our arrival. The staff is always ready to help or simply ask how your day was and they really seem to care! They also arranged outings for us and restaurant reservations. I simply cannot recommend them enough they are outstanding in every way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The only choice when staying in Marrakech
Review_Text: I would very strongly recommend Riad Andalla when staying in Marrakech. Christophe our host is delightful as is the entire staff. Our room was beautiful only surpassed by the incredible rooftop terrace. The riad is a very welcome respite from sometimes chaotic Marrakech. Kick back and relax with a glass of wine and look on to Place Jemaa El-Fna. On a side note there was some scheduling snafus through no fault of the riad which Christophe went above and beyond the call of duty to resolve.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lauren S wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Lovely place to stay Christophe was very welcoming and made us feel at home. He also gave us a lot of helpful information on places to visit and where to eat.  It is beautifully decorated with an excellent terrace overlooking the main square which was great to sit and relax at night. The room was very quiet considering how close to the main square the riad is located. Also has air conditioning which is great when it's hot WIFI available in the rooms and on the terrace.  Christophe also arranged a taxi from the airport when we arrived which was great as we arrived late.  A big thank you to all the staff who were all very friendly and helpful I would highly recommend this riad and if we ever return to Marrakech we will definitely stay here again.

If you are looking for a gorgeous comfortable riad look no further this is it!! amazing views great people especially Christophe who made us feel welcome (even if I don't speak French :) Riad overlooks the main square which is fascinating to see from above the terrace is perfect for chilling relaxing and enjoying a bottle of wine. We stayed in Bachahamou which is traditionally decorated and best of all we didn't hear a thing at night :) Loved it don't hesitate to book here you won't be disappointed.

Review_Date: Giulia T wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: The perfect place to stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: This a beautiful riad I loved the decor in the reception area and in the room everything was so elegant but the atmosphere is relaxed and informal. The terrace is wonderful you can have your (delicious) breakfast while looking at the main square. We arrived in Marrakesh by train and took the bus to the square the riad is not so difficult to find if you look at their website! But probably the best part of the stay were the owners Andre and Cristophe who gave us lots of useful info about what to visit in the city. We only spent a day and half in Marrakesh and their advices helped us make the most of it! I would recommend this accommodation to everybody!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: C Y wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Everything was perfect. Christophe and Andre really looked after us and advised us where to eat and visit food wine and room was great. Very friendly atmosphere and for 2 women we felt very safe we will be back!

Review_Date: Lenka O wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Amazing place and surprisingly quiet nice staff :-) You can taste real Morroco there.  But it was very difficult to find it carefully check the map.  I am not sure if WiFi is in rooms or only in "lobby" and at terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David E wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: A little gem in the Medina
Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad on the recommendation of friends and must say we are glad we did. It's location is ideal for a true feel of Marrakech being situated at the heart of the Medina. Christophe was a fantastic host as were all the staff who made us feel at home and offered some great recommendations of what to visit and places to eat. We also took advantage of having dinner on the roof top terrace which I would highly recommend.

Very nice Riad. Great service nice people and a very good location. Christophe and Andre are very nice and make you feel at home with their cheerful attitude and hospitality. When i come back to Marrakach i will definitly book this Riad.

Review_Date: Mike and Katy A wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: We stayed 5 nights in the riad and wish we could have stayed longer. Christophe and everyone else at the riad made it feel like home. We were impressed with how helpful everyone was and the great recommendations we got. It made the trip so much more enjoyable knowing that we were well looked after. The terrace views overlooking the Djeema El Fna are particularly wonderful and the decor is great. We will definitely come back in the future and force our family to stay here as well. What more could you ask for out of a place?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a hectic start and by the time we arrived we were tired grumpy and hungry. Christophe's cheerful attitude immediately soothed us. He got us settled with the help of his partner Abdul. He directed us towards a good place to eat and gave us the low down of Marrakech where to go and what not to do. The hotel is charming and so interesting to discover the decoration and rooftop terrace overlooking the main square. Even though we are so close to all the action we always had a peaceful nights sleep. Everything was clean and again so uniquely decorated that you must stay in a place like this while in Morocco. Christophe and Abdul were helpful in all our arrangements and I would definitely stay here again as it is perfect and convenient for Marrakech touring. Breakfast is typical for Morocco which is French style. Just pastry and cafe/teajuice. It was this was in all the places we stayed. You would need to ask if you want some fruit.  They also have air conditioning which you will be glad for in the Summer.

Review_Title: Excellent location and super helpful staff
Review_Text: Very nice Riad super service and hospitality. We have everything we need. Super location near the main square (but no noise in the rooms) nice roof terrace with view to main square. Really nice interior of all Riad and rooms even fresh roses in the lobby and rooms. Christophe was very helpful to give us suggestions what to visit in Marrakesh and where to eat better. We can recommend this Riad to everyone who want to stay in Marrakesh Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Larissa S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We had a wonderfull time in the Riad Andalla. Christophe the hotel owner was very kind sincere and had the best tips for two young blonde ladies who went exploring Marrakech. The location of the hotel is perfect. You look out over the famous square on a roof terrace where you can truly unwind. Finally the hotel really has the look and feel of Marocco. Small rooms but very cute.

Review_Date: Shirley Z wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: It was such a delightful stay in this Riad for my family of 5. This is my family (from US) first trip to Africa and we stayed in 9 different Riad/hotel during our 15 day trip. This Riad definitely rose to the top for its superior service and hospitality. When we first arrived Christophe left a note/map for us when he was out with expecting our arrival. During the course our two day stay Christophe and his staff were extremely warm friendly and helpful on giving various suggestions regard to where to visit and eat. We were almost at the end of our trip and run out of clean clothes. Christophe’s staff offered to wash the clothes for us. The clothes were returned nicely folded and I was told the wash service was free - which is totally surprised while we're asked/expected to give service fees for almost everything during our Morocco trip. On the last morning my children wanted to do the last minute shopping before leaving so had to skip the breakfast. Christophe had his staff to wrap the breakfast for my children to eat on the road. The Riad's location is also great right next to Jemaa El Fna. From rooftop terrace you can see all the actions from the square while distancing enough to be away from the noise. The Riad was kept extremely clean and decorated nice even the rooms are small.    This is my first Tripadvisor review. I just feel the obligation to write a review for this top notch service Riad. I would highly recommend it to anybody visiting Marrakesh wanting to stay in a convenient location in the Medina and seeking for a superior Riad service. I have no doubt to stay here again if I go back to visit Marrakesh in future. Thanks Christophe and your wonderful staff!

This is the only Riad we stayed in in Marrakesh so we can't compare it (and wont once this place is available next time). We opted for the dinner on the first night as we were arriving late and didn’t fancy going out. The chicken tagine was the nicest food had during the holiday. The terrace overlooking the square was perfect close enough to hear the sounds and savour the atmosphere but serene and peaceful at the same time. The rooms traditional and fun. The Riad team were charming helpful and relaxed. We were delighted with the Riad Andalla its location really is second to none. We travelled with our 10 year old son and we all really enjoyed soaking in the atmosphere. Book it you won’t be disappointed!!

Very welcoming beautiful traditionally decorated Riad exceptionally located with a lovely roof terrace.    The staff were extremely friendly and easy to get along with. Christophe recommended an excellent restaurant for my wife's 30th Birthday celebrations and unbeknown to us the lights came down and 'happy birthday' started playing!!    It was a real escape from the hustle and bustle of the market it was so close we found ourselves stopping by in the afternoons to get out of the heat and in to the air con. We would definitely stay again. You're in safe hands.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Simply great hotel. Since we stepped in till we left the place Andre Christophe and their staff were awesome in giving us tips and hints helping in whatever was needed. Great location! Very nice view! Very nice hospitality! Rooms are small but very cozy clean and nice decorated. Adriano and Cintya.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve K wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Best value for money in Marrakech
Review_Text: The welcome I got was fantastic not only from owners Christoph and Andre but all the staff. They all remembered me from previous trips and made me feel so welcome it really felt like arriving home. Such genuinely nice people.  Considering I hadn't booked I was very lucky to get a room - I strongly advise booking as I can imagine they could easily be full with returning clients. This clearly speaks volumes.  You could search the web for hours but I'm positive you will not find better value for money (location decor terrace owners and staff - just totally lovely people). The riad is just the right size not too big that it's impersonal and not too small that you become a feature. The price is very competitive too and don't forget you can be served beer and wine if you want a total luxury in Morocco! The owners will be only too happy to help you achieve what you want from your stay with a wealth of knowledge and good sound advice. They can recommend and book trips restaurants places to visit etc and you can be sure they are not on a commission they just have your interest at heart.  This was my fourth visit and I really can't imagine staying anywhere else in Marrakech. The location is perfect just 2 minutes from the main square easy to find in a safe neighbourhood. The roof terrace has views over the main square with sofas and tables several areas so there's always space. The ground floor patio is also a pleasant tranquil area with fountain sofas and tables along with a more secluded sitting room. You can always find a corner if want a quiet moment. All the rooms are individual and really nicely decorated spotlessly clean with comfy beds with quality bedding. The place is silent at night so a good sleep is guaranteed.  Owners Christoph and Andre have poured their hearts and soles into this place and it shows. They clearly care about their guests and the riad as each time I return I notice new touches more art work new decorations and fittings new bedding etc. constantly updating and keeping the place in top condition. They are obviously not after making a fast buck but more interested in providing a quality stay for their guests.  Having travelled all over Morocco with a mixed bag of experiences arriving at Riad Andalla for me is a guaranteed pleasure - you'll always be well looked after safe and secure amongst genuinely lovely people.  Don't hesitate just book it.  (Note the year before I found Riad Andalla I paid 50% more for a lot less and to a disingenuous owner)

Review_Title: Great views of Djemma el Fna
Review_Text: Riad Andalla sent a driver to the airport for us. When we got out of the car we met Christophe on the corner carrying 2 bags of vegetables purchased for our evening meal. The riad staff are friendly. We had lovely meals and excellent wine on the roof terrace overlooking the square.

After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor I booked the Riad Andalla for our stay in Marrakesh with my cousin. What a fabulous hidden gem and lived up to the fantastic reviews already put on trip advisor. You could not want a better place to stay and so close to the famous Djemma el Fna square (2 mins away - tucked down two small alleyways off the main walkway). You can see the square fully from the beautiful roof garden where we were welcomed with mint tea and biscuits. Christophe (the owner) made us feel very welcome and gave us good advice regarding places to eat etc. Its such a beautiful clean little riad with some gorgeous decorations and our room was very Moroccan comfortable - with air conditioning and en suite facilities. We eat in one of Christophe's recommended restaurants just on the square and the food was good and cheap. Breakfast was served on the roof garden - hot bread pancakes jams fresh orange juice tea etc. We found the staff very helpful. Marvellous place great price and highly recommended to everyone who wishes to visit Marrakesh.

I am a bit lazy for reviews however exceptionably I am happy to review Riad Andalla as a fantastic place to stay just off the Djemma el Fna. Fantastic reception from the owner and all personnel very warm and friendly. Nice place to stay not a luxury but very comfortable and clean.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent location just at one corner of one of the most suggestive squares in the world.
