Christophe and his staff are very kind friendly and ready to give you all the indications you need. We had a wonderful dinner on the terrace the evening of our arrival with a magnificient view of the Jamaa at the sunset. Yes the rooms are quite small but clean - honestly who will stay too long inside when Marrakech is just outside waiting for you?. Last remarks: wifi is detectable in every corner of riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stuart C wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Excellent location just off the Djemma el Fna although if you haven't checked their website beforehand you might find it tricky to find the exact lane to go down to find it. Once there we were warmly greeted by the owner who quickly showed us to our lovely air conditioned room. Do book the dinner there (20€ per person) if you do go as they serve up some wonderful local cuisine which is just divine. We were even treated to this up on the open balcony overlooking the Djemma in full atmospherical swing which was only amazing. Despite it being located so close to the markets the Riad is nice and quiet and has a very relaxed environment and the staff ensure they do everything they can to help you enjoy your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A splendid Riad close to the Jamaa El Fnaa place
Review_Text: Everything was perfect. A taxi driver was waiting us at the airport and brought us close to the riad. After the welcome tea we had a chat with Christophe one of the owners. He spent some time to answer our questions on places to visit restaurants and best shops.  The location of the riad is splendid close to the famous Jamaa El Fna place. The terrasse on the rooftop give a magnificent view on the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matias P wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Really nice location. But you will really love people working there. Christophe is a really nice person always looking for the best way of helping guests and showing the best parts of the city always happy smiling and offering help. A quiet place to stay and close to everything!    Matias Argentina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I couldn't recommend this riad more - the location is perfect breakfast is delicious and the roof terrace was lovely. The rooms are really comfortable and everything was spotless. Christophe is an amazing host and gave us excellent restaurant recommendations helping us with bookings. I'll definitely be coming back to Marrakesh and Riad Andalla and will be recommending it to everyone I know!

We had a fantastic time would recommend to all!!! RAID was in a very central location perfect for exploring the old town of Marrakech close to all local attractions such as the palace markets fabulous restaurants activities and a sort drive to the mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorena P wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: Thank you Christphe!!    Riad Andalla was a really good place to spend a few days in Marrakech. Their hospitality and friendship make as to feel at home.  It is in an excelent location as well everything is near by and you feel completely safe a cozy.    I defenetly recommend Riad Andalla!!

We stayed in the Riad only for 2 nights but it was very good value  for money. It is located in the center so it makes shorter stay much easier you don't spend your time wondering around the city trying to find your way. The owner is very friendly and helpfull. Will definately recomend!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riyadh Andalla will always be our only choice when going to Marrakech. Their hospitality and friendship makes guests feel at home. I would like to thank to Mr. Christophe for all he has done for Helena and Ricardo: his understanding and attention was indescribable and I am eternally grateful. I recommend Riad Andalla to anyone visiting Marrakech because it is 100% reliable. Its central with a great decoration and easily you go to any place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: The place to be in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Excellent location for all sights and for a magic view on Djemaa el Fna! Great services on the rooftop terrace with soukhs sights and snake handlers at your feet. Christophe and Andre welcome you with uncomparable hospitability tips and tricks. Their authentic Riad offers a warm friendly and safe environment for an exciting and relaxing stay. Recommended without any hesitation to first time or returning travellers to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my husbend stayed at Riad Andalla for three nights before we rented a car and went traveling around the country. Our room was comfortable and had a good athmosphere. The riad has been renovated withbgood taste and it is clean but not too glamorous. We spent quite a time at the rooftop terrace and did some work. The wifi worked wonderfully and we could get our stuff done without any problems. All the staff were really nice and was there when needed but no fas about anything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Second stay here and we will be back!
Review_Text: Just got back from another wonderful break in Marrakesh. After staying in Riad Andalla in 2011 the first thing I did was email Christophe and Andre to check availability... as wouldn't want to stay anywhere else! Apart from the fact the location is second to none you just feel so welcome the moment you arrive. I think one of my favourite places in the world is their terrace on a warm evening over-looking the hustle and bustle of Jamaa el Fna. Then you've got the lovely rooms the fantastic staff and the yummy breakfasts. I can't recommend it enough!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aziza B wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: I was looking forward to come back to Riad Anadalla this time with family and friends and again it was a great stay we were lucky to have great weather the whole week so we could enjoy hours on the roof terrasse with great view on the place Djemaa el Fna. I had recommended the riad to my friends and all enjoyed it very much!  During this trip I had as well a business event with 57 people I had to organize the business dinners Andre had recommended 2 restaurants Pepe Nero and Dar Essalam and both were a great success.  Christophe arranged as well all the taxi transfers for the 57 seminar participants and the mini bus transfers for a trip to the Ourika Valley (we had booked a 1/2 day tour for 13 people with lunch at the Restaurant Au Bord de l'Eau).    Thank you Christophe and Andre for all your friendly help tips and suggestions this made the week be a great success only happy smiling faces !    I am looking forward to go back my friends and I are already planning the next trip to Morroco Riad Andalla is definitively on our list.

Review_Date: David S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is centrally located next to the Jemaa El Fna square with superb views from the rooftop terrace. Christophe and Andre are warm and welcoming hosts and the Riad is very clean and comfortable. I’d highly recommend a visit!  David

Review_Title: Friendly Haven in a Chaotic City
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here in February for 3 nights. Christophe was sooo helpful full of tips do's and dont's offerings of tours palces to go and things to do where to eat and where to drink (and that's no easy feat in this non-drinking City). The Riad itself is a welcome greeting after being amongst the hustle and bustle of this enigmatic City it provides a tranquil and calming influence and this is definitley needed to help relax and unwind. Whilst the proximity to the Square is fantastic it is also a negative especially if you are wanting to sleep before midnight this just isn't going to happen albeit if youre there for only a few nights its not too much of a nuisance. A trip to the Atlas Mountains is a must and can be done very cheap albeit you wil need cash for the added extras that arent mentioned. We would come back and stay here based on the impeccable attention to detail from the hosts! Simply awesome.

A cosy peaceful riad in a perfect location only 2 minutes walk from Jemaa El-Fna square. The owners Christophe and Andre were probably the most helpful & friendly hosts I have ever experienced; they made us feel incredibly welcome & gave us lots of tips for things to do & places to eat. The other staff members are also very friendly & accommodating. A generous breakfast of bread pancakes pastries coffee & orange juice is served every morning which you can eat on the lovely roof terrace overlooking the square. The rooms are clean & feel spacious because of their high ceilings & the whole riad is beautifully decorated. An excellent place to stay in Marrakech.

As a little family parents with our 18 year old daughter we spend a week in Marrakech.Riad Andalla is the perfect place to stay in Marrakech. Next to the marvelous Jemaa-el-Fna square you can have breakfast (delicious) on a terrace with a marvelous view over the square. Also perfect to take a walk in the evening on the square the Riad is nearby. The rooms are excellent and very tastfull decorated with a local touch. The hosts Christophe and André shell help you with tips for restaurants and trips in and outside of Marrakech. All other members of their staf are very kind and helpfull. At the Riad Andalla you will feel like home while discovering Marrakech. We surely can recommend this beautifull Riad to everyone!

This was our fourth time to Marrakech and nineth time to Morocco so we know the country reasonably well. We discovered Riad Andalla through booking.com  It was a very good choise. The Riad is only a few steps from Jeema el Fna and the owners Christophe and Andre make you feel at home. They speak perfect English which for non-speaking-french people like me is a real added value. They were keen to help and provide advices.  The Riad is clean confortable and stilish.    Don't know when but the next time to Marrakech thiss will be the choice!    Sandro - Milan (Italy)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anthony M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Put the Koutoubia directly behind you. Cross over the Djemna Square Turn right at the French Café. You'll find it right right right and left Knock and ring and you're in. Go to the roof and see aloof. The best in Marrakech. From another wonderful couple. Tony & Rachael
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Riad Andalla - excellent location and hospitality
Review_Text: My wife and I spent 4 nights in Riad Andalla this Feb 2014. The hosts Christophe and Andre took care of us in all details of our trip (transportation from airport to the Riad tour to Atlas mountain tips for shopping and restaurant) but most important than this was that they made us feel like in a friend's house.    Now talking about the Riad: room comfortable breakfast delicious and location few steps from Jemaa El Fan and all main attractions.    Christophe and Andre your hospitality is above the average.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Having deliberated considerably whether to stay in a traditional Riad or a modern hotel thankfully we decided on this Riad. Conveniently located close to the Jemaa El Fna Square it was a lovely oasis in a busy part of the Marrakech old town.    From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome by the owner Christophe who is the friendliest landlord we have ever encountered over many years of travel. We felt like we had been invited into a family home and included as part of that family. He offered plenty of advice about local sightseeing and safety and was always happy to help and advise on anything we asked about.    This Riad is of traditional Moroccan style with colourful furnishings and decorations. It is spotlessly clean throughout and very comfortable. There is a delightful rooftop terrace overlooking the square (we understand the only Riad to have this) where breakfast is served and can be used at any other time for relaxation or a refreshing drink.    As already highlighted in other reviews the rooms are on the small side but completely adequate for a short stay. The showers were spacious with a powerful supply of hot water. We had been slightly worried after booking this Riad because we had heard that the rooms were not lockable from the outside however we left valuables including our passports unattended every day without any problem. Due to the way the property was managed and staffed we felt no reason for concern.    This is not a 5 star hotel it is a delightful Riad in the heart of Marrakech. If we ever return we would definitely stay at the Riad Andalla again.    This Riad is very difficult to find when you first arrive so we would strongly recommend that you ask Christophe to arrange your airport transfers.    Keith Sue David & Jon-Paul

Review_Date: 直美 wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: This was my second stay I stayed for 4 nights.  As it is good location from Place jamma el funa rooms are very clean and cute  warm & kind people and very safe...they treat us just like family members.  Great Riad to stay!

Review_Date: Nathan T wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Title: Homely Riad With Fantastic Views of the Square
Review_Text: We visited this lovely Riad on the 8th January 2014 for my 30th birthday. It was are second time in Marrakech. The airport transfer was great (last time we where left stranded by are Riad). The Riad is excellently located all the staff are very nice it is very clean however the rooms were very small and there is a strong smell of sewage when you shower.    We did not eat in the Riad but I must say it always smelt of home cooking that I do regret not trying. We would never use a hotel in Marrakech as you would lose so much of the magic of a Riad and this place had plenty of it being well presented very traditional Moroccan style extremely homely to the staff who were so friendly and really did make us feel at home. The roof terrace is a great place to drink and relax and enjoy the amazing views.    Christophe and the staff gave us such a warm welcome and Christophe took his time to make sure we enjoyed our stay advising us on places to eat and visit - we did not receive this type of welcome on our first visit (at a different Riad) so this was especially appreciate especially if it is your first visit to Marrakech - thank you Christophe.    Definitely recommend this Riad!! :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Friendly owners and staff - excellent location
Review_Text: Christoph and André and their staff are very hospitable the public rooms and bedrooms are tastefully decorated and clean. Rooftop with view over Jemaa-el-Fnaa. We really liked it and would highly recommended Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are going to stay in the heart of old Marrakech then this Riad is a must. Let's be clear here a Riad is not a five star hotel it's a Moroccan guesthouse. The Riad Andalla is particularly special because of the two most wonderful hosts Christophe and André they make you feel most welcome and are very informative in fact as a very well travelled person I have never been so informed in my life. All the staff working here are extremely friendly and aim to please at every possibility. We were a little concerned at first because there are no locks on any of the doors but do not let that put you off as we found out later this is very common in all Riads and everything is very safe. If I had to stay in a Riad again this one would definitely be top of my list.    Tips    1. If this is your first trip to Marrakech make sure the you arrange for the Riad to pick you up from the airport as it is impossible to find the first time.    2. Don't expect summer in January. Take a warm rain coat and good walking boots.    3. You will be a tourist so be savvy you will become a target so question everything and trust no one. Listen to Christophe and André's advice.

Review_Title: Beautiful riad, amazing central location with views over the square
Review_Text: We had a fantastic two nights at the Riad Andalla. It's a beautiful building well decorated and clean and were well looked after by Christophe. Our room was smallish but perfectly big enough for us and for the location. The roof terrace is amazing and there's nothing quite like having breakfast overlooking the square in the morning. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We loved staying in Riad Andalla! The location could not be better! seconds away from Jemaa el-Fnaa and a few minutes walking from all the sites.  The owners and stuff are so nice. They make you feel most welcome and make sure you have the best time in Marrakesh giving helpful advice and helping with any need. The rooms are very nice and clean and the terrace is wonderful! We enjoyed sitting there for breakfast and after a long day in the city relaxing there and looking at the best view - Jemaa el-Fnaa.  If I go back to Marrakesh I will definitely go to Riad Andalla again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrea K wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: We were welcomed with open arms when we arrived at Riad Andalla and felt instantly comfortable. The riad is very clean the interior is beautiful and the breakfast at the roof top terrasse that comes with a freshly sqeezed orange juice is the perfect ritual to start your day. From there you can watch the famous Djemma el fna. At the first evening we had a three course menu at the riad which was delicious and gives you a first glimpse into traditional Moroccan cuisine.  The hosts gave us many tipps regarding sights cab prices bargaining in the souks and nice restaurants in different parts of the city which helped us to make our time in Marrakech unforgettable.  We would definitely recommend to stay at Riad Andalla!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bruno Felix wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: This riad is next to the main square Place Jemaa El Fna. From the terrace you can have a great view form the square. However being so near is still a quiet and peaceful place to stay. From the train station you can take a taxi to the square ( 30 dh ) or walk ( 30 min). To get there for the first time it´s necessary some help. Although it´s very near the square you have to enter some narrow streets not conventional. But when you enter the riad you will find a magic place. Beautiful and cosy. Christophe the owner is specially helpful and caring. He not only helped us with lots of tips about anything we needed but made us feel like home. For a real experience in Marrakesh forget the chain hotels in Ville Nouvelle stay in Riads. We strongly recommend this Riad it´s a touristic attraction itself. The superb breakfast in the terrace looking at the square is another rewarding experience

Christophe and Andre the owners and their staff know how to take care of their guests and make them comfortable. Useful Marrakech tips enthusiastic. Riad Andalla is cosy clean and has good working sanitary. Breakfast on the roof terrace is very nice. Don't bother to look further.  Lodewijk & Sena
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patricio O wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Located in a narrow and quiet alley just a couple of blocks away from hectic Djem el Fna square this small riad gets the best out of it. You will even have breakfast in he terrace looking to the square beautifully decorated the owners are friendly and really helpful. The rooms are not very big but overall the place is an oasis in the middle of a chaotic town.

Review_Date: Graham W wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: We decided on a change for Christmas and had a wonderful stay at Riad Andalla. The staff are extremely welcoming and the Riad is in an excellent location 2 minutes walk from the main square for entertainment in the Medina as well as the main Souks and must see sites.

Brilliant atmosphere and extremely helpful owner and staff. The stay there was a pleasure. I was made at home given great assistance in what to do in Marrakech. I would recommend it to anyone thinking of a trip there.

Review_Date: Philip M wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: We had a very nice 7 day stay at Riad Andalla. Christophe and Andre are very friendly helpful and take time to suggest good places to visit. In fact you feel that you have known them for years.    The Riad is 2 mins walk from Djemaa El Fna and has a very nice roof top terrace. The rooms are confortable & clean. We stayed in Chems. Everyone who worked in the Riad was extremely friendly if you need any advice just ask. Breakfasts were nice and simple - coffee breads jams and honey. Which served by Younis was very charming. We will definitively come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aziza B wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Atlas mountains, La Koutoubia & Djemaa El Fna in one view
Review_Text: The location is perfect 2 mn walk to the Djemaa El Fna. Amazing view from the terrace  rooms very confortable & clean. Extremely friendly owner and staff if you need any tips just ask Christophe and Andre they will take the time to discuss and advise you with good tips. I will definitively come back and can only recommend Riad Andalla!

Feeling at home during all the stay.  Very clean and really nice staff.  Perfect location even if it's near the place jemaa el fna it was really quite at night.  The terrace was great for breakfast and a little chill out time in the between of sightseeing and wandering in the medina.  Great tips from Christophe and André about the city place to visit and best advice about hammam and where to eat ever!  I'll return for sure and recommend it to everyone willing to experience a charming and warm city as Marrakech

We loved this place the location is perfect and even it's very close to the hustle of the Medina we had good quality sleeping.  Breakfasts in the terrace were remarkable the view is amazing!  Our room was very comfortable and tastefully decorated as was the rest of the Riad.  The owners and all the staff were so friendly and accommodating! I got sick in the middle of the trip and they were so kind to get me medicines and even prepare me special meals.  If we go back to Marrakech we will definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Terrific Riad with wonderful rooftop views of Djemaa el-Fnaa square. Christophe was amazingly helpful in providing information about the city where to go what to do and great restaurant suggestions. The staff was equally as amazing. They served breakfast on the rooftop terrace and if you wanted anything else they were happy to accommodate. With the location just off the square it was easy to stop back at the Riad to drop off purchases from the souks or just relax on the rooftop with drinks before dinner.    If this is your first time in Marrakesh I would recommend arranging airport service with Christophe since the Riad is slightly off the square and down a few alleys but after the first time it's easy to find on your own. Also make sure you have small change (coins) before you arrive to the square for tipping. Before you leave the airport buy a bottle of water or a snack so you have a variety of bills and coins. Even though you've paid for the transport service through the Riad the guide (not the taxi) will ask for a tip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is an amazing Riad and unfortunately we only stayed there for 1 night on our return to Morocco. Had we known about this place before we would definitely have stayed here on the 1st leg of our trip. The views are amazing you can see the whole square from one side and the mountains on the other. The owners are amazing too and very helpful. Would definitely recommend this place to all. Sorry it's taken soo long to write the review.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mariana G wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Loved to stay at Riad Andalla. It was recommended to us by a friend and we were not Great location friendly owners wonderful staff beautiful house lovely terrase. very recommendable. Can't be better!  Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alexandra R wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Feel at home and even better!!!!
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad Andalla in October 2013. You cannot get a better location. The friendly owners went out of their way to make me feel welcome. The location is brilliant right off the main square with roof terrace views to die for. I loved the decor really Moroccan and tasteful. I will definitely recommend this Riad to friends. The dinner was fantastic too. Nevertheless the room was on the very very very small side.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous find, cosy, convenient and welcoming
Review_Text: Loved staying at this Riad - it is well run clean and comfortable. The friendly owners went out of their way to make me feel welcome. The location is brilliant right off the main square with roof terrace views to die for. I loved the decor really Moroccan and tasteful. I will definitely recommend this Riad to friends and will return for another visit. A really fab place!

Review_Date: I A wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad Andalla in October 2013. You cannot get a better location. It is a haven after all the hussle and bussle of the Medina. The room was on the very very very small side. As a single traveller I felt it was samll  I cannot imagine two sharing that room (which is how it is set up). Nevertheless Christophe was amazingly helpful in providing information about the city where to go what to do how much to pay for a taxi. To be honest I only visited the places he reccommended. By mistake I ended up in a museum that wasn't part of his suggested places - it was a complete waste of time. I then decided to stick only to what Christophe reccommended and he was right. Every place was worth it. The staff at the Riad was incredibly friendly - there was always a lot of smiles. I loved my stay. As mentioned in other reviews this is not a 5* hotel and it doesn't need to be it doesn't want to be. It's really like a friend's house and that is what is great about it. The breakfast in the mornings was fantastic too.

Review_Title: Feels like coming home to friends...
Review_Text: Our first time at the Riad Andalla was in November 2011 for 7 nights and we fell in love with this wonderful place. Now in October 2013 we returned and stayed for short 4 nights and it felt like coming home to friends!    The Riad does not claim to be a five star hotel but the service the atmosphere and the warmth of all the employees makes it better than in any five star hotel that is known to us.    The only thing we will do when we plan our next trip to Morocco is to ask Christophe for his always wonderful and extensive advise of how to fill our holiday - he will gladly give it even if it doesn't take place in Marrakesh the whole time. ;-)    Thanks to everyone for the wonderful time!  Christian & Erica
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: a little slice of heaven right in Marrakesh!
Review_Text: Just back from a 3 day stay at the Riad Andalla and I can't say enough about this place. It's location its ambiance and the staff are a delight. We were so surprised by what greeted us when the door opened it's decor is tranquil warm and very inviting. This Riad has bags of character along with its owners. We were lucky to meet Christophe who made our stay so enjoyable. We had everything explained to us maps drawn and given lots if idea's for things to do. During the 3 days we visited Majorelle Gardens Marrakesh Museum Isis Spa Pepenero Restaurant and finished the trip off with an afternoon by the pool at La Maison des Oliviers. We would highly recommend this Riad to anyone and do hope to visit again.    Steve & Philippa xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful Riad in a wonderful city
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is a dream of a Riad beautiful homely clean friendly and best of all it overlooks the amazing Jamaa El Fna in Marrakech. I've stayed in two other Riads on previous occasion and neither were half as magical as the brilliant Riad Andalla. I stay with my Mum for three nights Im 32 and she is 59 and we both totally loved it. The rooms are each unique and special and Christophe's personal welcome and recommendations made it the perfect trip. It is really is a special find.

I stayed here for about 4 nights while visiting Marrakech. The riad is located right by the heart of the medina; jemaa el fnaa square. It was a perfect location for anyone who wants to spend the majority of their time in Marrakech in the medina. I can't say enough good things about the riad. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. The interior of the riad is beautiful. While we didn't get to meet Christophe one of his friends was running the riad in his absence. She was really nice as well gave helpful suggestions and helped us out a few times where our sub-par French failed us when trying to organize activities. Our room was beautiful with traditional tile work and plaster walls. Each room has an AC unit which worked well and quickly cooled the room. Also the rooftop terrasse provides an incredible view of the square and of Marrakech. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in Marrakech.    In case anyone is thinking about doing an Ourika Valley excursion here's some notes on the experience (not reflected in my rating of the riad because it's done by a third party)  -We had a driver for the day. He picked us up on time and was a really friendly and knowledgeable guy who spoke great English.  -We stopped at a few locations on the way up the road to the cascades: a Berber house a pottery shop where they make pottery right there in front of you a place where they make argan oil and other herbal remedies that are all for sale lunch at one of the many restaurants that's in the river (food was great). We also stopped a few times to let us take pictures. At the places the driver took us we never felt pressure to buy things.  -We were paired up with a guide to take us up to the cascades. Unfortunately he wasn't the best. His English was pretty good but he wasn't particularly knowledgeable about the area or cascades (despite being from there). Also he complained about our tip size after doing a pretty average job (we were also told it was tip what you like).  -Be forewarned that during August the cascades are super rammed with local Moroccan tourists trying to escape the heat of Marrakech. This made the trip up and down slow due to traffic and the climb to the cascades a bit more treacherous due to crowding.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is down a littl street near the main square. Very helpful proprietor and staff. Quiet but the roof has a great view of all the action. Beautiful decor. Only suggestion would be to have bottled water in the room and have drinks served on the roof. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel!  Th hotel even accomodated my fiance's special dietary needs at breakfast!

I stayed here with my (retired) parents in a Suite for just 2 nights and everything about the Riad was perfect especially at the price paid. The interior of the Riad and the rooms is beautiful and calming despite it being right next to Jemaa-el-Fna with a rooftop terrace that directly overlooks it and is also well shaded. Breakfast was simple but fresh and delicious. The staff are absolutely fantastic particularly the owner Christophe who really makes you feel like you are at a home away from home he is courteous and goes out his way to help out and provide useful advice. I needed assistance with rearranging a hire car and he did this without any hesitation or fuss.    If arriving late at night (we were after midnight) I would recommend the transfer service as though centrally located the Riad would be difficult to find for a first timer. It's down a few narrow lanes off a main lane that leads on to Jemaa-el-Fna square (50m) easy once you're there but the transfer service made it no stress.

Amazing riad. You can't beat the location. 2 mins from the Fna square (central square where all the action take place). Lovely hosts Christophe and André are very easy going helpful and discreet. Rooms are nicely decorated and comfy beds. Youssef the handyman is very friendly and helpful as well as the cleaning ladies Rashida and Hayat. Good breakfast. I will definitely come back !

Riad Andalla is fantastic!    It is gorgeous inside absolutely beautiful and very Moroccan. Every floor is lovely and feels homely.    We stayed here for 4 nights. Our room was on the ground floor and we slept so well (there was no noise from outside the room even in the evenings). It was small but had everything you needed we had a really enjoyable stay and I would definitely go back!    The Riad is in such a perfect location – it is less than 2 minutes away from the main square of Marrakech yet perfectly quiet at night. All the best things to do in Marrakech are within 15 – 20 minutes walking distance. The Riad also felt very safe and there is always a staff member in the Riad. The small streets around the Riad also felt very safe and we are two quite small girls travelling alone.    The terrace where you eat breakfast is also beautifully furnished and just far enough from the main square that it is not noisy (but you can still see it and take photos).    Christophe arranged for us to do a couple of days trips (to Essaouria on the coast and to the mountains) and he recommended some restaurants for us to visit (lovely food! And I didn’t get sick from them at all they are safe places to eat). He also showed us on a map the best things to do in Morocco which made our holiday easy and enjoyable – he definitely showed us the best things to do. He also made us bookings at the most lovely spa in Marrakech! He Andre and the staff are all so friendly and helpful; it made the stay very easy. The service was excellent. Christophe (and everyone) are so friendly helpful and easy to get on with.    Christophe also arranged our transportation to and from the airport which was hassle free and had no problems.    This is brilliant value for a holiday in Marrakech! I would definitely go back and have recommended it to my parents.    Thank you !!!!

Review_Date: Gurpreet B wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad for the last two nights of our trip to Morocco. The hosts are extremely nice and caring. The location of the Riad facing the Jmaa El Fnaa is priceless. The rooms are clean and the Riad has a home like feeling to it. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to catch a birds eye view of the Jmaa El Fnaa from the amazing terrace.

On booking this riad we received an email immediately from the proprietors Andre and Christophe who offered us transportation to and fro our entry point into Marrakesh. As we were on a tour of the country we made our own way there; however when we arrived we found the place being run by their friend Sandrine. She was incredibly friendly helpful and easily interchanged between English and French; I speak French but my partner does not. She arranged early entry into the room as we arrived at 8:30AM and had their staff serve up a breakfast immediately. Along with Younis their night staff and general handyman and the ladies who worked during the day servicing the rooms we felt like part of a family and were treated accordingly. The riad is extremely secure in a city where crime is an issue indeed we left money and devices in our rooms without fear. The rooftop terrace provides a unique view over the main square and is a refuge of tranquility amongst the chaos of the medina.    Sandrine arranged an excellent excursion into the mountains and all her recommendations regarding places to go things to do and restaurants to eat at were spot on and should be followed! We would go back to Marrakech specifically just to stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: In the very heart of the medina
Review_Text: Stayed there for 5 nights and felt at home. Andre and Christophe are wonderful hosts always ready to help you and get everything you need bus tickets train tickets cabs booking for restaurants. The place is cosy and comfy and having breakfast on the terrace overlooking the market place with the Atlas in the background is simply magical. Can't wait to go back there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Return to a home from home
Review_Text: I have just returned from a second visit to the Riad Andalla. This time with my family the welcome we received was amazing- heart felt and just lovely. The staff are relentless in their aim to please and the owners are absolutely fabulous .... Andre and Christoph could not do enough for us  a taxi was waiting to pick us up from the bus station when we arrived from Essoueria and dropped us as close as possible to the riad. The staff were waiting to greet us with the best mint tea and our family room was cool  beautifully clean and spacious. The smells sights and sounds of this riad make you relax immediately. The other guests I have met there are always delightful and Andre and Christoph make every effort to take time in helping all.  The weather was extremely hot so we relaxed on the terrace and watched the square come to life as the sun set. Big super clean towles and a fab shower refreshed us for our night in the square.  We spent the next day at a beautiful pool which the boys organised for us - it was the perfect end to our holiday travelling around Morocco. We will return again - love this place - thank you to Christoph and Andre for such an amazing time x

The rooms are good airco in every room the people very nice and warm. The breakfast on the roof top terras was really nice and so was the view over the square! During our stay there where problems with the airco the lady of the house immediately did everything to fix this!

My parents and I were in Marrakech in May and stayed at the riad for 5 nights.  First of all I have to mention Christophe and Andre-- they were such wonderful hosts and it felt like you were visiting friends.Their staff also need to be mentioned they were great always helpful and happy to help you as well thank you thank you! After the hectic hours of traveling and the stress that goes with it it was great to arrive at the Riad with a warm smile. We were showed to our room and then offered some mint tea as a welcoming drink lovely touch. Christophe took the time to explain the area a little bit giving us some tips on where to eat what to visit and so on. The riad's location is ideal! You are literally 5 minutes away from the main Square which makes it so convenient after a long hot day in the souks to just come back and have a nice glass of wine on the roof terrace which was overlooking the square. The riad itself is lovely small but has everything you need and very cozy. You can tell that a lot of considerationtime and love was put into the decorations. The rooms were very clean and made everyday. When traveling it's always the people that make the place-- the place can be wonderful  but without the right hosts it's just not the same. Christophe and Andre are exceptional. We had two bags along with us that broke and we asked Christophe if he knew someone who could fix it.Right away he said yes took our bags and they were back and fixed within an hours time. Now that's great service! Thank you again so much if you are reading this. I have nothing negative to say about this place it's worth the money and I would go back there in a heartbeat. Much love from my parents  Please come visit us in Thailand we'd love to have you    Isabel

Stayed for 3 nights was great to be so close to the action. Owners were really helpful. Our room had a day bed in it furnishings all really nice bed comfy. Air con works needed it as was so hot! Staff friendly and happy to get us anything we wanted.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed in riad Andalla for 4 nights with my wife at the end of Juni.  it was an excellent stay from all points you can see it.  first of all the owners Andre and Christophe are wonderfull hosts.  they helped us for everything we needed  very polite always with best moodgave to their riad  the highest niveau of quality cleanessdesign..  rooms very comfortable very very cleanimportant in africa  each with different design.  marrocan breakfast on the very beatiful terrace overlooking  jemma al fna.  wonderful marocan home made dinners with candles and advises about  recipes from Andre was in sunsets looking at busy jemma el fna something not  to forget over life.  staff is wonderful very friendly trying to keep the Riad in the highest level of quality.  beside the best location the prices are affordable.  All in all a best choice for me in Marrakech which i highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful riad, fantastic location, perfect hosts
Review_Text: My fiance and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at Riad Andalla and had an excellent time.    Firstly Christophe is brilliant; charming welcoming and friendly. He really makes you feel at home.    The location is perfect just on the edge of the square so you can go from the cool quiet of the riad to the madness of life in Marrakech in no time. For me this was ideal; it was super hot and of course very busy so it was nice to be able to nip back to the riad cool down have a drink calm down....and then head back out again.    All of the staff were lovely from Christophe and Andre Younes (sorry about spelling!) who was a brilliant waiter and very friendly to the ladies maintaining the rooms which were always spotless.    We ate at the riad 1 night and the food was very good. A tasty 3 course meal with the option of wine also on the rooftop.    The staff are happy to advise you on where to eat what to see how much to expect to pay for things how to get to places but this does not impact on your own discovery of the city just enhances it.    All in all Andalla felt like a home from home like you were visiting friends at their beautiful house exactly what we wanted from our stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect little Riad.. It was our sanctuary in such a manic city!
Review_Text: I am a big fan of researching a property prior to travel on tripadvisor and I know some people can moan about the tiniest things. But Riad Andalla was no exception. Not only were the reviews 100% correct but I was so thankful to have booked this Riad in such an amazing location It was perfect for us.    Location 10/10 - Bang on the square plus the views from the terrace mean you can watch the hustle and bustle from a distance when you are tired!    Service/Hospitality 10/10 - All staff I met were so polite helpful friendly and there isn't even a lock on your door so it shows how safe and secure you will feel. Christophe the owner was superb at recommending where to go questions etc.. Really nice guy!    Breakfast - Simple what you need to keep you going till lunch and the bread selection differed from day to day.    Room 10/10 - Really cute. It is small but what more do you need? Immaculately cleaned daily hot water on tap and beautifully decorated with a co-ordinating fez!    It is for the money spot on. Really happy!    I truly recommend this property to anyone :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: An oasis of calm on the edge of the Plaza
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad Andalla as a 50th birthday surprise and at the end of a day of surprises it was a crowning achievement. The riad is 'traditional chic' basic but pleasantly relaxing and Christophe and his staff are helpful and attentive without being obtrusive.    My partner was in email contact with Christophe for weeks before our arrival and was able to arrange taxi pickup from the airport - this is a convenient arrangement and one which I would recommend for any first-time visitor. Once there Christophe is always on hand to recommend suggest or arrange anything from restaurants museums excursions or places of interest.    All in all I would not hesitate to visit the Andalla again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kimberly S wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: So glad we stayed at Riad Andalla in Marrekech!!
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay very much at Riad Andalla. Thank you Christophe for such a warm and friendly welcoming!! Loved the renovated Riad the food and staff were all wonderful. We felt very safe comfortable. Christophe gave us great advice about where to eat where and what NOT to eat and also directions to get around and back to the hotel. The location is great and we enjoyed breakfast from the top of the Riad where you can overlook the Jemaa el-Fnaa square (also amazing to see at night from here - we were there on a weekend night). We would highly recommend Riad Andalla and would stay there again!

We got off the plane and a driver was waiting to take us to Riad Andalla where after winding our way through a maze of alleys we were warmly greeted Christophe and staff with mint tea cookies and an extremely helpful and entertaining orientation of Marrakech. Dinner on the rooftop terrace overlooking Djemma El Fna was our best meal on Marrakech! The Riad is charming comfortable and in a perfect location and the whole team graciously took care of us. Christophe has a wealth of knowledge about the area and is a great resource. We enjoyed our day trip to the Atlas Mountains too. If you are lucky enough to visit Marrakech this is a great place to stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my mother stayed here for 3 brilliant nights on may/2013.  Since the moment we set foot on Riad Andalla from the moment we left we were treated like members of the family.  Christophe Andre and their lovely crew were more than happy to provide us with first class service and arrange everything we needed.  The location is perfect really close do Djemaa El Fna (you can see it from their terrace which I understand is something unique for a riad in Marrakech) but not so much that the noise bothers you we slept like babies every night.  I strongly recommend their dinner service which was one of the best meals we had in Marrakech. Do not miss it.  All in all a great experience which I hope to repeat soon.

Review_Title: Incredible location, great staff, perfect stay.
Review_Text: Stayed here for 5 nights with my girlfriend last June and it couldn't be a better choice. Location is spot on just close to Djemaa El Fna right at the center of the Medina. Some might argue and complain about the noise that comes from the streets at night but I think that's just part of the experience. The view from the terrace is incredible on of the best sunsets in Marrakech's and the terrace itself is a great place to chill out in the afternoon sipping a mint tea and resting the bones after a day in Souqs or just to enjoy breakfast (which is included) and getting ready for the day. The staff is extremely helpful and gave us a very warm welcoming. Christophe the owner and the guys (Andrea Younes did I get the names right?) were always available to help us out giving us information and all sorts of tips about restaurants places to visit transportation etc. that were essential for us to enjoy even more our trip to Marrakech.  You can book a transfer straight from the airport to the Riad we were also able to book a tour to Ourika Valley and visit the waterfalls with a driver and guide included during our stay.  The rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated (as the entire Riad by the way). We stayed at a kind of small one but there are bigger ones on the other floors and we really didn't mind the space as it was very confortable.  Totally recommend Riad Andalla specially for couples who seek a romantic escape. Perfect location excellent staff clean and confortable rooms and a typical Moroccan ambience for a very considerable price. What more can you ask for?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for four brilliant nights and could not fault the place. The location is incredible with views across the vibrant Jamaa el Fna but a quiet resting spot within the Riad. Christophe was the best host we have ever experienced. He quickly worked out the type of holiday we needed and before we knew it the perfect mix of relaxation exploration and great food was arranged. Definitely book Riad Andalla. We hope to be back!

Very nice place right in the center of the medina. Beautiful interior. Very nice rooftop terrace with good view on the Djemaa el Fna. Room was good though not very spacious. Didn't bother us though. Everything was clean. Food was excellent. Christophe the owner gave us good tips on where to go and eat with his handdrawn map which he must have drawn a 1000 times by now.. Prices were reasonable for a tourist hotspot I'd say. Had a great time in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful time in Riad Andalla! The view from the terrace over the grand place is amazing rooms are so charming we could have bought the whole interior! Thanks for all the important and interesting information and organisation!

Review_Date: Hayley B wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at Riad Andalla and had a fantastic experience. The Riad is located in a superb spot just off the main square with a roof terrace that has spectacular views overlooking Jemma el Fna. Christophe and Andre and all of the staff at the Riad are very welcoming and friendly and make you feel right at home. We must also give a special mention to the cook as we had 2 dinners here and they were by far the best meals that we ate in our whole Moroccan trip (in particular the vegetable tangine which was perfect.)  We highly recommend staying here! Hayley
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful stay at the Riad Andalla
Review_Text: Stayed here last week for 4 nights - and had an amazing time the riad is beautiful and the location is excellent - we loved the rooftop terrace where we could overlook the Place Djema El Fna - the only riad with this view! Christophe and André were perfect hosts - very welcoming and extremely helpful booking us restaurants and organising a great day trip to the Ourika Valley. I really can't recommend this riad enough.

Review_Title: Wonderful welcome and expert advice which enhanced our stay
Review_Text: As a first timer to Morocco my friend and I had little idea of what to expect.. We need not have worried Christophe Andre and the team introduced us to the city of Marrakech in a gentle and helpful way drawing great maps on how to get around and explaining everything carefully. The team had a wealth of languages between them English French Spanish and maybe more - so we got great information thought out our stay. We laughter alot and enjoyed the lovely terrace sipping wine. We will be back - and soon ...  A must go to Riad - highly recommended !  Suzette

Review_Date: caroline A wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: Did we enjoy our stay in Riad Andalla....but of course!
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed at Riad Andalla in May. As marraketch vergins and women travelling alone we were abit nervious we needed have been. The Riad is delightful and perfectly located but it is the welcome and the attention to detail provided by the hosts Christophe Andre and their 'family' of staff that makes the experience truly unique. They were were wonderful hosts helping us to maximise our our visit. with recommendations and bookings of anything from attractions resutarants and taxis. Just as importantly they made us feel totally safe and able to enjoy all this wonderfull city has to offer!  thank you    Caroline Cope xx

Review_Date: Jean Giugni wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: My wife And I loved the Riad Andalla and their owners. They were Very kind and helpfull. If you will need anything in Marrakesh they are always read to help you. You feel at home. Thanks for everything Christophe And André. Best Regards Jean and Luciana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Andalla for almost a week in March and we had an awesome time there. The riad is a like a quiet oasis in the middle of the busy old city of Marrakech.  Christophe the owner is really friendly and does a great job in making his guests feel like home.  He gave us recommendations for restaurants and places to go.    The rooms were clean and nicely furnished the breakfast delicious and it was good to have wi-fi.  The rooftop terrace has a nice view over Djemaa el Fna.  We will definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Just fabulous... the best hosts ever!
Review_Text: We were delighted with our room which was quite magical in opulent textures of reds and gold. Having stayed in four different riads I can say that Riad Andalla had the most comfortable bed of all. But what really strikes you is the generosity and love for their guests bestowed by the hosts Christophe and Andre - you could not be made to feel more welcomed - it is as if you are the guests of your oldest and dearest friends who are absolutely thrilled to see you again and share in their delightful home. It is worth staying at least one night in this fabulous riad just to experience their kindness. In such a bustling and sometimes overwhelming city it is wonderful to have such friends at hand - you are made to feel that they would do anything for you to ensure your visit was perfect. We shall never forget them and their colourful riad. We must also mention Yunis who served us delicious mint tea and pastries on arrival and is a real asset and compliment to the staff who were all kind and welcoming.

The best thing about this Riad is its superb location a few seconds walk from the main square. My daughters and I had a triple room which was nice enough though quite small. Breakfast comprised bread and jam and pancakes which were ok. I have nothing to complain about this place its just that its not anything particularly special. We later moved to a different Riad which was!

Great place with lovely roof terrace overlooking the main square. Very friendly staff. Had booked one room for me and my young family but they kindly gave us a second room for free. They Even gave us a great breakfast in spite of having to leave hotel for airport at 7 am

We were welcomed with a nice mint tee and received very helpful and friendly advice from Christophe about where to go and what to see in Marrakech. Our room was charmingly decorated and clean. Another highlight was the terrasse and the nice breakfast we enjoyed there. The location of the riad is also extremely convenient. Altogether we had a great stay and would definitely come back to this great riad.

I'd love to give this riad a 3.5 but since I can't I'll give it a 3/5.    Christophe and crew are really great and communicate all the info you need. With all riads in Morocco get directions to where you are going or have someone come and meet you. We arranged a transfer from the airport with the riad and the driver was waiting as expected.    Because the riad is in the medina near the square you have to walk the last bit or have your bags taken by chariot.    The room was a bit dark (it was a blue one) but the shower was good the decor exotic and the staff were very attentive. There are no locks on any of the doors and no safes so if you have something very expensive you might want to leave it with Christophe. It did feel very safe though because there are always people about.    The thing that makes this place special are the owners. They give good information on the area and are always available to help. Breakfasts are good as well. On our final night with Riad Andalla a really lovely dinner was organized probably the best we had in Morocco.    I would recommend Riad Andalla in spite of its small imperfections.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Memorable stay in atmospheric, prime location
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed here in late February for two nights. Christophe was very helpful and welcoming and the Riad is beautifully furnished and comfortable. We felt very at home and found Christophe exceedingly useful with tips for eating etc. What made the trip for us was the location of the Riad - it is so central and the roof terrace has a great view of the main square which is really special. It's lovely to be so close to such a buzzy area and breakfasting while watching the square wake up was a real treat. That said the Riad was calm and quiet and I had no trouble sleeping. Our room was fairly small and could get chilly (the heater didn't work but we didn't complain as it wasn't v cold) but happy to have a smaller room as we were so central and as Londoners we were used to it anyway. I would recommend the Riad to anyone who was visiting for a short stay as it means you are right in the action while very comfy and well looked after!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Close to all sights but basic accomodation
Review_Text: Pros: People (Christophe Younis and Andre) were all great as well as all the staff and location - very central and close to all the main attractions. Cons: very very small damp room with a tiny bathroom and uncomfortable bed - quite cramped and the Riad is down a little alley (which did not feel safe at night). This is basic accommodation and you are paying the price for the location and hospitality. We only stayed one night but could not have stayed longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve K wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Trust the good reviews.  I've stayed here 3 times now and every time it gets better.  Christophe and Andre are the perfect hosts at the Riad every morning and evening more than willing to help with whatever you need - from shopping for slippers to arranging a trip to the Sahara. I followed their recommendation to Pepe Nero restaurant and have now dined there 4 times. The rest of the staff are very polite and helpful nothing too much trouble nice genuine people.  The location is so very easy from the main square and in a safe area. Absolutely perfect with the big bonus of a view over the square from the rooftop terrace. (watch the chaos with a glass of wine in your hand).  To try and give a balanced review I've racked my brains trying to think of a downside. The only downside I can think of is the rooms are a little small but considering your location in Marrakech and the view from the terrace it represents outstanding value for money. The downstairs patio and lounge are nice areas to relax in so you wouldn't want to be in your room anyway. Typical Riads have small bedrooms and this is a typical Marrakech Riad.  The quality of sleep is great no traffic or street noise at all. Always hot water. air con if you need it.  Really unless you want the 'marble palace' style riad don't hesitate to book this - It's super friendly helpful staff will really help you get whatever you want from your visit and it wont cost the earth.

Fun place fun owners and ideal location. The Riad is just behind cafe de France off the Jema el Fina square and the noicefactor! From the roof terrace the view is highly entertaining and in the mornings when the excellent breakfast is served a haven of peace and quiet.  The rooms relatively small but colorful and comfortable are very reasonably priced and there is parking (and porters) just accross the square.

My family and I have just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Riad Andalla (my wife and I plus my parents). I can only echo what the other favourable reviews have said. The Riad is excellently located and the rooftop terrace not only enjoys great views but is a comfortable and relaxing place to escape the medina. The rooms are cosy and really well decorated and the communal areas are very nicely done. Breakfasts are good (pancakes breads and the same great orange juice you can find in the Jemaa el fna). The recommedations and contacts for food and trips are also well worth listening too (we had a very enjoyable trip into the Atlas mountains). Best of all though are Christophe Andre Younis and the rest of the staff. They are always cheerful enthuiastic and welcoming. Nothing is too much trouble for them and they go the extra mile to make sure your stay is special. They also respond very quickly to email questions prior to our trip. In short they have done a fastastic job turning this Riad into a 'must stay' place in Marrakech and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others as we would stay here again the next time we visit this great city.    Matt and family (UK)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect start to a holiday in Morocco
Review_Text: For great hospitality and an ideal situation it's hard to beat this stylish riad in the centre of Marrakesh with its roof terrace overlooking the Jema el Fnaa. The welcome from the owners André and Christophe immediately made us feel at home as we stepped in from the winding alleyways into the Riad Andalla. Breakfast in the roof terrace was the ideal way to start the day in this hectic and fascinating city and our beautifully decorated room was just the place to relax and recover after a foray out into the streets. If you want to experience the real Marrakesh give the 5-star hotels a miss and come to this great riad in the city's vibrant heart.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rodrigo D wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Very good Riad to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: I´ve never been to Marrakech before and my stay started with a mint tea at this riad. I must say that I was received very well by the people in Riad Andalla. My room was in excellent condition and it was a very nice room decorated in Morocco style. The breakfast is another great stuff from this Riad. You enjoy it with a great view from square Jemaa al Fna. Christophe gave me excellent tips from Marrakech to make my trip better. The location of this Riad is privileged. I'll be back to this Riad as soon as I can.

Review_Title: As an introduction to North Africa, this will be hard to beat.
Review_Text: The adventure started when we lead by a local guide down the Rue de Banques off of Jemaa el Fna square we were taken through a winding left and right alleyway to the Riad Andalla. We were greeted cordially with big smiles from the staff and were escorted to the roof terrace. After being offered mint tea and local biscuits Christophe gave us a really informative insight to the 'does and do nots' of the local area Also good advice of the 'must sees' of the area on a short visit.    Our rooms were impeccable serviced daily and any request was never a problem. Staff were always on hand smiling and making our stay comfortable.    The breakfast terrace was superb as was the breakfast. Warm bread honey marmalade peach jam warming coffee all served with a truly heartfelt 'Bonjour' to start your day. The terrace was also perfect for a mid afternoon or early evening break with a nice glass of chilled wine served by the willing staff.    When you come out of the Derb (alleyway) you can turn left to go to the square or turn right which takes you directly into the souks and to the museums and palaces the location cannot be equalled. Sunset on the roof can only be described as 'Magical'    We will tell friends we will tell travellers we will remember. We will be back.    Thank you Christophe and your ladies and the very handsome Younes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Surene G wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: My friends and i checked in to Riad Andalla on 26 Feb 2013 and stayed for a total of 3 nights    GREAT HOSPITALITY  After I made our bookings online we received a customised welcome email reply from Christophe to thank us for making Riad Andalla our choice accommodation and he looked forward to welcome us! Also he asked if we will require any transfer - Man... I thought we will only get this in 5* star hotel!    When we reached the Riad we were welcomed by the friendly staff who offered us cookies & home made Moroccan Mint Tea. I need to really compliment that the decor of the place made us feels welcome and it was very cozy as though we are living as one big family. Please go to Christophe if you need excellent food & beverage venues and hamman.... (He will show you his fantastic map drawing skills ;p)    EXCELLENT HOUSEKEEPING  The ladies tidied our rooms daily keeping it neat and clean. When we reached the Riad I was just asking my friend how woud the hygenie level be. Now I can proudly share with you 100/100!    GREAT LOCATION  It was situated in a very good location in the old town with all the best actions that you wouldnt want to miss! It really beats staying in the new town with all the 5 star properties etc. The Night Market & Medina was less than 5 mins away!    I would definitely not hesitate to stay in Riad Andalla when I revisit Marrakech again in near future. & before I forgets... Did I mentioned breakfast is served as well? - of coz not just your usual bread & butter ;)

Have just returned from a fantastic stay in Marrakech thanks largely to our stay at Riad Andalla. The location is perfect it feels like you are enjoying a really genuine Morrocan experience. Christophe and his team could not have made us feel more at home or been more helpful. From the airport pick-up through to recommendations to our journey back to the airport everything was handled brilliantly.    The roof terrace is also fantastic with a great view of Djemaa el Fna.    Christophe knows the city so well and his recommendations are spot on. Trust him your trip will be the better for it! I would highly recommend this riad to friends and family and if I return to Marrakech I would definitely stay here.

Review_Date: Natalie W wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Perfect location amazing hospitality and some of the best personal recommendations I have ever had on a city break. Friend and I stayed at Andalla for three nights first weekend in Feb and had a truly fab stay. Location of the Riad is great shopping immense (make sure you know you can take extra baggage onto your flight back as you will need it) and Christophe’s suggestions on Pepernero and Les Bains de Marrakech were probably the best moments of this break. Unbelievably relaxing considering the hustle and bustle of the city. Andalla is homely welcoming and I would certainly recommend it and stay there again.

The location of the riad is fantastic! You can easily reach the souk the square the new city and all other touristic sights. The staff was great and did everything to please us. They arranged our airport transfer and gave us some restaurants and hammas recommendations. I would definitely stay there again.

Review_Date: Eva D wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: Riad Andalla was a wonderful place to stay while visiting Marrakech. The staff was at all times very helpful and cheerful it was great fun thanks to them. We recommend this place as it is perfectly located next to the most common sights

I booked this beautiful Riad online before visiting the wonderful and chaotic city of Marrakech with my boyfriend. I chose it because many reviews had said what an excellent location it was in how charming the staff were and how comfortable the Riad was. Booked in for two nights we ended up staying a total of four... The Riad is absolutely stunning complete with intricately detailed tiles authentic Moroccan furniture trinkets collected by the owners on the walls and a roof-terrace with views of the Atlas mountains and the Djemma el Fna - (excellent for drinking mint tea on after a hectic whizz around the Medina). All of the staff made us feel very welcome coming back in from bartering in the Souks eating rabbit tagines and sampling Moroccan wine at all hours of the day and night. We met the owners on our second say who gladly helped us out in sorting out an epic trip into the mountains for two days which was greatly appreciated and enjoyed. On our return we opted to stay for another two nights although this was not in our original plan(!) and we were upgraded from a very comfortable double bedroom to a glorious suite on the top floor which was very special. We had early flights on our last day and the delightful Johannes made us an early breakfast. All in all we had a really fantastic stay which really made our trip away one to remember and would highly recommend this Riad to other travellers looking for some luxury at a very good price in Marrakech. Thank you to you all. If you ever come up to York you will be more than welcome to stay at the Judges Lodgings. Sophie and Nick.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marina m wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: First is important to say that the location is perfect.  The owners are very friendly. Riad's ambient is nice simple and confortable and has a great view terrace to the Jemaa el fna.  But we had some minor issues such as: air condicioning was not working at 1 night hot water was not enough for 2 showers (other days were good) and the room has some smell of sewage.  I would stay there again but with some price negociation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicolas D wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We've chosen this riad for our holidays 'cause we've riden a lot of great reviews about it... and we can say one thing : everything's true.  Rooms are incredibly clean and comfortable the staff is always attentive to our needs (and their advices to visit are wise ^^) and last but not least breakfast was soooo divinely good on the terrace during sunrise (thanks Ouria !)    It's useless to write a complete essay because one thing is sure : I know where I will sleep each time I'll go to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Friendly Riad in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: We arrived on the evening flight: Christophe had arranged a driver to pick us up and upon arrival at Jemaa al Fna hand us over to a man with a handcart. So our introduction to the medina was following a cart through the mad traffic into the main square and into the alleyways to the Riad. A truly wonderful introduction to Marrakech and great fun!  Our first meal was at the riad proving to be one of the best of the holiday and good value. This has got to be the best way to start a trip to Marrakech.  The staff are really friendly the riad is really close to Jemaa el Fna - you can see it from the lovely rooftop - and the decor is authentic. Our room was quite small but we only used it for sleeping so that was no problem.  Definitely recommend Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Arlene O wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad Andalla in October 2012 and loved it. In a nutshell I could LIVE here!    Christophe and Andre - and all of their staff - are simply delightful. So helpful and informative. I am a woman who was travelling on my own and and right before I was to depart on my trip was having second thoughts about going to such a country on my own. Christophe reassured me and gave me the best orientation immediately upon arrival. One of them was always available to answer any questions about what to do where to go etc as well as just interacting with guests.    The riad itself absolutely meets my criteria of what I look for in accommodation when travelling: small clean quiet and centrally located - with bonus marks for charm! Because the riad is small it was very easy to meet up and talk to other guests at breakfast (delicious!) served on the lovely balcony overlooking Djema-el-Fnaa. A dinner prepared by the riad staff is absolutely recommended.    Marrakesh is a fantastic destination and staying at the Riad Andalla was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. An oasis of calm in the middle of this happy fun always different and sometimes frenzied city - loved it :)

Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: Perfect location for the Marrakech experience.
Review_Text: I had booked a long weekend stay at the Riad Andalla as a surprise 50th birthday for my partner. I had visited Marrakech 10 years ago and I wanted to show him the unique flavour and experience of Marrakech that had ‘wowed’ me all those years ago in the short time that we had. For this reason I wanted an authentic Moroccan Riad (rather than a hotel) with a view over the Djemaa el Fna Square at the heart of Marrakech where all the ‘action’ was. Riad Andalla ticked all of those boxes and more.    Communication with Christophe the proprietor was always prompt and efficient throughout the booking process and he was the perfect host when we arrived taking time to orientate us with maps and directions to places of interest and also advising on a variety of places to eat. This was valuable advice and in a chaotic city such a Marrakech really did put us at our ease and gave us the confidence to just get out there and enjoy it!    The Riad itself was completely charming and the staff always friendly and helpful. The rooms might be considered a little small in comparison to some European hotels but remember this is a Riad (guesthouse) in a fantastic location and we found it perfectly adequate for our needs. The linen and towels were very clean and we had terrific hot showers.    We ate on the roof top terrace for our first evening meal (complete with birthday candle!) and for breakfasts which were simple but delicious; bread pancakes and jams fresh orange juice and coffee. The closeness of the Riad to Djemaa el Fna was not just great for the views over the square from the roof top terrace but also on more than one occasion we were grateful to be able to nip back to our ’bolt hole’ to draw breath after the ‘souk experience’ before venturing out again.    In summary the combination of the ambiance the location and Chistophe’s hospitality made this the perfect weekend that I had hoped for and I would have no hesitation in recommending Riad Andalla to fellow travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Luis M wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: Like staying at a friend's house!
Review_Text: After being to one too many impersonal big-chain hotels it was a wonderful change to stay at Riad Andalla. It was exactly what we wanted. More than the location which is amazing (1 block away from Djema-el-Fnaa squarea two minute walk) the very clean rooms and the affordable price what we liked the most about this riad was enjoying the company of Cristophe and Andre. For absolutely everything we wanted to do they either took care of it personally or gave us the best advice. We were a large party and had to do some last-minute changes to our reservation (add and extra bed take one night off) which they helped us with very diligently. Each morning Andre helped us shape our itinerary and gave us excellent dining tips. In such a hectic place as Marrakech having their orientation made our experience a million times better. DO NOT dare purchase anything without asking their opinion first. If Andre says you are being asked too much trust us you are. During our stay in Morocco we ate a lot of typical moroccan food (tagine couscous) but the best couscous definitly was Andre's.  Even though it is just near the main square once you make the first turn into a little alley that leads to the Riad it gets very quiet and so the rooms are very quiet (except very early in the morning the first call to prayer is very loudly heard). We stayed at suite Chems which was incredible. It's the one with more light of the rooms we saw. The beds are very comfortable and the everything is nice and clean.  Breakfast was served in the terrace. Even though it was very cold in the mornings you do get some sun and have a great view of the square were you can see all the action begin once again. The breakfast was very good also (coffee/ tea/ chocolate milk orange juice and two different types of bread which were different each day). We particularly loved the one that was like a vanilla spongecake and regretted later in the day not having eaten it all.  Also we travelled with our 7 year old daughter and we can say that this is definitely a child-friendly riad. She felt right at home. Everyone was very nice to her and made her feel great!  Do not hesitate to book this lovely Riad.  Thanks again to Andre Christophe and all the staff from Riad Andalla!

Everything has been said already but two main things are very worth being  repeated. First the riad is absolutely nice clean and in an ideal position to  live the best of Marrakech. of course if you are ready to pay 3-4times as much  you might get more space or more luxurious rooms...but this is quite normal i  think. Everywhere!  Second thing: every person working in the riad is absolutely nice and super  kind. On top in a country where each time you ask a direction in the street 10  people try to bring you to their cousin or neighbour and to sell you something  at a crazy price the suggestions and recommendations Christophe gives you with  NO second interest allowing you to get the best out of a couple of days in  town are totally priceless!!!!

We stayed at Riad Andalla for our December holiday based on reviews from Tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed! Christophe Andre & the rest of the team were very accomodating & helpful and we really enjoyed our stay there. The location of the Riad is also great as almost everything we wanted to see and do was within walking distance of the Riad. The view of the market and snow capped Atlas mountains was also incredible!

Review_Date: THE LONDON LOUNGER wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I don't know why people have ranked this a 5. It's not a 5. The rooms are small old and dirty the food is OK the staff are nice. I would suggest that this is a hotel to stay in if you are on a tight budget. If you have more money spend it on the more luxurious places which maybe are not ranked as highly but are exceedingly superior to this place in terms service luxury cleanliness quiet and food. Location is excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This beautiful riad is in the perfect location next to Djemaa el Fna. We were made to feel very welcome by Christophe & André who were attentive to our every need tour guide great food plugs! etc…...
