Also when we had had rental car problems Christophe helped us sort out the issue.    Looking forward to another visit one day soon.

Review_Date: Neil R wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I've twice stayed in Riads in Marrakech - they have been lovely but difficult to get to and from. Riad Andalla is in a different ball game: tucked behind the Cafe De Paris 5 minutes from the Djemma down narrow but lit alleys. We stayed in a junior suite on the 1st floor - a long narrow room with double bed and a red divan. The bed was very comfy. There was no table but a closet - and the floor was carpetted. There was a good strong shower and a toilet behind a curtain. It had heating. There were no locks to the room or a safe - everything was on trust. There was a large communal area and seats on each floor. The Wifi was good but only worked downstairs. Breakfast was on the roof three stories up with brilliant views of the Square. Breakfast itself was average: the first day we were given deep fried donuts - my cholesterol count went through the roof just looking at them. On the other days there were Moroccan crepes. Great orange juice but weak coffee. We never ate in the Riad but did visit the expensive but lovely restaurant on the way to the Riad in the first alley. Overall a great place to stay but you are paying for the location
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sitwat M wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Andalla last October had an amazing experience. The staff was very hosbitable. Particularly Christoph's guidance helped us a lot in exploring the city. Breakfast that we used to hav on the rooftop is somthing we still talk about very often & miss. Christoph also helped us get the bus tickets that we needed to travel to another city which otherwise seemed to be a hassle as we had language issues while communicating with the local people who either speak Arabic or French. All in all an excellent experience highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dani O wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: A really good place to stay in the heart of the medina!
Review_Text: Simply everything perfect. Great location really close to the main square in the medina and very friendly and helpful staff. Very nice decoration in morrocian style. Good rooms. I have travelled a lot and it is one of the most recommendable hotels I have been.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jean D wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: Staying in Riad Andalla is a fantastic experience.
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at Riad Andalla from the 21st December to 26th December 2012. The hospitality shown to us by the owners Christoph and Andrew and their staff was absolutely fantastic. We were made to feel so welcome they went out of their way to make us comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The accomodation was home from home. We had the most wonderful time because they looked after us so well. on arrival Christoph welcomed us and gave us lots of information regarding things to do and see and information on the local area. He booked a restaturant on our behhalf and arranged a guide to take us there and escort us back to Riad Andalla at the end of our evening. There was a lovely dinner provided by Christoph Andre and their staff on the night of Christmas eve for us and other guests. The food and service provided was first class. On arrival in Marrakech Taxis were arranged for us to be met and return to the airport Christoph even paid the taxi service direct so we did not have the hazzle it was just put onto our bill which made life easy. Before our arrival I communicated with Christoph by e-mail on several occasions regarding questions I need to ask. Christoph responded immediately with answers emphasizing that he is more than happy to help with any enquiries I have.    I would highly recommend Riad Andalla to anyone considering staying in Marrakech  Regards Jean Drew
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A love nest in the Medina...
Review_Text: I just returned from a week-long trip in Marrakech with my husband and we enjoyed every bit of our stay in this great place. All throughout our stay we have been so well taken care of by Christoph and André the owners. They made sure we were picked up at the airport and once we reached the Riad they offered us a drink and a little snack while giving us very useful tips and advice about the city.  In the evening they arranged for a romantic dinner on the rooftop terrasse of the riad... and the food was absolutely de-li-cious! (sighs)  During the entire week they really went out of there way to make us feel at home and comfortable. They gave us maps of Marrakesh made bookings for us for the hamam as well as for some restaurants arranged a day trip to Urika Valley got us bus ticket for another trip to Essaouira... They even found some time to take me shopping in the souk!  I cannot imagine going back to Marrakech and not staying in this Riad. It is so nice to have a "home" to go back to when one is travelling... and this Riad certainly feels like home!  Thank you André Christoph and the rest of the staff for the great time we spent with you!  Hugs
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I spent four nights at the excellent Riad Analla in November.    The riad arranged for a taxi driver to meet us in the arrivals lounge at the airport who then took us straight to the riad.    On arrival we were welcomed by Christophe and Andre. They provided a map of Marrakech and suggested tourist attractions restaurants bars a great spa and also provided travel advice. They were always on hand to help with anything we asked for. Firsthand knowledge is very useful when trying to make the most of trip to somewhere like Marrakech.    The Riad is in an excellent location literally a stones throw from Djemaa el Fna. The roof terrace is superb the ideal place to look over the square - sunset sunrise and at night. We enjoyed being in the tranquillity of the riad but still being able to enjoy the atmosphere of the square.    Thank you so much Christophe and Andre you made our trip to a very interesting city!    A 100% recommendation from us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Xavier T wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: Riad Andalla, the place to be
Review_Text: Staying at Riad Andalla has been a wonderful experience: conveniently located in the bustling heart of Marrakesh Christophe & Andre's place fits in beautifully. Decorated with taste full of local flavours this haven of peace will provide you with a cosy terrace overlooking the mesmerizing Square a nice king-size bed to sleep in very decent plumbing in a soothing ochre bathroom and the opportunity to make new friends everyone being eager to share opinions on what the day's been like and advice about what to do during one's stay. Christophe has been very helpful and knowledgeable about what to see where (not) to go and we really owe him many thanks for making our week in the city such a success. A high-five to all of them there staff and management alike.  Have a nice stay with them too !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matthew C wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: The best location of all for those who want the buzz of Djema El-Fna.  Lovely interior great decour to the rooms. To top that there is a great warm feeling a homely atmosphere generated by Christophe and the other staff. This is missing in other equally beautiful riads. The rooftop terrace is stunning with panoramic views. If I went back to Marrakesh I would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are looking to stay close to all the action of Marrakech medina then I would highly recommend a stay at Riad Andalla. We were made to feel very welcome during our stay here from before we had even arrived!    Before we arrived we emailed Christophe the owner to ask for directions to the riad (although it is located next to the square the entrance was down a few alleyways) and we also made dinner reservations as well. Christophe replied promptly and was ready to greet us when we arrived at the riad. He provided us with mint tea on the rooftop terrace and gave us a map and told us some information of places to visit and recommended some restaurants to have lunch later that day.    Our room was one of the suites and had beautiful traditional decor and although the riad is on the square and you can hear the sounds of the snake charmers and drummers during the day there is no disturbance at night so we slept very well.    Dinner was served downstairs in the patio lounge by the fountain. It was a little too quiet for my liking but the food was pretty tasty. Breakfast was included in the price and served up on the rooftop terrace with views over the Djemma el fna square. The views from the terrace were what attracted us to this riad in particular and it was nice to see the action of the square from a viewpoint.    Although our stay at Riad Andalla was brief I would definitely recommend staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephan K wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: I had the chance to visit Marakech in November 2012 ... I went to Riad Andalla first "by hazard" now it will be for sure the " spot to be " for ever !!! it's a fantastic and wonderfull Riad. I did discover a warm and sweet Riad so wonderfull so clean and delicious. As example : the room (suite Bachahamou) is so beautifull and delicious warm ambiance. the breakfast is fantastic : each day a new cake new taste new marmelate and fresh orange juice ... after 5 days still surprise. You can also take place at the Riad to enjoy a delicious couscous cooked only for you on the penthouse of the Riad !!! Riad Andalla is real dream for any one who want to appreciate life ... The price is incredible as so low with a high level of services like a 4stars hotel in Paris or in London. Thanks so much for this AMAZING RIAD !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Perfect location right next to 'la place'. The riad has a fantastic sunroof with a view of 'la place' the roofs of Marrakech and the High Atlas mountain range in the far distance. Breakfast on the sunroof with a view of the mountains every morning... what a way to start to day! And last but not least André and Christophe are excellent hosts with a lot of good 'insider' tips for Marrakech. I stayed in 3 riads during my stay in Marrakech; if I would visit again this would definitely my number 1 pick.

With it's discreet but very central location and rooftop overlooking the lights of the biggest market square in Marrakech it was an ideal location for our first visit to Morocco. The staff we're very welcoming and treated us as guests in their home giving us freedom to roam and helping us with every aspect of our stay: places to eat things to do things to see and made our experience ideal. It's also within very short walking distance of a lot of other markets and a 10 minute (and very cheap) cab ride to the new town with all the modern less traditional things to do and see. The rooms are cosy and very traditional truly making you feel like you are a guest in someone's home the breakfast was nice and moroccan very accommodating allowing us to make requests for what we wanted. We really warmed to all the staff there and we're sad to have left them but will always remember our experience and will definitely return there whenever next we are in Morocco!

Review_Date: Morten S wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: Great Riad in the center of Marrakech
Review_Text: If you are looking for a centrally located place to stay in the Marrakech Medina you should absolutely book Riad Andalla. The Riad is hosted by Christophe who makes the most to ensure a pleasant stay in a friendly atmosphere.  The view from the terrasse over the Djema al-Fna square is stunning but make sure you also spend a couple of hours on the square during the night where the square really comes alive with Berber music local trader and food stand.  Finally a thanks to the staff who got up before dawn to make me breakfast on the day I left. That really made my day.  Overall a very pleasant stay and if you are looking to stay in a traditional Riad centrally located in Marrakech this is the place.

Sometimes I read reviews and think it may be too good to be true. Not here! Every positive review is well deserved and true.  Fabulous location - very close to main square but the noise doesn't carry. The Riad is very peaceful! Terrace at night looking onto the square is amazing!  Would advise that you take up their airport/bus station transfer as it is easy to find once you have be shown but you may struggle otherwise.  Hosts are fantastic! Very very helpful! Nothing seem like too much effort for them! Christophe even managed to get us booked in for a Morrocan spa treatment when the baths were otherwise full!  Great advise re places to visit/places to eat!  Fantastic Riad! Thanks to everyone there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrea H wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: Brilliant oasis in a busy city with wonderful staff
Review_Text: Me and my husband have just returned from our second visit to Marrakech. It was the first time we had stayed at Riad Andalla but it certainly won't be our last! From the very minute we entered the Riad we were made to feel very welcome and at home. Our room was beautiful with wonderful decor as was the whole Riad. It was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helfpul and we felt really looked after during our stay. Christophe (the owner) was a real star recommending a fantastic romantic restaurant one night (even organising a table and a guide to the restaurant) and giving us lots of advice. He certainly made our stay a perfect one and we loved his humour. The Riad itself was in a brilliant location just a short walk from the main square and it was lovely to come back to the piece and quiet of the Riad and sit on the roof terrace (which had fantastic views) away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We had an evening meal in the Riad on our first night and this was delicious would highly recommend this. We met some wonderful people and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Arriving in Marrakech from Casablanca in late October we realised our Moroccan adventure was only just beginning! Marrakech is truly magical please do submerge in it's culture and get lost in its maze of souqs. But the most enchanting experience for us was our stay at the Riad Andalla. We are a couple accustomed to staying in big 4star hotels across Europe Asia and America. So imagine our pleasure when we arrived at the Andalla with its warm reception unique Moroccan decor pristine rooms and friendly attentive staff. Recommended to us by our good French friends who had stayed there previously our stay was truly magnificent. The French owners Christophe and Andre are excellent hilarious hosts and made our stay complete. Do trust their local knowledge and recommendations and u will not be disappointed! Make sure you have a home cooked evening meal at the Andalla and local wine on the roof top terrace with unrivalled views of the Djemaa Al Fna. We were romanced by this secluded candlelit encounter enjoying a truly fine evening with excellent food that typifies Moroccan cuisine. With 2 French owners how could you go wrong?! Seduced by the charm of the pristine Riad Andalla and the fantastic hospitality of Christophe Andre and their lovely staff we will definitely return in the near future. To make your stay in Marrakech complete make sure you stay at the Riad Andalla. Christophe Andre merci beaucoup. Mark and Ceri West Midlands UK.

Our first trip to Marrakesh we had a decision to either stay in a standard hotel outside the Medina or choose a riad in the medina for a more authentic experience. We took a risk and opted for a Riad in the Medina. Turned out there was no risk.  I have never felt more at home and relaxed than when staying in this Riad.....and to think it is located in the heart of one of the most intimidating cities in the World.  Just 50 meteres from the main square. We stayed in the Chems suit. We didn't experience any bad smells from the shower drain. With ears plugs I was not woke up by the early morning call from the Mosque.( and I am a light sleeper)...the power shower was great with hot water within seconds...the air con was a great plus ...the breakfast was fresh produce everyday..  the biggest asset you have in a stay at this Riad is its owner Christoph...to have an honest local spend 45 minutes with you covering all the highlights of the city for you and most importantly the pitfalls to avoid was simply invaluable...  I look forward to out next stay and thank you so much Christoph for making our stay wonderfull  Congratulations on this Gem you have created.

Review_Title: Fantastic hospitality at the Riad Andalla
Review_Text: My wife and I had a lovely time at this accommodation. The host (Christophe) was fantastic and he treated us like royalty from minute one. The hotel is ideally located and his initial briefing was very thorough and informative. The room was quaint but perfectly adequate for our three day stay. Clean and a nice breakfast on the terrace every morning was a joy. Just stay here you wont be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: the right place to be in Marrakech
Review_Text: the location is perfect next to Djamaa al Fna the view from the rooftop is fantastic the interior and decoration is in the best of taste the rooms are lovely the staff is very obliging and helpful in every need the whole place is very clean the breakfast is french but more than enough and last but not least Christophe with his open and easy nature gives you a feeling of visiting a friends home you won't notice that you're staying in a hotel far from home

Fantastic riad in the heart of the Medina the perfect place to experience Marrakech from. Lovely clean beautifully decorated rooms and a great terrace to enjoy the sunset across Jemma El Fna. Easy to find once you've been shown the way once so we recommend organising an airport pick up through the riad when you book. We really appreciated Christophe talking us through the map of Marrakech and his recommendations of where to visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Let Riad Andalla guide you to the wonders of Marrakech
Review_Text: The best part of our stay in Riad Andalla in Oct. 2012 is the warm helpful and joyful company of Christophe Andrei Yunes Christophe's sister and the rest of the staff. Could not ask for more in the riad's location accommodation and staff's assistance. Andrei gave us bread to bring along for our next trip to Ouarzazate. Little touches of kindness and thoughtfulness add to the memory of a wonderful journey to a foreign land.

Review_Date: Ellen H wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: Wonderful and beautiful riad with helpful staff and a wonderfull atmosphere. The owner is very good at giving advice for at good stay in Marrakech and also to help you move onwards to other cities in Marokko.

Riad Andalla was the perfect place to stay in Marrakech. Not only was it situated just a short stroll from the famous Djemaa el Fna our rooms the rooftop terrace overlooking the square the service (especially by Yules) and our hosts and their invaluable advise made Riad Andalla the perfect introduction to our 9 day trip around Morocco. Cristophe and Andre made us feel at home: Cristophe gave us tips on sites to visit and restaurants and stalls to eat at and Andre gave us bread and croissants for our early departure at the start of our road trip. I will choose Riad Andalla over all the other riads in Marrakech when we go back to visit this wonderful city again!

Review_Title: Riad Andalla should be your first choice of where to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Every thing was perfect; from being picked up at the airport by their driver to check out I couldn't have asked for more. The location right of the Place Jemaa el-Fnaa is perfect and the views from the roof top terrace can't be beat. Christophe does a wonderful job of giving you an orientation of Marrakesh and suggests the best sites and places to dine. The Riad is wonderfully decorated and is truly an oasis in the busy Medina of Marrakesh. Small touches that were especially nice included fresh squeezed orange juice at breakfast and incense burned by the fountain in the central foyer. I highly recommend Riad Andalla.

Review_Title: Fantastic place and would return again
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at Riad Andalla for 3 nights and really enjoyed the stay. We were greeted by Christophe’s sister when we arrived late Sunday night who managed to get by on enough English but when Christophe arrived the next morning he was fab a big character with plenty of knowledge of places to visit and advice on prices to pay when haggling! He drew us a map of where things were and how to get there as the small alleyways are very confusing which we used and was spot on! (Thank you Christophe)  The actual Riad was excellently positioned behind the Café De France just off the main square (Djemaa el Fna) so easy to find once you knew the route! The décor inside was very tastefully done and our room (Bachahamou) was perfect with a very comfortable bed and fantastic shower so no complaints there.  We managed to see all the main attractions within the medina within our short stay even managed a horse and cart trip in the rain which was still very enjoyable. Everything inside the main walls is accessible on foot and is within walking distance of Djemaa el Fna but must admit we did get a couple of “petit” taxis when we got a bit lost back to the square and paid no more than 30dh each time even though they wanted more.  The only slight negative or improvement that we can say is the breakfast was very simple and something like fresh fruit would improve it but the freshly squeezed orange juice was excellent so overall marks would be 9/10 for Riad Andalla with breakfast losing it the one mark!  We would definitely recommend Riad Andalla to anyone who wanted to visit Marrakech and would definitely return ourselves.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location, charming rooms and welcoming hosts!
Review_Text: There are hundreds of riads to choose from in Marrakech but I don't think we could have found better for the price. A 2 min walk to the market (you can watch the action from the charming rooftop patio) clean rooms with hot water good breakfast and hosts that make you feel like family the moment you arrive and provide you with all the information you need to maximize your stay in Marrakech.    Seriously stop looking and just book this one!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had a 3 night stay in a room on the ground floor opposite reception. It had a lower price than the upstairs rooms which cost about 50% more. I didn’t find any disadvantages with this room and if it is available I’d take it. (There is not a lot of activity through reception because it’s a small guesthouse with only ~8 rooms.)    The riad's location is right next to the Djemaa el-Fna which is good for the convenience and because it makes it easy to find the way back. It is on the same block as the Cafe de France a local landmark and a minaret which is the tallest building in the square is nearby.    I recommend using the riad’s transfer service especially if you arrive after dark – you have to go down a few alleys and without knowing what to look for it would be difficult to find the first time. (My transfer had an issue though. The car driver handed me over to a street porter and tried to get me to pay for it even though the riad's fee covers transfer to the riad's door.)    As soon as I arrived the owner (Christophe) drew me a mud map of how to find my way back to the Riad gave me a map of Marrakech and explained the layout of the Medina and the wider city and made some restaurant suggestions.    Breakfast is not a large meal but it is served on the rooftop terrace that overlooks the square and has a great view. The view is even better at night.

Review_Date: Liz P wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: What a wonderful place to stay in Marrakech! Christoph and Andre were so welcoming and helpful. We loved the peace and calm of the riad compared to the bustle of the city outside.  The rooms were comfortable and beautifully decorated and we found the wi-fi connection downstairs very good. The riad is very conveniently located near the main square.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Review_Title: Great personalized service, clean and comfortable.
Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights. The place is tucked inside some winding streets. Easy access to the market. The area is safe. The owner is always present the staff is polite and attentive. The room i stayed in had a queen bed and was decorated with Moroccan accessories. The bathroom had continuous hot water. The internet connection was bad but they say that all of Morocco has bad internet.

Review_Title: A most enjoyable stay i Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and I had got a recommandation from a friend who said Riad Andalla was a must. And she was not wrong! We stayed in Riad Andalla two days then we spent a few days in Essaouira and was back in Riad Andalla for a last night before flying home. The Riad was like a second home for us with a friendly staff who fulfilled all our wishes and needs. The location is just marvellous: Overlooking Jamaa el Fna we had the feeling of beeing ringside to a never-ending drama playing out in the square. To sit on the terrace with a cold beer looking at the sunset: You have to try it to belive the feeling. The only negative was the 5 o'clock (a.m.) prayer-call from a nearby minaret but this is something you have to live with in a muslim country. :-)  Our best to Christofe and Andre!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Victoria L wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: The best place for stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We've stay at Riad Andalla one month ago with two of my sisters and my brother-in-law. We had a really good time. Mohamed Christoph and all the team made us feel at home.  The food was excellent and served in that terrace with an unique view to the Jemaa el Fna priceless!  The location is perfect just two minutes walking from the square. It's just good to know that if you arrive by night traffic is closed in that area so your transfer will leave you like ten minutes walking distance but the driver can assist you finding a man to handle the luggage and help you finding your way to the Riad not a big deal.  We've also appreciate all the local information and tour booking they provide us.  Totally worth it!!

Stayed at Riad Andalla because it was near to the Jamaa el fna square and was the only one that overlooks the square Christophe was an excellent host and all his staff were excellentwhen we arrived he gave us a map and marked all the places of interest and recommended places to eat which were all good! The suks are a must ( go with a guide as you get to see a lot more) Dont eat in the Cafe France as a glass of mint tea and a small can of coke will cost you about £8:00! The cafe on the opposite corner Cafe Chez Chegrouni is good food is ok and reasonable prices If you are going to eat in the square of an evening then take Christophe's advise and eat in number 1 or 31 ( they are always crowded which is a good sign!) The ONLY negative thing that I can say is that there are a few Mosques close by and you get the wailing noises very very early in the morning which keeps you awake so I suggest you take some ear plugs and wear them when you go to sleep!!! I would definately recommend this Riad because of its location cost great host and friendly staff and I would certainly go back if I go back to Marrakech! Merci Christope!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter Motson wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: If you have the slightest difficulty walking as I do this is NOT the place for you. First of all if you arrive after 1.00pm the main square is closed to traffic so the nearest the taxi can take you from the airport is a good 15 minutes walk through overcrowded and very hot cobbled streets. The suitcases are transported in a barrow with you by a street porter. The Riad is NOT on the main square as claimed but down three cobbled and potholed alleyways about 5 minutes walk. The roof terrace does overlook the main square and provides good views of the activity day and evening.  The other problem is that the internal staircases are very steep and one has no handrail. The bedrooms are on the ground first and second floors with the roof terrace above that.  Continental Breakfast is served on the roof terrace but because of my walking problems they very helpfully provided for us on the ground floor.  The bedrooms are very small with no place even to unpack a suitcase and there is no door between the bedroom and bathroom/toilet just a curtain! You also have to remember to shut the shower drain plug or the room smells very strongly of drains!    Apart from all of the above I have to compliment Christophe and Andre on their warm welcome the information they gave us regarding sightseeing and eating out and the fact that Christophe accompanied us back to the main square with our suitcases when we left. Nothing was too much trouble for them and we would love to go back apart from the access problems.  If you have no problems with walking this is a great hotel for a holiday. I have no wish to spoil their record or ranking position but the purpose of Trip Advisor is to tell the truth !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Teresa S wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: Wonderful hosts but we won't be back.
Review_Text: We stayed for 1 night in this riad. It is very close to Jemaa el Fna. The terrace has a view to the plaza but unless you have a good zoom lens you won't be able to take good pictures - best to go to Cafe Glacier for that.    The booking process was good - Christophe responds to emails quickly. When I found out later that the price for the room had gone down Christophe acknowledged that. Instead of a refund for the difference I just asked for transport to the Supratours bus station and it was no problem.    We booked Lalamira - it is a very small room and the bathroom is tiny! The wifi doesn't work well in the room. We left early the next day and arranged to get our breakfast at 7:00. This was the least amount of food we were served during our 2-week Morocco trip and the pancakes were cold and hard at the edges - like they had not thawed properly.    On the positive side Christophe Andre and Muhammad were very nice and the location is very convenient to the Jemaa el Fna. I had requested Christophe to purchase our Supratours ticket to Essaouira for us - he did make a reservation but we had to go to the ticket office to buy the tickets (we got better service in this regard at another riad). We stayed in a better riad in Marrakech after going back from Essaouira so would probably not go back to Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I love this Riad. The booking is very systematic the staff is very nice and helpful the room is super nice and beautiful the terrace is very nice the location is too perfect (a very important point to be taken into account for a single female traveller when walking back to the Riad at night).    I stayed in this Riad for 5 nights I felt so safe after entering the Riad. I would not have to worry about the security of the room and my luggage all the staff in the Riad is taking very good care of the guests.    The owner of the Riad Christophe is so nice that he helped me to order the bus ticket to Essaouira in advance and offered many useful tips regarding eating sightseeing transport in Marrakech. The staff there are all very passionate and helpful.    I would definitely go back to this Riad when I visit Marrakech again and would recommend this Riad to anyone who wanna spend a holiday in Marrakech. Believe me the location of riad in the medina is a very important factor to be considered as you can get annoyed by people trying to talk to you or even follow you if you have to walk back to the Riad for a long way each night.

Review_Date: Jennifer V wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Bonjour! Riad Andalla adds to the enchantment of Marrakech. Words simply cannot express how much the staff made our stay in Marrakech a spectacular one. Not to mention the location! After a long day of exploring you can sit on the rooftop terrance sip tea and watch the splendors of Jemma el Fnaa unfold before you.  The staff was more than helpful with coordinating transportation trip ideas and food recommandations. My husband and I were impressed and completely satisfied. Our time was short in Marrakech (4 days) but it was filled with nothing but adventure good eats and a fabulous place to stay.  Thank you Riad Andalla!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: CP Goh wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: I'm not sure this is the best Riad in the town but I can guarantee that you will like it! Simply beautiful Riad great hospitality from Christophe and Andre. It is difficult to locate the Riad for the first time as you need to make few turns in the narrow back street to reach this Riad. Don't get me wrong it is very close and took you just less than 2 minutes walk to reach the main square. I would suggest you to arrange a private car with the Riad to bring you from the airport to the Riad without any hassle in just 15 euro/trip. Many thanks to Younif for preparing the breakfast at 7 as we need to catch our earlier flight. The view from the terrace overlooking the square at evening is absolutely brilliant and awesome. I was surprised not many people on the terrace during evening. The only complained I have will be the weak Wifi connection and literally impossible to access inside the room. I would suggest Andalla to get another router/wifi on 2nd floors. It would be great if guests can access the internet from the terrace or inside the room. As for the smell from the drain hole inside the bathroom I guest this is the common issue in this area/old town. I don't have any issue just remember to close it after use it you will know what I mean when you stay there. The taxi fare from the square to the new town(shopping) is just 10 Dirham and 5/10 dirham tips for dining in restaurant is acceptable. Enjoy your stay in Andalla!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sinan M wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Spent 4 days here at the beginning of an 8 day moroccan adventure including marrakech and Fez. Riad andalla is perfectly located within a minute of the main square with a beautiful terrace overlooking the square for evening chillax.  The rooms are authentically decorated with intricate beautiful features and decor and the ambience is of relaxation authenticity and a lovely family vibe.  This is chiefly due to the proprietors Christophe was very accomodating and friendly and helped expedite further travel and local activities.  Thoroughly recommended a bargain at the price you wont regret it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel Hogg wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Many thanks to Christophe Andre and Mohamed for their fantastic hospitality during our recent stay at the Riad Andalla. They were always willing to help out with arrangements and advice on places to visit and how helped us settle quickly into Marrakech life. The location of their Riad is perfect overlooking the Place Djemaa El Fna and provided an ideal place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. A few days spent here combined with a few days spent on the coast provided us with an ideal week's break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The riad has a Great location great staff breakfast was good nice room with air condition. The only problem when you are travelling as a couple: no door to the bathroom only a curtain. I stayed only one night.

Review_Title: Genuinely friendly in a not genuinely friendly city
Review_Text: We want to extend our gratitute to Mohamed christophe and Andre for their help smiles and friendly attitude. You will find that most of the locals street locals that is are friendly for money. They can be nasty and really umpleasant pushing you to hire them as guides misguiding you to buy things you don't want and pretending to help you to find your way out of the Medina. When you here them telling you "FERME or closed in english" just ignore them.  Riad Andalla is a no frills Riad very well located and quite difficult to find the first time only.  First suggestion to the guys is to draw a simple map starting from CAFE DE FRANCE a landmark in Marrakech to the labyrint alleys that lead to the Riad. It is very simple once you have been at the Riad once.  Rooms are in three different floors they are small with two single beds or a double with a private bathroom and a curtain dividing the room and the bathroom which can be at times unconfortable for there are no windows to the outside and no extractor. So watch what you eat...All the rooms have wooden doors open to the courtyard and a curtain. You can actually have the doors open and the curtains closed for privacy. we found it completely safe. Breakfast is served from 8 to 10 but they will accomadate your needs in case of an early departure or if you sleep in. Coffee fresh orange juice bread and gem. A suggestion add some fresh fruits since they are all over Morrocco and are very good and inexpensive specially grapes and apples. Also I would see some croissants and occasionally some cheese. So Mohamed get in the oven and do some baking...  Mohamed the night watcher is always there when you need him with a big smile and very sincere and speak fluent english Cristhope will help you get around the city giving you maps and explain in details where to go also with very good english with a french accent and Andre gave us excellent recommendations for eating. All the places were a hit even though Andre does not speak english well he loves for the guests to speak to him in english so he can learn. Make sure you talk to him in English even if he says he doesn't understand. He is a charmer.  Riad Andalla was a pleasure full of excitment and fun. Good luck guys.

My husband and I stayed at the Riad as a treat for his 30th birthday. What a fantastic time we had! The staff were always extremely friendly and welcoming. Christophe and Andre were away on holiday while we were there but Sandrine who was watching over the riad also had excellent knowledge of the area and was only too happy to make reservations for us. For my husband's birthday Sandrine and the staff bought him a lovely card and present. They even arranged for a cake as a surprise in the restaurant we ate in that night.    Rooms are compact but beautifully decorated and cleaned every day. There was a good supply of hot water and we were provided with a fresh supply of towels daily. The air conditioning in August was a must! The location of the riad to the main square could not be beaten and the views from the terrace are just amazing. It is so lovely to just sit and read while watching the food markets set up for the evening. The mint tea served at the riad could not be beaten anywhere else we went in Marrakech!    Our absolute favourite days was a cooking class at 'Les ateliers lalla Fatima' which can be booked through the riad. Fatima took us and another couple out shopping for food and spices. We then went back to her house and cooked our tagines while been given various different breads cheeses and biscuits to try. A brilliant experience!    Overall I would highly recommend staying at Riad Andalla. I have already booked my next stay for February next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 2 nights in Riad Andalla as start of our 10 day Maroc Roundtrip. It was a very pleasant stay. Warm welcome by Christophe with some good get-around-tips. From the rooftop terrace you have an excellent view on Jeema el Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emilie P wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: Amazing Ryad in an amazing location with amazing people!
Review_Text: We stayed in Ryad Andalla for a week in total (when we first arrived in Marrakesh and before heading home)  Tastefully decorated (each room with a different theme) and extremely clean this ryad has everything you need:  - an awesome terrace with direct view on Djemaa el Fna (gives you the feeling to be part of it)  - very close to the main square  (I think you ll struggle to find closer)  - great rooms ( beautiful big enough and very clean)  - very good breakfast   - good tips on what to do/not to do in Marrakesh  - nice welcoming mint tea and biscuits  - very helpful and friendly staff  Christophe and André are wonderful hosts and make your stay the most enjoyable. Their close relationship with clients and staff is the reason why you feel very well looked after. They genuinely care about making your stay as pleasant as possible.   I am shocked to read the negative comment as she is complaining about our arrival. We had just arrived in the patio it wasn't late and we were not loud and the staff was patient and caring to help her feel better.  I m sorry for her that she had a bad time there as her own experience is not reflective at all on what the ryad has to offer. Just make sure you close the seal in the shower and you won't be disturb at all by the smell!  Thanks to Christophe André and their staff for such a pleasant time!   Emilie

Review_Title: DO NOT STAY IN RIAD ANDALLA, Marrakech Medina
Review_Text: I'm a world traveler on my 2nd round-the-world trip and have visited 60 countries now. Despite the reason I booked Riad Andalla was because of the good/excellent reviews but everything was far from right for my stay and the worst experience I've ever had.    My Expedia reservation didn't specify which room I found myself checked in to the only ground floor unit which is between the kitchen and public area not far from the entrance. With the windows and door not 100% shut and facing in I could hear everything. The bathroom was stinky.    Then I went to the restaurant they recommended and vomited shortly after. I couldn't even stay in my own room to rest and/or wait for the next possible throw-up. Because the owners greeted and oriented the new guests right by my room in the public area. There is a rooftop terrace (which was highly reviewed) they could have easily invited the guests to go up to have their welcome mint tea and chat forever as there is no room right on that floor but they just had to talk outloud right by my room. They said it was only 7ish in the evening but they knew I was sick and had to rest in my room. They said it was only 30 min but there were at least two groups checked in since I told them that I was sick.    The worst part was when I expressed my problem they (mostly Christopher) showed no apology nor sympathy at all and as if it was my fault to book their Riad.    I'm so sorry about my own mistake but I want to make sure the world knows that DO NOT STAY IN RIAD ANADALLA in Marrakech Media.

We stayed for 4 nights in the Riad Andalla which was friendly jolly and welcoming from the first minute. Our hosts Sandrine and her husband (not the owners of the Riad but their friends who were baby sitting the place during august) really were incredibly friendly indeed and the place was run more like a comfortable relaxed home rather than a formal intimidating hotel. On our arrival they explained the local enviroment to us asking what we were interested in seeing so they could advise us on what to do. After 15 minutes of Sandrine explaining the map to us we were ready to go and explore with recommendations on the best places to eat and the sites to see. Our stay was very cosy with the rooms communal areas and terrace being kept impecably clean. The terrace itself had a fantastic view of the Jamal al Fnaa while being high up enough to retain a calm escape from the bustle down below. Breakfast was deliciousfresh and varied with juices jams and local breads to keep us going in the heat and often with Sandrine and her husband popping up to say hello and check that we were ok. On my birthday I was even surprised by a lovely birthday gift from Sandrine which was a really nice thoughtful touch!  Brahim and his wife (who also worked in the Riad) were also incredibly welcoming agreeing to show us how to cook a local speciality (my husband is a chef so wanted a lesson) in the Riad kitchen first taking us to the butcher demostrating the cooking process then taking us to the local hamman for our tangier (Marrakesh stew made in a ceramic pot) to be cooked in the ashes of the hamman fire.  We then came back to the Riad to discover that a place had been set for us on a table on the terrace ready for us to eat our creation! Again a very thoughtful and appreciated touch!  All in all a very pleasant stay and a Riad that I would heartily recommend for its hospitality and kindness.  Ooh and you can even get a beer or a bottle of wine on the terrace if you are missing that kind of thing!  Many Thanks Riad Andala we hope to see you again sometime but till then thanks for looking after us!  Dot and Andrew
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The Only Place I'd Consider in Marrakesh
Review_Text: It really doesn't get any better than this riad. From location to decor to attentive and friendly staff. We stayed for 3 nights and got top notch treatment at Riad Andalla. Sandrine was so sweet and friendly and went out of her way to make us comfortable in Marrakesh giving great tips on shopping dining and site seeing. She recommended a fabulous hammam too. If you're going to Marrakesh don't hesitate to book your stay at this riad. A great vibe all around.

Everything about our stay at Riad Andalla was absolutely perfect. The service was first-class and the staff went out of their way to make our stay relaxing and comfortable. Christophe was away but kept in touch by email and Sandrine and her husband went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Location ideal within 2mins of the main square rooms well decorated and spotlessly clean and the service faultless. We travelled around Morocco for 2 weeks and of all the places that we stayed from the High Atlas to Fez Riad Andalla was without question the best in all respects. We definitely hope to return! Fantastic thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked this hotel for myself and 2 friends from the reviews on TA and was not dissapointed. Christophe and Andre are the ultimate hosts funny easygoing generous welcoming and will look after you anyway they can. Christophe was fantastic with his recommendations booking hot air balloons Hammam's and cooking classes. He was also very helpful via email prior to travel to organise our stay. Andre speaks very little english however with my limited french italian laughter and wild hand waving we communicated perfectly. The location of this Riad is sensational. So close to Place Jemaa el Fna sights and great food. When we arrived I thought "Oh goodness where are we going" as the square is closed to traffic after 3pm. Therefore you walk to the Riad with a man carrying your bags in a cart you wind through some very small lanes but fear not you do arrive safety. Be aware of this if you book the driver from the airport after 3pm. After navigating the lanes a few times I almost felt like a local. I travelled through these lanes by myself at night and never questioned my safety. The rooftop terrace is a quiet oasis away from the "craziness" that is Marrekech. The Riad is 3 levels I stayed in "Chems" a room on level 2. The room was large clean air conditioned and had windows to the square. My friends stayed underneath me in "Bachahamou" and did not have any windows. The bathroom was perfect (love the shower head!) just make sure you close the shower drain after use as the smell is a little disturbing (I was told this on check in!) Valuables where safe in the Riad so much so I never locked my door the whole time I was there. The breakfast in the morning was sensational and the staff of the Riad where awesome. There is no lift in the Riad however the stairs are easy to navigate even with 2 bags full of the wonders of Marrekech. Thankyou Andre and Christophe for making my stay in Marrekech perfect - I will see you on my return to eat some more chocolate with you both! Do yourself a favour book here.

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: My wife and I both in our 60s stayed at Riad Andalla in early June 2012. We had a great time; situated close to and with rooftop views over the main square. Our room was fine well air-conditioned (it was 30 to 37 degrees whilst we were there) comfortable beds.  Christophe was away unwell and we were looked after superbly by Andre and the lovely Sandrine. They were very friendly and hospitable helped in planning our activities were very tolerant of our Aussie attempts at French (:<)) and are just great people. They have a standing invitation to visit us on the Sunshine Coast Queensland Australia.  We highly recommend Riad Andalla!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael L wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: When I'm planning to visit a place I haven't seen firsthand I wonder about different definitions of good locations. I can't overstate how ideal this location is in Marrakech. You're going to want to stay near Place Jemaa el Fna since that's the heart of the Medina and worth visiting over and over. However you're going to want to have a place to retreat to when you need some down time a place where you can get away from the noise and high energy.    Riad Andalla is absolutely perfect -- its about 50 meters into a little neighborhood. It takes about 90 seconds to walk down to the square but the Riad itself is beautiful quiet and a perfect home base.    Christophe and Andre were absolutely wonderful hosts. We sat down with Christophe to ask questions and get some info on what to see and do. All of his insights were absolutely spot on. He's got the eye of a seasoned traveler the honesty of a good friend and the knowledge of an informed local. Every time we'd see them they took great interest in how things were going and helping us out with anything we needed. We had incredible and personalized advice and we truly appreciated it.    Riad Andalla itself was absolutely beautiful three stories of wonderful design with an atrium and a fantastic rooftop terrace. It was a tremendous value and I would enthusiastically recommend it to everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful riad in the heart of Marrakech!
Review_Text: My cousin and I had a fabulous experience staying at Riad Andalla. Christophe and Andre (and other staff) were exceptional hosts; welcoming and very helpful! They recommended a great restaurant for us to try and made the arrangements for our trip down to the desert. The location just off Place Jemaa el Fna is perfect. It's in the heart of the city and walking distance from almost everything. The Riad is located on a quiet alley which is a great escape from the hectic streets around. The rooftop terrace overlooks Place Jemaa el Fna and provides incredible views. Every inch of the Riad is decorated beautifully and the rooms are a good size and clean (Kamar the blue room is beautiful and peaceful)!    We had an amazing time in Marrakech many thanks to our hosts! We highly recommend staying at Riad Andalla.

Review_Date: Ben R wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: It was a pleasure to stay in Riad Andalla. We spent 6 nights here and loved every minute. From the moment we entered the Riad we were greeted with a huge smile and offered great advice regarding our stay in Marrakech. Christophe is an amazing host and really did make our stay that even better. The room was well sized and well designed with a great sense of security. The decoration is amazing and the atmosphere cannot be faulted. We spent many a night sat reading on the roof terrace admiring the fast paced Marrakech down below probably the best views you can get in Marrakech! The room rate includes a free breakfast which was simple but did the job. I would highly recommend this Riad to anyone staying in Marrakech and i am sure il be back one day. Be sure to visit Pepenero whilst in Marrakech (as recommended by Christophe) as this is some of the best food we have ever eaten!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve K wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: Riad Andalla - Best value for money in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here in April 2012. We were met at the airport and taken to the Riad. Located right next to the main square the location could not have been better - certainly very easy to find. The rooms were great clean and well presented and very quiet at night. No buzzing motorbikes or noise from kids in street which has kept me awake at night in other riads.  The terrace was fantastic - the brilliant view over the square was a treat.  Hosts Christopher and Andre were so friendly and helpful we really could not have wished for more. They arranged taxis restaurants day trip to waterfalls. The perfect hosts. (They even serve nice wine and local beer).  Having stayed in a number of riads in Marrakech this one really stands out as the absolute best value for money.  Look no further you wont find better for price/location/hospitality.  When next in Marrakech I wont be staying anywhere else.

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We spent three nights at the Riad Andalla and cannot say how grateful we were for the wonderful atmosphere that Christophe and Andre have created in their Riad. They gave some fantastic tips for restaraunts and an indication of the best way to get around the city. Despite a mishap with the room Andre did his absolute best to make sure we were comfortable.

Review_Title: Really made us feel at home
Review_Text: My friend and I were travelling to Marrakech for the first time and spotted Riad Andalla on TripAdvisor - what a great find it was!    As soon as we arrived Christophe made us feel right at home. The tips he and Andre provided for sightseeing food and generally keeping safe in Marrakech were spot on. Also as two girls on our own Christophe really looked after us making sure all the arrangements we made for the trips we had planned were in place and everyone knew where to be at what time. Our time in Morocco included a visit to Essaoiura; on our return to Riad Andalla Andre gave us the best welcome back ; wanting to know all about our trip and providing more tips for our last night in Marrakech.    On a practical note both of the two rooms we stayed in were clean and extremely well appointed providing everything we needed. The roof terrace was truly lovely with amazing views over the square - perfect for gazing over at breakfast (just right to set us up for the day) or for time out with a coffee in the afternoon.    All in all we had a really fantastic time at Riad Andalla it really was a home from home and definitely hope to return!

We came in on May 19 2012 for 4 nights scattered in our 10 days in Marrakech. We took the transfer (15euros) to the riad because the riad is in the alleys we didnt want to waste time getting lost on the first day but its actually easy to find. If you want to save 15 euros for the tansfer: take taxi to the jemma el fna (deal about 100 dirhams) ask to be dropped in front on cafe de france if they cant do it (impossible in afternoon) walk all the way to cafe de france from the horse carriages where they will drop you. Cafe de france is big has roof terreaces red coca cola shades u cant miss it. From taxi/horse carriage its not even 5 minutes walk. Once to cafe de france on the jemma el fna turn right at the black "pepe nero" sign ( the sign is at eye level between restaurant chegrouni and cafe de france cannot miss it) not even one minute later turn to your right into the alley BEFORE the shop "brins d'orient" in the alley you will see a restaurant sign you are on the right way take the first to your right again at the end there is a door #17 with an arrow to the right follow the arrow to your right at the end of the alley there is a brown door with a small inscription "REAL" turn left and you are there its a dead end take the door on your left handside there in a brass hand on top of the wood door written Riad Andalla. From the cafe de france to the riad it takes 2 minutes if you walk normally and u just saved a few euros: that much more to spend in the souks or to eat on the jemma.    The riad is very homey nothing luxurious but you feel welcomed with Christophe and André 2 frenchmen holding the riad. We thought their service was excellent. For the price you get to have free breakfast a roof terrasse right over jemma el fna close to cafe de france which is good because all the drivers from our excursions asked us to wait for them there for pick up early in the morning. There are no curfiew the doorman stays at the door to make sure you are back before he closes the door. The ladies of the riad are very pleasant and the cook is very nice also.    We had total 3 different rooms during our stay all of them simple basic no tv no phone no windows to the outside world but we didnt need it: theres a cool roof terrace with plenty of space to chill out. We had air conditioning which seemed to be set at 28 degres it felt more like a fan but we slepts well we were so tired the beds were confortable we had hot water. There was a smell in thebathroom in one of our rooms i believe its because of the way they built the houses there. Nothing major but we could have done without. The riad was clean it felt safe: we left all our luggage and our purchases there while away for 2 days at a time to go to the desert and to essaouira.    Riad Andalla is a great spot for marrakech close to everything. No mistakes staying here. We loved it.    Un grand MERCI Christophe André et toute votre equipe: Adbou Saaida Atika Jmiya & Ibrahim.    Signé 2 vietnamiens du Canada au Maroc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Valerie W wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is beautiful and impecably done yet not formal or stuffy. The staff is friendly and helpful and everyone - even the other guests - makes you feel at home. Christphe greeted us and gave us insider tips and recommendations to have the best experience in Marrakech. The location next to Jamaa el Fna was extremely convenient.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brit C wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Myself my husband and two of our friends booked a trip to Marrakesh knowing nothing about it. We picked Riad Andalla because of it's proximity to the Djemma el Fna and the good reviews. We were not disappointed - not for a moment. From the easy pick-up at the airport (highly recommended) to the rooftop view overlooking the market; from the comfy bed to the AMAZING service - Christophe and Andre treated us like not just guests but friends . They imparted all their knowledge to us: from where to go swimming to where to get a good shave (from "the barbier") to where to eat dinner (Pepe Nero!!) and which Hammam to try (couldn't get in cause it was so busy but looked gorgeous - Les Bains de Marrakesh). Their numerous recommendations took the guesswork out of planning our days and left us with plenty of time to explore the many wonders of the city. Our favorite part of everyday was coming back to our air-conditioned rooms taking a luxurious shower and sipping drinks on the terrace while watching the sunset over the Medina. I knew nothing of Marrakesh before I arrived but feel like I had the trip of a lifetime in no small part to the Christophe Andre and their lovely staff. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: maureen g wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Everyone at the riad was exceptionally helpful and welcoming. Abdul was particularly superb always available to assist us and very hard working. As other reviewers have noted the location near the main square couldn't be better. Breakfast is included and is simple coffee and bread.  We ate at the riad the first night and it was OK. Don't stay here if you are claustrophobic because the rooms are very very small and without outward looking windows.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I searched on TA for a small Riad to stay for a 4 night stay and finally decided on Riad Andalla. So pleased I choose this place - its amazing.  From booking last October to then the stay at the end of April then departing after 4 nights - everything was superb. Christophe and his team are great hosts. Helped us from start to finish. Its a must to ask for a pick up from the airport - you would never find it by your self! All the little streets and alley ways are a mystery!  Christophe welcomed us with mint tea and also then gave us details of places to eat and more importantly places NOT to eat! Stall no1 in the market was superb and very cheap.  A car and driver took us to the Atlas Mountains for the day which was good fun and well organised.  Abdul (the night porter) was great at his job and always smiled and greeted us with a friendly face. His mint tea is amazing!  The views from the roof terrace across to Djemma el Fna are to die for.  Looking forward to a return trip hopefully next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I loved this place. Its nice and close to the square it is simply beautiful and the hosts and service were second to none. Very friendly very helpful and we felt very much at home. We also had a meal here one evening which was fantastic - highly recommend it. We also arranged via reception for a driver to take us out to the Atlas mountains and this was at a reasonable price and a great english speaking guide who was very pfofessional. All in all a great riad. And the view from the terrace is also wonderful - we spent a good few hours sitting up there watching the sun set/rise and all the action below in djamma el fna.

Review_Title: Lovely riad in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: The Riad Andalla is not only situated very close to the Place El Fna - its owners have also created a great home for travellers. The rooms are very cosy and comfortable the staff is very friendly and helpful and the food is very good. You get helpful tips on what to do and see during your stay. We enjoyed our stay very much and hope to return soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic location, beautiful building and superb host!
Review_Text: Several things make Riad Andalla so amazing.  Firstly it is ideally located 5 minutes walk from the Djemma el Fna in the Medina. It's really handy to be so close to the action and there are a lot of things to see and do (including the souks) within a very short walk. There is a little bit of noise in some rooms from the square so take earplugs if you're a light sleeper. We were also woken at 04.15 every day by the call to prayer from the mosques though I imagine this would be the case at any place in the Medina. The Riad also felt very safe; you have to knock to enter and the staff will let you in.  Secondly the building itself is beautiful. The central courtyard (ground floor) is lovely with lots of little areas to sit in. The bedrooms are spacious very clean and comfy and beautifully decorated. My group had four rooms in total - large group - and all were individually decorated and a bit special! Most importantly the roof terrace is AMAZING! It looks right out onto the Djemma el Fna and it's fascinating to sit up there at breakfast and dusk to watch the character of the square changing.  Last but not least is the personal touch and extraordinary welcome from the owner Christophe and all of his staff. When we arrived (very early before our rooms were ready) we were given mint tea and biscuits on the roof terrace and Christophe gave us the lowdown on Marrakech. He recommended restaurants (good ones and ones to avoid) told us about good places to visit how much taxis should cost how to barter in the souks where to get a good hammam etc etc. He also booked us a restaurant one night and a hammam the next day (Isis - very good). Nothing was too much trouble for him and his staff and the advice he gave us really gave our trip a special edge.  I'd go back there in a flash and have been recommending Riad Andalla to all of my friends.

This was our first trip to Marrakech but we were made to feel completely at ease in a new culture. Christophe (the owner) organised transfers from the airport to the Riad which helped as we wouldn't have found it without help! We were welcomed with mint tea and cookies on the roof terrace and our luggage taken to our room. Christophe talked us through the places to visit provided us with maps and told us the best/safest routes so we wouldn't get lost. He also told us rough price guides that we should haggle to so we didn't pay over the odds.    We ordered a meal for the first night so we didn't have to worry about finding a place to eat and it was by far the best meal we had in Marrakech. I would thoroughly recommend eating at least once in the Riad it is a truly wonderful experience on the rooftop. Christophe also recommends other good places to eat for all price ranges despite them serving food at the Riad and offers to book tables for you.    The room was spotless and we had no problems whatsoever (make sure you put the plug down after showers like they say). We had a little trouble with the wifi at first but once we found the right place to sit it worked fine! Breakfast on the roof terrace each morning was magical and Abdul (the night porter) couldn't have done any more to help - despite the language barrier. The Riad was in a perfect location for visiting ALL of Marrakech and we would absolutely return! I would recommend it to everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Riad with a warm welcome
Review_Text: This was such an amazing place to stay on our first visit to Marrakech. Christophe organised a taxi from the airport then a guide (with a barrow for our luggage) to lead us to the riad. We would never have found it on our own! However it is in a really good position close to Djemaa al-anfa and all the sights of the Medina. The view from the beautifully furnished terrace of the square and the snow capped Atlas mountains to the south is hypnotic. We spent a long time just gazing at it all in amazement. Christophe's advice about how to get around what to see and what to avoid was invaluable and meant we made the most of our visit. Breakfast on the terrace served by the charming Abdul was delicious and varied a little each day. We also had dinner at the riad on our first night and that was very good too. Our room was prettily decorated but was a tad small for us and all our stuff so when I return I would try to book a slightly bigger one. As others have said all the team were cheery and helpful - we really felt at home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The location of this riad is excellent. its very close to the main square and has a lovely roof top terrace where they serve a great free breakfast. While you are eating breakfast you can watch the merchants setting up for the day. At night the view of the square is amazing! Its also very close to the beginning of the souks. You must try the fresh orange juice in the square it is amazing! The raid is tucked away from the main road so you have to navigate a few small street/alleys to get there. We arranged transportation with Christophe to pick us up at the airport and they took us all the way to the riad which was excellent because I dont know if i would have found the place on our own. Christophe and the staff are fantastic and welcomed us with amazing mint tea. He answered all our questions and was very helpful. The staff were always smiling and although there are no real locks on the rooms i never felt unsafe. You have to buzz into the riad to be let in which is a nice safety feature. Its very quiet relaxing and beautiful. There was always pleanty of hot water and our 3 person suite was amazing (90 Euros/night). When we checked out Christophe give each of us a nice thank you metal bookmark which was a nice surprise. I highly recommend the Riad Andalla.

I could not find any faults about this Riad. Location wise it is absolutely just a stone throw away from Djemaa al-afna . And like the other reviews about the staff here they are truly a very admirable team. Always friendly and dependable. I must thank Christophe for having such a great staff as well as being a wonderful host. I enjoyed staying at this Riad. I never felt like a tourist because Christophe made us very comfortable and the place always inviting and quiet amidst the chaotic daily life outside the Riad. The Riad is beautifully decorated with a wonderful roof top terrace over looking the square... Magnificent view at night and day time as the Medina and the square come to life.  I must say the best cup of Mint tea I've ever drank was from Riad Andalla! Thank you for opening your Riad to the world Chritophe... and many thanks for your tips....

Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: Fanastic view of the medina, amazing location
Review_Text: The location of the Riad is fanastic the staff are unsurpassable in their friendly welcomes and Christophe is a wonderful host.    The views from the roof terrace where breakfast is served are amazing. We also really enjoyed watching the medina come to life in the early evening from the roof terrace then throwing oursleves in knowing that we only had a two minute walk to escape - it really makes a huge difference to your stay.    There are no locks on the room doors & the loud housekeeping staff mean that afternoon snoozes are out but otherwise a really fantastic Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were really welcomed into Riad Andalla. The location is like no other. They made our stay so welcoming and the decore was beautiful. We were even upgraded for our last night to a suite!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Couldn't ask for a better introduction to Marrakech! Room was spot on breakfast fab recommendations were perfect!! Mint tea Super Duper! Location amazing!!!! we felt like it was or home! All staff were perfect! Top marks and big hugs to all x x x x cant wait to come back!

It was a great pleasure to stay at the Riad Andalla for anyone reading this.. i have never felt more welcome and at home Christophe is fantastic host who will personally sit down with you and pass you his tailored recommendations what to eat but more importantly were.. everyone has heard of stomach issues from marrakesh.. but his tips couldnt have been better a* :) As it was my 1st time in the medina i was told what to do what to look out for what to see just some gd advice and i had a great time also special note to the staff... so friendly.. and the tea u cant beat it..i spent most of my time on the terrace reading in the afternoons even though ur right above the square u do feel a sense of distance and privacy. but the andalas location cannot be beaten i went by myself for a weekend and i came back in great spirits! shokran

We had a lovely stay at the Riad Andalla it is in a fabulous location close to the Djema el Fna with a fantastic roof terrrace which lets you look over the square but from the peace and quiet of the riad. It was a great spot for breakfast and even better for the dinner we had the first night and it was the best chicken tajine we had during our entire stay! Christophe and his team were excellent giving some really good suggestions for places to eat hamam and other useful tips (such as how much to pay for taxis). The rooms themselves are small (as is the nature of the type of accomodtion) however we were not expecting the type of accomodation you may get in a large hotel outside of the medina we preferred the more authentic marrakechi experience. Would definately choose to stay here again if/when we visit Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniel H wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: We had a great stay at Riad Andalla Christophe and his staff were fantastic hosts. The recomendations made by christophe were always spot on and he provided excellent local knowledge of all the best places to visit. The riad itself is in a great location but felt nicely distanced from the hussle and bussle of Djemaa el Fna. The terrace was a good place for breakfast and dinner was by far the best meal we had in Marrakech.    We will definitely be going back!    Dan & Jade
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: connor b wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: Riad Andalla offers authentically decorated rooms and a very nice view of the place Djemaa El Fna. The terrasse is definitely a highlight. The crew were always very friendly and helpful giving useful tips and advices. We couldn't pick a better place for exploring Marrakech - being well located and at the same time having the possibility of escaping the hectic.    Many thanks to Christophe and his team - we come back ... inchallah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fredy L wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: Happy & proud to be the first two filipinos to stay at RIAD ANDALLA!!
Review_Text: I & my friend are both happy & proud to be the first two filipinos to stay at RIAD ANDALLA & we are of course inviting more filipinos & tourist around the world to stay here because aside from the good location you will also enjoy a good value of your money because the service is personalized & excellent!!! from the owners to the housekeepers.. they're all very friendly & nice making as feel we are home (away from home) Staying in Andalla is wonderful especially if you want to live like a moroccan & understand their culture. The Andalla is such a tranquil place with beautiful rooms (Thanks to the owners for upgrading us to a suite room) & my favorite part is waking up every morning having a breakfast at their panoramic terrace overlooking the treasures of the medina!!! Let me add that they serve a very good Morrocan dinner too.. so you can book ahead of time if you want to try their sumptous cuisine!! Enjoy Morocco & be sure to book at Riad Andalla!!

So I went to Marrakesh to propose to my girlfriend ( she said yes by the way so is now technically my fiancée ) . I had planned to go the Atlas mountains but before wanted to show her the hustle and bustle of the heart of Marrakesh . After reading reviews on here I chose the Andalla and boy was it the best choice I made. My job means I travel all around the world and I have stayed in a lot of hotels and I can pretty much afford to say anywhere I want. If you are looking for a Hilton or a marriot this is not it . This is far better. It’s a taste of an authentic Moroccan experience. First of all to get to the Riad you go through these winding side streets . ( our driver from the airport  arranged by the riad knew exactly where to take us ) . Felt like i was in an Indiana Jones movie . When we got to the hotel we were greeted by the owner Christoph. He was really friendly and made the place feel like home straight away. The room we stayed in was beautifully decorated . Again this isnt a Hilton so no TV or marble floor but it was clean and very chic and more than I hoped for. Christoph and Abdulla were great they knew all the best / safe places to eat and go. Walking with Christoph in the main square was like walking with a celeb . Everyone stopped to shake his hand or give him a cheeky salute. I definitely felt like I was connected. But the Pièce de résistance ( see my French is getting better Christoph :)) was the roof Terrace that over looked the Djemaâ el Fna: The view is breath-taking and gives the opportunity to take a step back and people watch without being in the mix. ( Check out pics on the website it actually looks like the photo ) . Breakfast was great up on the terrace and the crepes and mint tea was amazing. ( Abdul the night watcher  made the best Mint tea I had in Marrakesh all week .. he had a special recipe only he knew . It was really addictive a must try if you stay there. ) All in all I would go back in a heart beat. We both missed the banter views and hospitality we received at the Andalla after we left. If you have read this far down my review. My last bit of advice is to you is book now you won’t regret it . It’s my best find on Trip advisor so far. Thanks again Christoph and the rest of the staff for a trip we won’t ever forget. See you for our 10 year anniversary .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad Andalla is perfectly situated in the heart of the Medina just moments from the Djema El Fna. The terrace has an amazing view of the square which changes as the day goes on into night and the square turns into a open air restaurant where you can eat very well for very little money.  The Andalla is immaculate - clean and fresh - the staff very helpful and accommodating but Christophe and Andre are the most delightful owners of the little piece of heaven amid the madness that is Marrakesh!!!  We were made to feel so welcomed when we arrived and felt like we had know them for ever. Both me and my friend fell in love with them both. Their personality's and attention to detail and willingness to make your stay as easy as possible is truly something that is rare - especially in tourism!  There are no keys at the Andalla so the responsibility of that "ol chestnut of who has and where are the keys" etc. It really is a home from home.  Nothing is too much trouble all staff are kind and caring and very friendly.  I am going to be 50 this year and I have to say the stairs were not a problem for me and I found the rooms delightful in fact the whole place is full of lovely trinkets and artifacts something to please the eye without being over the top . The bathrooms are finished in the traditional style of Tadklact which is used in the Hammams it stops the steam to penetrate the walls and cause damp. It is a beautiful traditional and silky finish that is also easy to keep clean The toilets do not smell but on the whole the drainage system in Marrakesh is a bit smelly so it is important to pop the shower plug down with your foot when finished to prevent any whiff!!!!!!!!
