You can eat at the Andalla traditional Tajine and Couscous etc - breakfast is simple and nice and served with a lovely welcome. There are many lovely restaurants that Christoph will point you in the right direction or organize reservations.  Quite simply I have nothing bad to say about the Andalla it was Ab Fab !!!!!

Review_Date: kirsti j wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: Although situated in the heart of the medina Riad Andalla itself was an unexspected peacful place filled with good energy! The riad gave a shelter from the facinating activity on Djema El-Fna and the colourful souks. While the exquisite terrace on the roof provided a connection both to the busy world as well as the mighty Atlas mountains in the distance. The riad was clean and delicate and filled with art and beautiful objects and the intimate atmosphere made it easy to mingle with the hosts and the other gests. Both breakfast and the quality of the service was excellent. We will recommend Andalla to all good spirited people visiting Marrakech. Thank you very much Christophe & André!

If you want 5 star luxury then go elsewhere but if you want 6 star friendliness helpfulness ambiance and location then there is no better place than Riad Andalla. From the moment we arrived to the second we left we felt so at home - Christophe and Andre the owners are so helpful and knowledgable about what to do where to go where to eat and general information. They booked trips restaurant spa and taxis and never let us down. Their staff (special mention to Abdul) are great and help in every way. The location is fantastic - from the leovely roof terrace you can see right over the main square and see it come to life by day and then change in the evening.  I cannot rate this place highly enough and would recommend it without hesitation
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dr Ashiq Patel wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: good location if you want to be in the midst of the madness of the Djama al fana. Not recommended for people over the age of 50 (stairs are huge) over 60kg weight( bathrooms are very small - especially toilet and stinky as shower stalls are not tiled and retain moisture & hence the smell) taller than 5'6" ( rooms and bed are tiny). Staff especially Abdou were great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice riad and very friendly owners
Review_Text: We stayed for two nights at this riad very well located near Marrakech's main square. And for all our outings into de medina it was the best. The riad is well managed both the owners and all the staff are extremely nice and helpful. By far the best feature is the roof terrace where they serve breakfast and you could just lounge there all day under the sun reading a book and being very very happy. The rooms are ok but some are very small I guess for the price one can't ask for more really. Had a little hazzle with their arraged transport because at pickup it arrived late and bringing us to the airport made us walk unnecessarily too long dragging our bags. Other than that all the other recommendations we got from Christophe were excellent.

I work in Juba South Sudan and was looking for a break. I didn't have much time to get plan my trip before leaving but it was never an issue as Christophe and his team were attentive to my booking requests always prompt to respond and helped make all the arrangements for pick-up upon arrival in Marrakech dinner preparation day trips spa reservations etc. It's a place that makes you feel like home away form home: people welcome you with wide smiles call you by your name sit down with you to ask how your day was and will help you figure out how to have the most amazing time in Marrakech no matter what you want to do. In fact Christophe and/or his team will personally sit down with each new guest to give them a run down of Marrakech help you figure out the good places to check out help book excursions spas restaurants and anything else. It's family. I ended up getting a cold/flu while there and Christophe and his team promptly offered me hot tea and medicine. The place is smack dab in the middle of the action but when you enter the Riad it's peace and quiet. Rooms are on the smaller side but a very artfully decorated and give you a homely cozy feel. This place attracts good wholesome people who often spend their evenings hanging out in the lounge area sharing stories of the day's travels. Honestly don't waste your time looking for anything else - you simply will NOT be disappointed.

We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Marrakech that was made extra special by Christophe and his wonderful team at Riad Andalla - they were like a second family to us. We especially appreciated Christophe's orientation chat and advice on sight-seeing and safe places to eat. As other reviews have already stated the Riad is fabulously located just moments off the square and within easy reach of just about everything but what makes it extra special is the care and attention that Christophe Andre and their team lavish on their guests without being intrusive.    We fully intend to return to Marrakech and will definitely book at Riad Andalla again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I really recommend the Riad Andalla as a super great place to stay in Marrakesh. The location is amazing - you can feel the old city - Medina very clean beautiful and cosy place the staff is sooooooo nice (thanks for all Abdul!) and Christofer like a old friend - he is able to arrange everything we need. I'm sure I'll go back to Marrakesh and for sure I will stay with them again!

Review_Title: The view from the terrace is wonderful
Review_Text: This is my second trip to Marrakesh and I did not hesitate to book Riad Andalla again. You do compromise on the space and comfort in the rooms for the terrace and its views but it is well worth it. I also know if it had the same room standards as some of the other Riads combined with the view then I would not be able to afford it.    The roof terrace is fantastic. To sit and watch the square is very special. However my favourite time is watching the sun come up over the mountains and the first light hitting the square as it comes to life. For me this is simply magic. Follow this by one of the best breakfast we have received in Morocco and there is simply no better way to start the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The Riad Andalla--Our Home Away from Home
Review_Text: What a wonderful experience! The Riad Andalla run by the delightful knowledgeable and personable Christophe and Andre (with wonderful help from Abdul and the staff) is located a short walk from the Jemaa El Fna. It is as others have noted amazingly quiet and tranquil--a wonderful respite from the mayhem and adventure that is the Souk and the Square (replete with snake charmers with flutes--and cobras food stalls and zillions of people).The rooms common area and terrace are beautifully appointed with Moroccan paintings painted doors pottery rugs furniture and antiques giving an authentic ambience. But practically speaking the location is superb the breakfasts are delciious there was always lots of hot water and we received wonderful suggestions and help for our itinerary in Marrakech--including restaurant suggestions a cooking class the best hammam in town a trip with car and driver to the Atlas mountains best museums and sights a glass of wine when we wanted one and a tasty tagine in the Riad one evening after a tiring day trouping all over town. We hope we have the opportunity to be in Marrakech again--and to stay at the Riad Andalla. We liked Christophe and Andre so much we invited them to visit us! About us: we travel all over the world for business--and pleasure--so we think we're good at recognizing great people and great places to stay. The Riad Andalla makes our list! Lots of languages are spoken well here and they will arrange for transportation from the airport (recommended for first time visitors to get your bearings).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: So welcoming so peaceful so calm so clean. Basically amazing. Christophe and Andre are certainly doing everything right true professionals in their hospitality. Can not leave out Abdul a real pleasure to meet him. Ideal location the roof terrace view well you've seen the photos.

Review_Title: Close to the action but far enough away!
Review_Text: We booked the Riad from the recommendations on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed.  Christophe is an absolute star!  He was our travel agent and PA the whole time we were there. Nothing was too much trouble for him and he gives you his mobile number!!    We arrived Christmas Eve having traversed the main square and it's madness to the lovely calm of Riad Andella.    The room was lovely - compact but with everything we needed.    The Roof Terrace - just perfect. A great view of the main square. You can listen and absorb the atmosphere from the comfort of the terrace. Breakfast also served here which was just what was needed to start your day off.    The restuarant recommendations by Christophe are spot on. Listen to him! Pepe Nero = no 1.    All the staff are lovely and friendly even if we had a little language barrier with no French!!    You will no be disappointed. It ticks every box!    If we ever go back to Marrakech we will stay with Christophe!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After spending less than half an hour at Riad Andalla we booked two more nights for the end of our week in Morocco.  Not only is the place beautiful it is absolutely spotlessly clean - I would challenge anybody to find a speck of dust!  Perhaps Andalla's biggest asset however is Christophe and his fantastic team. We felt like we were part of the family. I cannot recommend this fantastic place highly enough Christophe could charge twice the money and it would still be a good deal!

If you like the idea of a riad where you effectively have your own space within a community or maybe even a family.. then you will love this peaceful tranquil and welcoming place within two minutes walk of the craziness of the Jamaal El Fna square offering a great counterbalance to it.    Christophe and Andre are two of lifes animated characters and could not have been more friendly and helpful. Being used to travelling for business myself and my special companion found a great deal of pleasure in the human contact that a riad brings instead of the impersonal "service" offered by so many chain hotels. Christophe takes a great deal of time with every guest to make sure they get all they can from Marrakech and the surrounding areas..I recommend you take him up on his suggestions as we did and were certainly not disappointed.    Found the Andalla through tripadvisor and am happy to report that it lives up to the positive reviews of the users...Well priced spotlessly clean and a great team.  Thanks guys we will definately be back when we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nancy R wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: As many have noted the Riad Andalla is a wonderful place to stay. I completely agree but would like to add a different perspective. There was a family emergency back home and we had to cut our trip short.    Christophe Abdou and all of the others could not have been more sympathetic and compassionate. I will always remember their great kindness and consideration. This is indeed a special place and these are special people. They are warm funny generous and extremely kind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad Andalla is a beautiful hotel ideally located for the square Djema el Fna. Even though it is located close to the square it is in a quiet place and as soon as you enter the establishment you feel a sense of tranquil and serenity which lets you rest from the hustle and bustle of this busy square.  The hotel is wonderfully decorated in a typical Morrocon style and the view of the square from the terrasse is absolutely stunning.  But as it is always said it is the people that make a place and this is very true of the Riad Andalla. Christophe and Andre along with their staff member are all very welcoming and very friendly.  We spent a wonderful four days there and we would gladly come back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: My second time, and its even better
Review_Text: This was the second time I visited the Riad Andalla and it just gets better and better.    The only challenge is to actually get booked a room. The owners and hosts André and Christophe has become very popular with their lovely welcoming place of residence very close to the great and famous place Jamaa El Fna.    I feel at home and are looked upon as an Arab prince.    Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace or inside with the other guests. The atmosphere and Christophe André creates is special in a particular country. Here you are safe and this is your home in Marrakech.    I recommend this place to anyone going to Morocco. Enjoy I did.  (They even pick you up from the airport and you pay at the riad)

Review_Date: Rui L wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: A place where the door is always open. Like home. Where the tea is special like the people who carefully prepare it. Leaning to the 'big square' it´s so quiet at night as it is lively in the terrace delicious mornings. From here you leave to explore and you came back to restore.  It's so simple to be good. Christophe and Abdul two names to be bookmarked.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Smith Q wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: a rich experience an amazing and unique service and Abdul cristofer and all the Andalla are special people...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandra L wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: Location Location Location....    If the Djemaa el Fna is the heart of Marrakech then Riad Andalla is where you can feel the pulse. We observed the Djeema from the roof terrace of the Andalla then within minutes were down in the square immersed in the atmosphere the food stalls the souks the entertainers. Then when the craziness of the Djeema became overwhelming we retreated to the sanctuary and sanity of the Andalla ;-).    Like a wave life in the Djeema started at a gradual pace in the morning gained momentum during the day and rose to a crescendo every night. The opportunity to observe the morning call to prayer from the roof terrace was surreal.    Accomodation is comfortable and immaculately clean service excellent and friendly and breakfast on the roof terrace was exquisite. A selection of good-value authentic moroccan food stalls/cafes/restaurants were recommended by Christophe and Andre. They also arranged a trip to the Oulrika Valley where the scenery was eye-poppingly gorgeous.

Our party of four senior citizens booked two rooms in Raid Andalla In October 2011. We wanted our once in a lifetime trip to Marrakech to be memorable. It could not have been better. Our rooms were charming and of course spotlessly clean. Breakfast on the roof top was a daily pleasure. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for a short Moroccan break for three nights in mid November.    The Riad is excellently located close to the main Djemaa el Fna square. The Riads rooms were very comfortable. Breakfast normally served on the roof terrace which has excellent views of the square was served inside in the beautiful courtyard in the centre if the RIad whilst we stayed as it was a little wet and cold.    What really made this Riad stand out though was the friendly and thoughtful service that we received throughout our stay. Christophe & Andre who own the Riad gave some great recommendations and were happy to book restaurants and spas for us. They were more than accommodating with any requests and we even received an upgrade after returning for our final night from a three day trip to the Atlas Mountains and Dessert. We were well looked after in the evenings by Abdul who made us some amazing Berber tea one night.    After the hustle and bustle of the city each day this was a welcome oasis to relax unwind and recharge.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gareth W wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: We absolutley loved the Riad Andalla we arrived at night to a buzzing main square and the Riad was a 30 sec walk from all the action. Despite being so close to the stalls and souks it was a peacefull clean classy place that was well above our expectations. Christophe and his team couldn't have been more helpfull and welcoming. After a day wandering around Marrakech we decided to get adventourous and headed to the desert mountains and coast and the Riad organised all of this at very reasonable rates. It was a home from home. Any time we wanted a drink or anything at all it was no problem. It relaay added to our holiday and I couldn't recommend it highly enough. Gareth & Lindsay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great and relaxing stay at Riad Andalla
Review_Text: The rooftop terrace has outstanding views of the square and the mosque. The rooms and the hotel are beautifully decorated and finished to a high standard. Ideally located a stone's throw from the square souqs and central to all the tourist attractions you would want to see.  The best part about the Riad though was the friendly and warm welcome we received from Christophe and his staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing !!! Location , ambience and fantastic service !!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and i stayed here for 4 nights and wish we could have stayed longer  from the moment we arrived  we were greeted by the most genuine and friendliest hotelier we have ever encountered ! We felt welcome and at home . The riad is amAzing  the roof terrace and the views are fantastic  the staff especially Abdul cant do enough for you ! We enjoyed the calm and tranquillity after the hustle and bustle of the square . The rooms are beautiful  and the vibe is relaxed . We will return to Morocco and we will Book Riad Andalla again ! Also it was our anniversary and we booked last minute  got a free upgrade and a last minute pick up from the airport ! Thanks so much for a wonderful stay !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A great place to stay in Marrakesh, everything was perfect!
Review_Text: I spent 4 days at riad Andalla with my boyfriend. We loved everything!  The location is amazing just fews steps and you are in the fabulous place Djemaa El-Fna; all the other attractions are on a walking distance. Warm welcome of André and Christophe the owners and staff very friendly with us. They gave us lots of suggestions to visit Marrakesh they also help us to book the Hamman and eventually the restaurant. Abdoul a member of the staff has always accompanied our abundant breakfast with his good humour and prepared us a unique tea with is secret recipe  The magnific terrace a really painstaking job look directly on the place. After a walking day around Marrakesh was really relaxing having a break on the terracelooking to the sunset on the place Djemaa El-Fna that started to get ready for the evening.  We also had dinner at the riad that was absolutely delightful both for the meal and the atmosphere.  The room have everything you need and the deco of the riad is very cosy.  thank you Christophe & André we hope to come back soon to visit you and Marrakesh and obviously we will stay again at Riad Andalla!L.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sthlm S wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: We were recommended Riad Andalla for our stay in Marrakech and now after staying there for 3+1 nights we have only good things to say about this place.  The owner Christophe and his staff are very welcoming and service minded. They really make you feel at home from the moment you enter the riad.  At the arrival you get all the information needed routines at the riad places to goto taxi fares.  The location is excellent with a view over both Jamaa al Fna and the Atlas mountains.  The calls for prayers 5 o' clock in the morning can be annoying but you will hear him from anywhere in the city.  The rooms are very nice and tasteful decorated each in a different color.    Thank you Christophe with staff!

Review_Title: Great stay but not for everyone!
Review_Text: Let me start off by explaining why the RIad Andalla is not for everyone!    If you are the kind of person who thinks that a holiday is about flying off somewhere "exotic sounding" but you don't really care where as you just spend your time sunbathing by the pool then the Riad Andalla is not for you!    If your ideal holiday is an "all you can eat and drink resort" so you can get drunk every night then the Riad Andalla is not for you!    If your ideal holiday accomodation is an identikit hotel chain where you wake up and could be in Marrakech Montreal Manchester or Milan you guessed it the Riad Andalla is not for you!    On a slightly more serious note a Riad is a traditional Moroccan house which means no lifts so if you are someone with reduced mobility then you may struggle here. They do have a ground floor room and I am sure the staff would bring your breakfast to the ground floor but part of the attraction here is the view from the roof terrace.    Christophe and his team at the Riad Andalla are fantastic. When we checked in he drew us a map of the area (the Riad entrance is on a back street - but never felt dangerous in any way) and suggested a number of things to see and do the only let down for me was one of the restaurant suggestions which as you can see here on Tripadvisor    http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Restaurant_Review-g293734-d1119599-Reviews-Dar_Essalam-Marrakech.html    has shall we say mixed reviews - if I have time I will add my review of the restaurant.    In all our time nothing was too much trouble for the staff and when was the last time you stayed in a hotel and the owner gave you his mobile phone number in case of problems?    If I had to be a tiny bit picky then the rooms could have used some extra storage space. Also the wi-fi was a bit slow and sometimes stopped working (if that sort of thing is important to you).    Apart from the fantastic staff the highlight for me was the afore mentioned roof terrace. Sitting up there having breakfast or watching the sun go down over the Jamaa el Fna amazing!    Overall really enjoyed our stay and would gladly return in the future.

Review_Date: Stefan H wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is much more than just a Riad! Perfect location close to the main square and yet very quiet very nice roof terrace great clean rooms tasty breakfast and a very warm welcome. On top of that the owners are really nice and helpful they gave us fantastic recommendations for dining places Hamman and a trip to the desert and helped with organizing it. This amazing help made our entire stay in Morocco really really good - what we did and saw would have been very difficult or impossible without them.  Highly recommended - and many thanks again to Christoph Andre and Abdul from the Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thank you so much to the owners Christophe and Andre for looking after us so wonderfully during our 4 night stay in Marrakech in September. Couldn't have asked for more from the moment we stepped into Riad Andalla we were well looked after and indeed were told by the owners "our home is your home". Fantastic location about 60 seconds from Jemaa el-Fna and nothing is too much trouble for the hosts who can give a recommendation for anything from day trips to spas and restaurants. They gave us the most fabulous recommendation to eat at Pepineros (we did so twice in 4 nights!) - one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. Enjoy this hidden gem in a busy bustling vibrant wonderful city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose Riad Andalla from the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. All we can say is that they are all true - and more. Christophe Andre and the team went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and memorable as possible.  The Riad is stunning beautifully decorated and furnished and spotlessly clean. It is in a fantastic location but do take up Christophe's offer of a pre-arranged taxi from the airport.  Christophe gave us great advice on places to visit made reservations at excellent restaurants and organised a day trip into the Atlas mountains for us.  If you are looking for a sanitised anonymous international hotel then don't stay here. If you want a wonderful immersion into the real Marrakech with fantastic accommodation and service then look no further.

Review_Date: Anne W wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: What a jem this lovely riad in Marrakech is. Christophe and his partner Andre are fabulous hosts. The ladies and men who work there are happy lovely people that make you feel so welcome. Christophe gave me a great overview to visiting Marrakech to start. The rooms are good and the AC was very welcome. Breakfast up on the roof-top terrace is just so such a great way to start a day.    Marrakech is a frantic busy city and it was great to have this fabulous retreat to go back to. The location is perfect! So close to Jma el Fnaa without being in the thick of it. There were so many times I was thankful about the location. After getting lost a minimum of three times a day it was great to have a place that was easy to get back to.    I would definitely recommend Riad Andalla. Good room wonderful people great location.

Had 4 nights here at this great little riad It's the perfect location we were made to feel extremely welcome from the minute we walked in until the time we left. Christophe Abdul and the rest of the team were friendly helpful and great hosts without exception. Cant fault this place in any way shape or form.

Review_Date: Mark H wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: We found at the" Riad Andalla"!! from the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome and it just got better each day we were sorry we had only booked four days and hope to return for a longer trip next time please pass on our sincere thanks to your wonderful staff who were fantastic. we can honestly say we have never stayed anywhere more welcoming and friendly (and we have stayed in some 6* hotels) so once again a million thanks to you and all your staff and we look forward to staying again at the Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katie P wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Title: Perfect location and excellent value for money
Review_Text: We had a short but action packed couple of days in Marrakech and stayed in Riad Andalla for 2 nights. We were met from the airport which was a real help and led to the riad tucked away off the square. Christophe met with us and ran through a couple of key things to see which was a real help as we only had a few days to fit everything in. The hammam and restaurants he recommended were both top notch and very reasonable for what you got.    The location of the riad is brilliant. A few minutes from the square with the souks and all the restaurants you could need on your doorstep. The roof terrace provides a great view of the sqaure and is really nicely decorated to allow you to relax and take it all in.    Great value for money and we would highly recommend it if staying in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian P wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Title: Welcomed luxury in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Made to feel very welcome with excellent tips and advise given by Christophe on our arrival. We even got a surprise room upgrade!  Beautiful Riad with high standard of rooms breakfast and an excellent view over the Jemma from the roof terrace. Amazingly quiet and peaceful despite being in an excellent location right in the heart of Marrakesh.  Tip: Very glad we opted for the organised taxi from the airport as we would have struggled to find it on our own  Thanks for a wonderful few days
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: sonya k wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: A beautiful riad in an exciting part of Marrakesch. The riad was very comfortable clean and exotically done. We felt like we had stepped back into 1001 Arabian nights mode for a couple of days!!! The view at night from the deck was amazing.  Christoph gave us a room upgrade without being asked which was divine! thanks Christoph  Christoph Andre Abdul and Jamillah spoiled us to no end. What great hosts they all were we couldn't ask for anymore......  Thank you again for our magical stay in your riad!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom W wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: An amazing place, with amazing people!
Review_Text: We stayed here a few nights through September and can not fault it. All the staff are extremely freindly and professional. They were very helpful and went far beyond our expectations to make our stay enjoyable. The Riad itself is pefectly kept and finished to an extremely high standard.The location is great and quiet. Beautiful is the perfect word to describe our stay here!    Thank you again to Christophe and everyone at Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A truly magical place that's simply head-and-shoulders above anything else on offer. The big difference with Andalla is this - the magic is not only in the Riad's atmospheric physical beauty the sumptuous sexy rooms it's serenity-infused roof terrace or its lush decor. It's more than that - it's in the people who own run and clearly. love Andalla.    Christophe and Andre don't just own Andalla - they nurture it as a place that they genuinely want others to experience and enjoy. You can feel their laid back enthusiasm all over the Riad and they genuinely make you feel like you're experience is important to them. It's far more than just 'having a happy customer' with them - you sense it's deeply personally important to them that you enjoy your stay. This shows through in every single aspect of service style and effort at Riad Andalla.    And after all that there's still one more gem in Andalla's crown that comes to life in the evening. Abdul who is the night custodian at the Riad is charismatic honest funny and as warm a host as you could wish to meet. Nothing is too much.    Riad Andalla is the kind of place with standards that makes other hoteliers jealous. And rightly so it's outstanding.    If you went to Marrakesh and hated detested and loathed Marrakesh itself but stayed in Andalla it'd still be one of your favourite holidays ever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose this Riad due to its location and we were not disappointed. 2 mins walk from the Sq and terrace overlooking the sq so breakfast was always interesting. We were collected from the airport (10 mins away) which I fully recommend as finding the alley way for the first time can be daunting once there its very easy and safe. The rooms were excellent clean new and we were immediately welcomed by the owner Christophe with Sweet Mint Tea on the terrace. We were shown places on the map recommended sights restaurants and even taxi costs. All the staff were welcoming especially Abdul. We would definitely recommend this Riad for its welcoming staff as well as location.

Review_Title: Friendly welcoming accommodation at the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Don't be alarmed by the backstreet passage ways that have to be taken in order to reach this Riad. It is a beautifully decorated traditional Riad situated within 2 minutes walk of the main square (Jemaa el Fna) at the heart of Marrakech old town and 5 mins from the Souks. From the rooftop terrace the view is truly spectacular.    Christophe was an excellent host (even from initial emails regarding arrivals times and sorting out airport transfer) - nothing was too much trouble. He was brilliant at pointing out places to go and how to get there and we will never forgot his map drawing skills! The rest of his staff were just as inviting and there is a special mention for Abdul who was there to great us at the door at any time day or night! (No keys are provided you literally knock to be let in).    The rooms themselves are small but were adequate as we were only in there to sleep and wash! They are also fully air conditioned which was a must in the september heat.    Breakfast was home made and usually served on the terrace except when there is bad weather. It is all pastries breads and preserves of all kinds of fruit (orange fig prune . . . .) freshly squeezed orange juice tea or coffee.    Overall - highly recommended to anyone wishing to experience the true heart of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great Riad very centrally located and only a short walk to the market. All of the staff are fantastic with a special mention for Christophe (owner) and Abdul who could not be more welcoming. Rooms are very comfortable and have AC (very useful). Christophe will also arrange for you to be picked up from the airport (even if dont ask and he doesn't tell you - keep an eye out for a board with your name on as I missed it).  Would definitely go back.

Review_Date: Ron M wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: Many features make the Riad Andalla worthy of a higher placing amongst the Marrakech B&Bs.    Firstly there's Cristophe and Andre - better caring hosts (throughout my stay) I have yet to meet on my travels. Their input is personal without being intrusive and all guests are treated equally. From the arranged pick-up at the airport and escort to the Riad to the warmest friendliest welcome .... to sound advice regarding the Souks and restaurant recommendations based on local knowledge - not that the Riad's dinners are bad at all - far from it! Thank you Jamila.    The rooms are small comfortable and sooo clean thanks to the team of ladies. Thank you Jamiaa Ouria and Atika. But special mention is reserved for Abdul the overnight minder who is a real star. He has little English it seems but matched with my bad French - we had amazing 'conversation'. I was especially grateful for his escort through the derbs for a 0500hr rendezvous.    By no means last there is the location - hidden behind cafes on the Jemaa el Fna with a superb rooftop terrace overlooking all the action from breakfast to sunset and dinner - a truly magnificent ever-changing spectacle. I am not aware of another like it.    Come stay and enjoy!

Review_Title: We Loved the Riad, the owners were Great, location also!"
Review_Text: Christophe and Andre made us feel really comfortable and gave us excellent ideas of where to go what to see where to eat everything! And divided between high quality and expensive and budget alternatives with also high quality and typical style just great! The Riad location was great with a very nice breakfast place with a view over the main square with all the Moroccan sounds in the background really exotic. I highly recommend Riad Andalla
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Little Gem hidden in hectic Marrakech- amazing hosts
Review_Text: I wish all hotels would be like Riad Andalla: central location Traditional and luxurious great food and home made breakfast amazing terrace overlooking the city very helpful staff and above all hosts who have a passion for what they do. Ask them anything from recommending a spa restaurant a tour or a baboush shop and they will give you unbiased and honest advice.  I felt I was at home and I can't wait to be back!

As our first time ever visiting Marrakech we decided that we would stay in a traditional moroccan riad and opted for the very popular Riad Andella. We were delighted with our choice as it was all we would have expected for a true moroccan experience. wonderful atmosphere beautiful surroundings centrally located with a wonderful view of the square. Christophe and his staff couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful even providing and extra room so that our party of 5 would have more space. The rooms were beautifully decorated in traditional style and the rooftop was atmospheric and relaxing. A truly wonderful place to stay for those seeking an authentic experience.

We stayed at Riad Andalla for a week whilst in Marrakech. Everyone at the Riad was so helpful and friendly. It was an amazing experience. They made our trip one to remember. We had so many laughs and the Riad booked all our restaurants and helped us book excursions and also advised us how best to see Marrakech. We love everyone at Riad and miss them. Thank You to Christophe Andre Abdul and Djamila. Truly a 5* experience.    We hope to come visit you again...such fond memories!!!!

Review_Title: The heart of Marrakech!! Extremely friendly and homely...will definitely return.
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad Andalla for 7 nights and by far it's been the best place I've stayed at whilst on holiday.  The staff are extremely friendly and always eager to help and make your stay comfortable. The owner Christophe was amazing...never met anyone so genuine and helpful! As we got there we were greeted with biscuits and mint tea on the terrace by Abdul (staff-incredibly friendly). Christophe throughout the 7 days was really helpful. He helped us plan our time there...gave us recommendations of what places to visit where to eat and what to see and directed us by drawing out maps...like I said really helpful and genuine! Our stay was extremely comfortable and homely the riad captured the culture if Marrakech and made out stay more worthwhile! The views from the terrace of djemma el fna was amazing. Would definitely recommend this riad to everyone...I will definitely be returning. You couldn't ask for a better riad in terms of location atmosphere quality cleanliness and most of all genuine staff! Thank you Christophe Andre Abdul and the rest of the team...you truly have left us with many happy memories!!

We loved everything about this Riad from its great location to the great hospitability of its owners and staff. Riad is located on the main square but the entrance is from the back alleys which is great because it is close to all the action yet peaceful enough. Terrace is great too whether for breakfasts in the morning or for relaxing in the evening while watching listening and smelling the main square everyday fiesta. Rooms are not too big but they have high ceilings and are beautifully decorated. In this Riad you don’t get a key for a room or the main entrance and you don’t need it because you feel like at home anyway. One night we left a purse on the terrace with all our money credit cards passports and other valuables and Abdu the night watchman returned it in 5 minutes. This is something you probably wouldn’t experience in a big hotel or even in some other Riads we have stayed in Morocco. Christophe and Andre (the owners) were there for us every day to help us with anything we needed (Getting around the city Restaurant reservation taxi reservation luggage storage etc.) and they are a great example of professional entrepreneurs who care about their guests and the whole service in their Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location/felt safe & taken care of at the Riad/Family with children
Review_Text: Christophe and Andre took very good care of us from the taxi from the airport to restaurant and touring recommendations. It is really like staying at someone's villa in the heart of the old city. GREAT LOCATION. Next to everything. Breakfast was excellent. Abdul the night watchman/breakfast person was very nice.

Review_Title: Riad Andalla- a great place for all!
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Andalla for 5 nights in room Zouak (downstairs). Being two females we were concerned about the safety in Marrakech but please be assured that the Riad and surrounding area is VERY safe!    The Riad is situated 2 minutes away from the main square souks and is around 10-15 minute walk maximum away from sights.    The Breakfast at the Riad is simple with crepes/cake lovely fruit jams and refreshing orange juice.    We would like to say a very big thank you to Abdou (night watchman) who spoke very little English but we were still able to understand him. He was very helpful and we enjoyed his company and stories. Abdou also serves breakfast in the morning. The owner Christophe gave us a detailed insight on the first morning about eating places and directions which was useful! The girls at the Riad are very cheerful and you can always hear them talking laughing and smiling which is at times great to see and hear.    Free wifi is available at the Riad but at times can be slow so therefore one needs to be patient. However it works and is handy.    Overall we had a very pleasant stay at this family home. I didn't feel like i was miles away from London and Riad Andalla makes people feel very welcome and safe. Insha'Allah we will visit again.

Ideally situated Riad Andalla is 2 minutes walk from the action of the main square yet offers a calm retreat. Its rooftop terrace where breakfast/dinner is served enjoys panoramic views over the Medina and beyond and is a great place to start or finish any day. The hospitality was friendly and relaxed and the service always obliging and attentive. Riad Andalla has an air of understated chic and it would definitely be first choice for any subsequent visit to Marrakech.

Review_Title: A tranquil riad right in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Riad Andalla is like a home away from home. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful in suggesting what you can do in Marrakech and the surrounding area within your time frame. The manager will go out of his way to accommodate you he is genuinely a top bloke with a good sense of humour.  The rooms are clean and furnished with traditional riad features which all adds to the experience. There is a great roof terrace with stunning views over the main square. You can sit back relax have drinks served to you whilst you watch the city transform at it hits night time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: i stayed here for 2 nights it is excellent value for money and is luxurious. Christophe the owner is extremely helpful too.
A riad that truly captures the essence of Marrakech- beautiful architecture and style with a picturesque view of the Jamaa from the roof. Loved staying here during out trip in Morocco.

We had a great experience in Riad Andalla. Christophe the owner was very welcoming and helpful as were all the team who worked hard to maintain a fantastic ambiance. It was an adventure to find the Riad but once we arrived we were greeted with a mint tea and cookies.    The room was clean and the Riad itself was spacious and beautifully decorated. The terrace had an amazing view of the central square "Jam El Fna" which was entertaining to watch as the sun went down.    We didn't try the evening cuisine offered by the Riad but we did enjoy the traditional Moroccan breakfast served by Abdul.    Riad Andalla is a traditional Moroccan house that has an interior courtyard running through the core of the building. A cute little water fountain sits at the base of the courtyard it's purpose to catch rain water which may occasionally fall. (I'm British and unfortunately brought a bit of the Mancunian rain with me during our stay!). Due to the nature of a Riad and the central courtyard shared by all windows I would recommend that those individuals who are hyper sensitive to outside noise or louder groups choose a less traditional environment.    I have already recommended this accommodation to a colleague at work and would certainly book the same Riad again :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 6 days in Marrakech and stayed at Riad Andalla just off the main square of Jamaal ef Na. Amazing  fantastic are the words we use to describe our stay. My husband and I travelled with my mum who is registered blind and has mobility issues - despite having no lift within the traditional riad my mum really enjoyed her stay. This was because of the incredible warmth and generosity that Christophe Andre Abdou and everyone at Riad Andalla showed us. Nothing was too much for them from directing us to fantastic sweet shops to getting an electrician in to change the bulb fitting in my mum’s room so she could have more light in her room! Besides the service its location and style made our journey even more rewarding. Beautifully decorated (which only reflected Christophe and Andre’s exquisite taste) it is 2 minutes from the main square close to everything and the only hotel which overlooked the square. We really miss the leisurely breakfast on the gorgeous roof garden and the hospitality that was shown to us made a simple breakfast into something very special. We love Morocco and Marrakech because of the cuisine the people the rich culture and history and the gorgeous scenery and now we have one more reason to go back to Marrakech. Christphe Andre Abdou we love you guys and can’t wait to see you again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm with fantastic service
Review_Text: What a fantastic Riad! We were made to feel so welcome and right at home. Christophe the owner was very helpful and recommeneded palces to see in our short time there. The Riad has amazing views of the square and although it is noisy outside in the Riad we barely heard a thing! Even sitting on the roof terrace was calm and peaceful. Talking of the roof terrace what a perfect place to have breakfast each morning! Views one side of the market square turn around and you have the Atlas mountains! It was made extra special for us when my boyfriend proposed to me!  The rooms were small but perfectly formed! All themed in their own way. The staff were very helpful although Christophe was the only one who spoke English. Saying that we still managed to have an informative conversation with Abdul the night guy with his limited English and our limited French!  The only thing I would say is if you choose to stay in this or any other Riad make sure you get them to meet you in the square to show you where the Riad is. Marrakech is a maze of side streets and alleyways and you will never find the Riad on your own.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Friendly and welcoming - ideal location - great quality at a reasonable price
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights in April and had a fantastic time. Christophe and Andre were absolutely charming and the perfect hosts the staff were all very friendly and the service was superb. We particularly enjoyed practising our French which gave rise to a few laughs! It was a very smooth transfer from airport to riad and we would definitely recommend arranging this in advance. We greatly appreciated our excellent dinner on the roof terrace on our first evening and enjoyed our breakfasts there every morning (although my husband would have preferred croissants to pancakes!) Our room was very attractively decorated but we found the bed a bit hard (although some people might prefer that). After breakfast on our first morning Christophe gave us advice on how to get the best out of our stay in Marrakech where to go taxi fares etc and gave us some excellent recommendations for restaurants. You would never guess that he must do this for new guests every morning! For our return to the airport he even took the time to escort us through the square to our taxi. We were very upset to hear the dreadful news about the bomb in the square today and hope that this will not discourage anyone from visiting this fascinating and exciting city and staying in this friendly and welcoming riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An ideal location for discovering the centre of Marrakesh the Riad Andalla can be no more than a 100yds from the World famous place Jemaa elfna the rooftop garden has a wonderful view across the square especially at night. Christophe and Andre were perfect hosts they made us more than welcome and their humor and willingness to assist was far more than I and my wife expected. Christophe set time aside to point out places of interest and where and where not to visit which was very useful he also gave us his contact number if we need assistance when out and about thankfully this never arose.    The Riad Andalla is beautifully furnished inside our room (suite) although smaller than expected more than made up for size with its comfort and decor the shower was one of the best once you got a hang of the taps but remember to put the plug down when finished as like Andre explained the Marrakesh drainage system does not exactly smell of flowers.    I would recommend a meal at the Riad on your first night just as we did on the rooftop (weather Permitting). The food was fresh and very tasty and if you are a wine drinker you'll be pleasantly surprised by the local Moroccan white and Rose    One thing I must do is mention the staff employed at the Riad Abdou Attika Houria and Jamila. They are so polite and courteous forever have a smile on their faces and you genuinely feel that they enjoyed serving you.    The only criticism I would have of the Riad is that when we stayed there were also a group of middle aged women staying and because of the way that the Riad is built meant that when they were talking (and singing at 3:00am in the morning) you heard everything however this discomfort was only for two nights but I wouldn't recommend groups but it is ideal for couples.    When in the Medina be aware that there are no bars serving alcohol near the square where you can sit and watch the world go by but there are many serving coffee and the Moroccan specialty of mint tea (just couldn't get the grasp of this) however there is one alcohol serving bar called Kozybar which has a sun roof overlooking the Palais El Badiî and is well worth a visit for Lunch especially on a warm sunny day.    Marrakesh what did I think ? well once I had got over constant harassment in the Souks of the horse and carriage drivers the taxi drivers and the fella’s with strange hats in the square I did enjoy myself. My wife loved it and what I did notice was the number of young/middle aged woman visitors enjoying themselves and findingthe environment perfectly safe.    Two words of warning don't accept what you think is a friendly free guide around the tannery there will be a price at the end. In my case I knocked him down from £10 to £2. Also be prepared for long wait in passport control into and out of the country.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: You would be crazy not to stay here. You can enjoy the Jemaa el Fna from the sunny terrace as it is that close. Each room has its own character and the house staff with Christophe Andre Abdul and the rest make you feel welcome but give you space and privacy. We stayed 5 nights. Great value. A++ for us = 2 travelers that passed through in March.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: i have travelled a lot but hardly ever experienced such a great amount of hospitality which makes you feel at home immediately. after my arrival christophe took an hour to explain to me the map of marrakech helpful hints of where to go or not to go. christophe andré and all the staff doing everything to give you the feeling of being most welcome. even after my return home i was touched by words of thanks and appreciation.  you can feel that riad andalla is not just a guest housel its christophe`s and andré`s`"baby" taken care of with losts of love which you notice in various details.  the location of andalla just around the corner of central jamma el fnar is excellent. i felt safe and welcome and free at the same time. perfect base and "maroccan" home to explore the fascinating city.

From the moment we arrived welcomed by chrisophe we had the most exciting stay we could have ever had in a place like marrakech. Marrakech is really wild in it's nature so you need like a safe home were to go and rest assured that you will be looked upon. The staff is excellent Abdu and the rest of the staff are difficult to explain. Since they will always help you with a smile. They don't do it for the money! they just do it cause they care and that shows!!    the cleanliness is yet again a break from the souks and the square just a couple of metres away.    The finishing is amazing and make sure you have a look at all the rooms when you get the chance.    Also do not expect to use keys that's a luxory you don't need at this RIAD.

We had a great time in Marrakech and staying at Riad Andalla was quite essential for that. This riad is perfectly located right next to the Djemaa el Fna square (over which it has a great view from the terrace). It is at walking distance from every attraction in the Medina which made our lives very easy since we could skip all the "taxi-bargaining stress". Andre and Christophe as well as the rest of the staff were super friendly and helped us with lots of tips on how to go where where to eat etc. The breakfast on the sunny terrace is a great start for a sightseeing day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The ONLY Riad to stay at in Marrakech!!!!!!!!!!!
Review_Text: We are 6 women just back from 4 day ‘girly trip’ to Marrakech. Without any doubt the highlight of our trip was Riad Andalla. The location is second to none being incredibly central to the Djemma al Fna Square – which after a day of shopping in the Souks is so very appreciated. The roof terrace is an oasis of calm and beauty atop the dust and hustle and bustle of Marrakesh and a real sun trap. Christophe and Andre the proprietors became true friends and were fantastic in every respect providing hairdryers and even weighing scales for us to check our luggage weight for the return journey. A special mention has to go to Abdou who despite having limited English managed to communicate perfectly and really looked after us. Each of the rooms have their own very distinct style and personality and it was such a beautiful place to stay that I would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone visiting Marrakech. Christophe speaks excellent English and liaised with me for months before our trip offering advice and arranging meals taxis and spas so that we had a very smooth and trouble free experience.

Review_Title: A Gem in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: this was our first visit to Morocco and thanks to the great assistance by Christophe/Andre and their team our short stay in Marrakesh was wonderful.. Everyone at the Riad is nice and anything you require will be arranged for you in no time from airport transfers to booking of excursions to finding the right night spot for a great night out. Thank you ...

Had a great time in this wonderful and well decorated riad which is very close to the Jamaa El F’na square.  Christophe and André are two adorable people who welcomed us as if we had known them for ever. They gave us information about what to do what to visit and where to go in Marrakech and its surroundings while drinking some fresh orange juice on the beautiful terasse enjoying the view. They were very kind and helping during the whole time we were there.  The atmosphere was very friendly and we wish we didn't have to come back home!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Andalla made our trip to Marrakech
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived in Marrakech the Riad Andalla were fantastic. From our collection at the airport the standard & location of the accommodation the lovely breakfast the friendly staff & the advice given by Christophe on the best sights to see & where to eat. We felt that this advice let us see a litte bit of the real Marrakech.    All in all we would highly recommend the Riad Andalla & would definately stay there if we are lucky enough to visit Marrakech again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad Andalla on our trip to Marrakech and everyone that works there treat us like if we were at home. Abdul and Christophe have been very nice with us and helped us in everything we needed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My boyfriend booked this riad for my 30th birthday trip and it was a lovely surprise!    We arrived at the riad via pre arranged transport which in our opinion was essential. Christophe and co were very friendly and welcoming throughout our stay. The riad was beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. We stayed on the top floor and could see and hear Jamaa el Fna- amazing location!    On our first evening we ate at the riad which we throughly enjoyed- lemon chicken tagine-yummy!! (Defo a must). The included breakfast of crepes jams fresh bread and lots of coffee was nice and kept you going til lunch!    In the mornings over breakfast Christophe was always on hand to offer advice and directions on where to go and what to do even tips on bartering our way through the maze of souks. Christophe also booked us a hamman which we had on our last afternoon- a real treat and we totally recommend it ( Bains de Marrakech).    Marrakech itself was a senses overload with little gems to be found constantly.  I am sure there are many more things I could say but wouldn't want to spoil your surprise! All I would say is BOOK YOUR FLIGHTS and go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Andalla was wonderful. The location is ideal and they offered everything we needed for an enjoyable experience. Of the many services they can arrange we took advantage of the direct airport transfer and a traditional (delicious) Moroccoan dinner prepared on site the evening of our arrival. The Riad is charming. Our room was clean and comfortable. The terrace was LOVELY with amazing views of the Djemaa el Fna. The best part of Riad Andalla was the welcoming and helpful staff; Christophe André Abdou Attika Houria and Jamila made our stay fun comfortable & memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great value and location, and the most hospitable hosts you could imagine.
Review_Text: We were 5 staying at the Riad for 3 days in mid February and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Riad Andalla. Christophe and Andre were both exceptionally helpful and made us feel very welcome - as did the rest of the staff. During our 1 week visit to Morocco we stayed at more expensive and luxurious Riads but Andalla is the one in which we had the most enjoyable stay. The Riad itself the terrace the location and value for money were all excellent but the hospitality of the hosts was what made our stay unforgettable.

The Riad is really really friendly. All the people there made you feel like you were at home. Christophe was an immense help nothing was far out of his way he would help with anything. Planning day trips telling us where to go arranging for us to leave our things whle on a few days trip to Essouiria. Came back and he even upgraded our room for no extra cost as he was fully booked. We even both had a book mark gift when leaving - Memories. I would highly recommed Riad Andalla ... Good views from the roof terrace. The night staff were awesome also ... No curfews! great for trips to the new part of the city. If going back to Marrakech. Riad Andalla would be the first stop. If you do end up at Riad Andalla ask Christophe to help you with a day trip to the Atlas Mountains. He will sort you with your own driver and a guide takes you up to some awesome mountain ranges and waterfalls ... some treks are a littel adventurous ... be careful!!    Its been a few months in writing this review ... but still miss Andalla the breakfasts on the roof in the sun! And most of all Marrakesh.    Go to Riad Andalla!!

Firstly I have to say that I choose Riad Andalla for the great Location just few minutes away from Plaza Jemaa El Fna.  It has a great terrace and Christophe Andrea and all their staff are really nice and great.  I felt at Home because they make you feel at home away from home.  Definitely I will suggest them for other stays and hope to be there again.  Riccardo

Review_Date: Luiz Fernando Niquet wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Title: Very beautiful Riad, with excellent location.
Review_Text: This is a very beautiful Riad very nicely decorated and with a perfect location just a couple of minutes from the square. This central location makes Riad Andalla a great place to rest after few hours of wandering around in crazy Marrakesh. Despite beeing just close to Djema El-Fna the Riad is not easy to find in the first time so it may be worth to arrange a pick-up from the airport or from the entrance of the medina. But after the first time it becomes easy to find your way to and from the square.    The place is very clean and well kept and the service is great and friendly especially from Abdul who was always willing to help despite the difficulties in communication because we spoke almost no french at all. Chistopher the owner is also very helpful and speaks English with helped us a lot. On the first day he gave us a map of the city and some tips about where to eat what to do and see which made things easier for our first time visit to the city.    The Riad has a lovely terrace where we had our breakfast. The view of Djema El-Fna was priceless. The breakfast was good if a bit simple (maybe some eggs yogurt or cereals would make it more filling).    The Riad is very calm and quiet and we had very quiet nights. In that aspect the Riad surprised me very positively because I was a bit worried about the noises from the medina and the prayer calls. We slept very well and did not hear anything during the nights.    The Riad offers free wi-fi internet which is very usefull. We had some trouble getting a connection from our room and had to go to the lobby to use the internet where it usually worked better even though sometimes we experienced some instability.    The price we paid for a double (EU$70) was a bit high for the Moroccan standarts but Riads are usually kind of expensive especially in Marrakesh and the service was indeed very personal and efficient. At the end it was worth the extra-expense and the Riad turned out to be one of the warmest memories of our 16-days Moroccan trip.    I certantly recommend this place and if one day I return to Marrakesh will definetly stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A perfectly well placed Riad. 5' from the Jamaa El Fnaa Square yet very quiet. Everything to see in Marrakesh is wakable from there. The owners are very helpful with their local advice. The Riad is immaculate cleaned every day. Eating breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Square is unique; so is having their home cooked dinner at night and overlooking the Square full of life as it only happens in Marrakesh. A unique experience. Perfect destination for a long weekend. Highly recommend the Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thor H wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Title: Great location, great service, great Riad!
Review_Text: I have to agree with all the other "Excellent" reviews and my title says it all. There is no need to look anywhere else. Andalla gives great value for money.

Review_Title: Ideally located, especially for first-time visitors
Review_Text: If like us you are worried about getting lost in Marrakech especially at night then Riad Andalla is the perfect solution. It's location is easy to find as it is so close to La Place Jemaa el Fnaa with lovely views of it from the riad's terrace. The owner Christophe and his staff are all very friendly and give good advice on where to visit and where to eat. The rooms in the Riad are comfortable and clean and the price to stay there is very reasonable given its prime location. Do stay here especially if you are a first-time visitor. You will not be disappointed!

Review_Title: The best riad on the best location
Review_Text: We stayed two nights in the riad Andalla and everything was just perfect. Form the beautiful deco of the building and the charming owner to the more than friendly staff. But the best of all is the superb roofterras. It is the only one in Marrakech directly overlooking the djem el fnaa.  Breakfast is rich and served on the roofterras on a sunny day (and there are plenty in Marrakech) just a dream come through. Why wait any longer....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was excellent. A haven of calm in a bustling and amazing city. The staff was extremely helpful and the rooms and the decor of a very high standard. We are already planning another trip.

Review_Title: Great stay and a magical time in Marrakech
Review_Text: This was my 3rd visit to Marrakech and I have previously stayed in lower rated accommodation but as we were staying for 4 nights we decided to pay a little more and I saw the reviews of Riad Andalla on Tripadvisor - all the previous reviewers were very complimentary and they were very right - this is definitely a great place to stay.  Most importantly is the friendly welcome you get from Christophe and his partner Andre - two ex-pat French men who own and run the place. They were really friendly and helpful and they have some great staff working for them including Adbul (the night porter). All the other staff who prepare breakfast and the rooms were always smiling and friendly. It really was a happy place to stay which is nice.  Rooms - the Riad has 8 rooms and we had one of their smaller rooms with ensuite facilities but it was very tastefully decorated it had hanging space and the bathroom always had hot water. We didn't spend much time in the room because the Riad has a lovely shaded terrace overlooking the main square and lots of other areas where you can just chill out and get away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.  Location - it is just behind the Cafe de France in the main square so is perfectly located although it does take a little time to find the first time as the Medina is full of alleyways but after first time we had no problems finding it again. The main square is only 2 or 3 minutes away.  Help & Advice - although we had previously visited Marrakech we got some great advice and recommendations from Christophe of places to eat and visit. All his suggestions were spot on. We also got him to organise a private excursion to the Ourika Valley which was very good. We could have done it cheaper by joining a group mini bus excursion but the driver Christophe arranged spoke great english and was very friendly and made it a great trip - many thanks to Adil our driver & guide for a great day.  Marrakech is either a place you love or hate - like most places in the Muslim world you get woken early by the call to prayer and some of the streets in the old city are dirty and grubby and you always get people trying to sell you stuff in the souks but Marrakech is a magical place and when we go back again we will be contacting the Riad Andalla as it is very welcoming and friendly place - definitely somewhere we would like stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakech.
Review_Text: First time in Marrakech. Some points to ponder:  1. Don't think you can show up and find a Riad. The alleyways are a nightmare to navitgate on your own especially if carrying bags. It is only fun once you get settled in.  2. Don't show up without the riad's phone number and knowing how to dial in a foreign country.  3. This hotel has a website with a good map; hotels.com does not. I paid for this mistake.  Points on the riad:  1. The riad was great once we found it (again our fault). The rooms were simple but clean and comfortable with heat and AC.  2. The food was simple and carb-focused but delicious and sufficient (especially if you plan on sampling food in d'Jema al-Fna...which you should).  3. The location was great once you found it. It took about 3 minutes to get to the square once you left.  4. After immersing yourself in the market all day and inevitably being overwhelmed it is great to sit on the roof drink a beer (though they only have one kind) and relax.  5. The ambiance staff and owners were great and create a wonderful atmosphere.  6. Don't let a cab driver drop you off at a random gate he convinces you is "just down the road" from the riad. See above but you will never find it.  I will stay here again when we go back; great value location and ambiance.  Shawn
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Are you going to Marrakesh for the first time or know the city as your pocket; RIAD ANDALLA is the place we recommend as your home.    Order:  We (four friends) studied Tripadviser for hours to find an accommodation that matched our criteria for a residence in Marrakech. RIAD ANDALLA was our choice.  As a first impression the owners' response was quick and gave us the feeling of being in professional hands. At arrival at Marrakech Airport we were picked up by the riads car which we certainly recommend for a price that is included in the bill at the RIAD. No hassle with a price for the driver; which is always nice to get a smooth start at arrivals.    The reception;  The reception at the RIAD was Royal with lovely tea and laughter. Christopher and André (the French owners) was very helpful with the order of tables in restaurants finding good Hamam and find the right rental firm that gave us the security you need in a situation with a car etc. The atmosphere was cozy and we felt right at home. They are super friendly without having to sit on your lap and get too close. After five minutes we felt safe and did not think that there was equipment valuables and other for $ 10000 slap in the room with no lock.    Localities;  Christophe and André have taken care of the authentic Arab style in the four-storey house. There are different rooms and I enjoyed probably the best suites with more space. There were comfortable beds and duvets that rarely experienced in the country with blankets to be first. I have a little dust allergy but did not notice it particularly. There was good pressure in the shower BUT remember to close the hatch strange smell from the pipes.    Location:  The largest values of staying in RIAD ANDALLA the location and the amazing rooftop view over Jemaal Fna Square. It gives a kick (eye candy) at breakfast and not least for the dinner with a atmosphere that you miss when you get home. (The RIAD) it's easy to find when you manage to locate the Café France and which corner to turn to the right. The stress and pace of the streets is totally absent in the RIAD is quiet as in a church and the perfect place to read or even write a book.    Food;  The first evening Christopher fixed a table for us at the French restaurant Kanyama was a great experience. Sunday made the Arab girls at RIAD food that was delicious. Recommended. Eating food on the roof was in a class by itself. One evening we will never forget. Just do it!    In summary:  Riad Andalla has a perfect location the price is competitive the staff is great the lovely food in the roof terrace in an entirely separate class the place has no bargain kings that sucks up money and I can with my hand on heart recommend the place for you and yours. But book early; it was quickly becomes full. Next time Chris & André!!

Review_Title: perfect accomodation, perfect location, perfect staff
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad Andalla for 3 nights whilst on a trip to a Morocco. From the minute that we arrived the welcome from Christophe and his team was exceptional. From providing us with recommendations of places to eat and visit what to pay for taxi rides and where not to venture after dark was all very helpful.  The accomodation was spot on - a converted family home into a traditional Riad with uninterrupted views of Djeema al Fna. I would imagine that some Riads have roof top views of other roof tops complete with satelite dishes!!  Wouldn't hesitate to recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic riad inside the Medina with a beautiful terrace on the Place Jemaa el Fna.  The rooms are well-groomed and clean.  Top home-made breakfast and dinner.  Andre and Cristophe were adorable taking care of us for all the stay.  Very recommended.

I stayed in Riad Andalla late Sept/early Oct 2010. Riad Andalla is an excellent but not perfect wonderful little place! Why isn't it perfect? As a solo traveler I was given the smallest room. It was cute but not very spacious. I used the second single bed to hold my luggage but if I had been traveling with someone I have no idea where we would have put our things. Also the room was dark (I like lots of light especially when I'm trying to get ready) the water pressure in the bathroom was nearly non-existent and the bed was very hard for my "princess and the pea" tastes.    Other than those relatively minor things (most of which I actually expected) Riad Andalla is wonderful! The location is absolutely perfect! Getting there the first time is confusing but once you figure it out it is relatively simple: literally a two minute walk or less from Djemma el Fna. You can see the terrace from the Square; it is just behind Cafe de France. ... The staff are very kind and welcoming though Andre seems to be the only one to speak much english. The breakfasts are absolutely yummy and both the terrace and courtyard/lobby areas are beautiful. And the wi-fi is definitely a nice touch! Gave me the opportunity to update friends and family on my adventures which was definitely appreciated.    All in all I highly recommend Riad Andalla. Just don't expect a 5 star quality bed! :-) ... I would definitely stay there again - but would probably choose to spring for one of the larger rooms.

I would just say to anyone who is thinking of visiting Marrakech that this a fabulous place and Christophe and his team are brilliant. We took Christophe's advice on various things and it made our trip a very memorable one. We booked the taxi from the airport through the hotel and a trip to the Atlas Mountains which was excellent. The rooftop terrace was very relaxing and our evening meal up there was wonderful.    So a big Thank You to Christophe and family. You made us feel like we were part of your family.

Review_Title: A haven away from the mayhem, at an affordable cost.
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Andalla for 3 nights in Sept. We booked a taxi from the airport through the hotel definitely recommended. The taxi dropped us off on the edge of Djemaa el Fna we were greeted by a little old man & his cart he took us through the square down a couple of back alleys to our Riad. I must say we did wonder where we were going it was around 7pm so it was buzzing with activity a little crazy but exciting!! On entering the Riad we were amazed tastefully decorated very authentic cosy I could go on & on! The rooms are on the small side but we didn't spend much time in them.We'd pre-booked a meal on the rooftop terrace which was delish and fab views of the Djemaa el Fna.Christophe is the perfect host always on hand with a smile advice anddespite what he thinks extremely good English ;-) Andre Abdhool & the ladies make up the rest of the 'family' that we felt part of. We also booked a day trip to the Atlas Mountains which we thoroughly enjoyed. A big big thank you to you all for making our stay in Marrakesh so memorable.

Review_Title: If You aren't staying here, cancel your trip
Review_Text: Riad Andalla Andre and Christophe and the rest of the staff are perfect for any visit to Marrakech- perfect location perfect accommodation and most importantly perfect hosts. Riad Andalla is located in an excellent location with quick and safe access to Djemna El Fna. When returning from a day or evening of exploring the last thing you want is to take another 20 or 30 minute walk to your riad - Andalla is truly minutes off the square. When you do get to Andalla you'll find yourself in a wonderful serene and beautiful place. The lobby rooms and terrace have wonderful ambiance. We loved falling asleep to the sounds of drums and music from the square. By all means make sure you plan to have a meal at the Riad - it was the best meal of our whole two weeks in Morocco! You won't be disappointed!

We stayed in this lovely riad for 4 days with a 20 month old baby and were quite amazed with the hospitality offered by Christophe Andre & and Abdool! The location is fantastic right on the Djema el-fna and very close to the souks and other major attractions. The riad itself is very tastefully decorated and the rooms are lovely even though they are a bit small. The terrace where breakfast is served is lovely with great views of the square. But most of all we were impressed with the hospitality of the hosts and the entire team - who went out of their way to make our stay a very pleasant one! They gave sound advice and some great recommendations & guidance! Special thanks to Abdool who went out of his way to ensure that our baby was comfortable and happy!

Riad Andalla is charming cozy calm and convenient. It is located right off the Djemaa el Fna square with a lovely rooftop terrace on which to relax and take in the excitement of the night market. Christophe Andre and their staff are warm welcoming and accommodating. I would stay here again and would recommend Riad Andalla to anyone traveling to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely place centrally located, very beautiful and quiet.
Review_Text: The other positive reviews are all right on. I selected Riad Andalla based on the reviews I found on Trip Advisor. First the location is just a minute away on foot to the Djemaa El Fna. Second even though located so close to the hustle and bustle the Riad is extremely quiet and peaceful.    Finally and perhaps most importantly is how impressive and friendly the staff is: if you stay here you will get to know Christophe André Abdou Attika Houria and Jamila. They will let you be if you like but they are also always cheerful and smiling and willing to give you any help you need.    I do not speak a word of French: I speak English and Spanish. Christophe speaks very good English. The rest of the staff and I had some humorous moments trying to communicate with one another. I had mint tea every evening with Abdou. Breakfast on the roof every morning was a great experience. Christophe was very good about giving me instructions on how to find my way around the Medina (NOT an easy thing!!!).    I hope to go back to Marrakesh some day and I would definitely stay here and I would definitely recommend this place to others. I was traveling solo but there are many rooms of varying size the place is huge and very very beautiful (check out the photos).
