We stayed in this Riad back in May based on the reviews of Trip advisor and we weren't dissapointed. We booked a taxi through the Riad on arrival and are so glad we did the driver takes you right to the door (can't bring the car right in so have to walk right into the centre!) there is no way that you would be able to find it alone! on arriving Christophe spent some time with us and went through best places to eat and suggestions of where to go which was fab. Christophe and his team make you feel so welcome and nothing is too much for them.  Christophe even reserved us seats on the bus to Essaouria.  We had our evening meal on the roof terrace on the first night - and although it seemed expensive it was by far the nicest meal we had whilst we were in Marrakesh. and the views just make the whole experience magical.  My Only quarm was that the rooms were so small but you're right in the centre so its to be expected!  The roof terrace is lovely when we were tired from walking around we would just chill upstairs with a book and you feel like you're in your own bubble whilst everything is going on down in the square.  I would have no hesitation of staying there again - Thanks so much to Christophe and his team for making us feel so welcome!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We ended our 2 week trip of Morocco in Marakech and stayed 2 nights at Riad Andalla. Our favourite part of our stay was sitting on the gorgeous roof terrace at night whilst watching the goings on in the main square. Our room was fine typically dark being a Moroccan riad but we had no door on our bathroom although whilst out on the first day they did hang a curtain for us. The drains smelled which is fairly typical of traditional Moroccan houses it seems. The only thing we found a little strange was that you could not lock your bedroom door from the outside and there was occassionally non-guest and non-staff people in the riad probably business contacts of the owners so we did find that slightly uncomfortable. Overall though it was a pleasant place to stay although I would never return to Marakech again as I found it a very stressful experience despite being used to the Moroccan culture. I think the mopeds that run around the small market streets should be banned! Glad I've been but not a place to return to for me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Things are enjoyed:    i) Christophe and Andre were excellent hosts.  ii) The location was excellent with a view of Jemaa El F'naa and within walking distance to many of the sites in the medina.  iii) The staff particularly Abdul and the wonderful ladies were unbelievably friendly and went out of their way to make the stay comfortable.  iv) Great rooftop terrace.    Things that I didn't enjoy:  i) The accommodations are... "rustic". Our room had a smell that we thought came from the sewer but in hindsight I think it was the air conditioner - there was likely mould or something that caused it to smell.  ii) The pictures are deceiving - the rooms are very small.  iii) The bathrooms are very old and the room that we were in didn't have a door to the bedroom.  iv) The walk from the square into the Riad appears unsafe... I'm sure it's okay but my wife was scared the entire time and I can't imagine a group of women being comfortable.    All in all it was a decent experience highlighted by the people. I'm more of a 5-star hotel person who decided to do something out of the norm. We ended up spending a lot of time at Hotel Les Jardins de la Koutoubia at the pool (for a fee) which was excellent. Riad Andalla is a nice place with an excellent location but it isn't a high-end hotel. So set your expectations accordingly.    Cheers.

Andre and Christophe are the best hosts.    They were so kind and friendly. At the first night they will recommend some places to eat and see. Very helpful and practical tips.    The Riad is loacted just next to the square perfect. The riad itself is so pretty and comfortable.You will have to try their home made meal at least once.    Difnitely stay again if I am back to Marrekesch
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Andalla review    We arrived through the maze of narrow crumbling alleys that lead to Riad Andalla in torrential rain helped with our luggage by Christophe and his staff who met us at the taxi on the other side of Djemaa el Fna - a walking distance of about 600metres. Inside the calm and colourful Riad was a warm welcome. We were instantly offered mint tea in the cosy sitting area whilst we admired the authentic Moroccan style of the superbly restored Riad.  Upstairs the bedrooms were small beautifully decorated and well-appointed with comfortable beds air-conditioning (used as heating in winter) and en-suite shower room.  There is a roof terrace where breakfast is served on nice days which has views of Djemaa el Fna and the Atlas Mountains in the distance. Breakfast usually consisting of plentiful crepes bread jam honey cake and coffee is very good.  The level of service was excellent except one hiccup where we had booked and confirmed restaurant meal on the first night but it never happened. Abdul - who is a member of staff who is seems always to be there from serving breakfast to last thing at night - took us to a nearby restaurant instead. He was very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. It helps if you can speak a little French though as he doesn't have much English. Christophe the proprietor speaks English and will arrange trips and give advice about what to see. He arranged a private taxi tour for us through the Ourika valley to the village of Setti Fatma just inside the Toubkal national Park which I can recommend.  The location of the Riad is superb in the centre of the Medina a couple of minutes walk from the bustling Djemaa el Fna with food stalls restaurants snake charmers musicians and storytellers and close to the Souks Koutoubia and Mouassine Mosques and Madrassa Ben Youssef. The narrow alleyways are perfectly safe but it would be difficult to find the Riad on your own the first time so I would recommend taking the taxi transfer offered by the Riad.  If you want to try to reach the Riad yourself take a Taxi and ask for Hotel Ali (taxis are not allowed any closer in the Medina). Find your way to Djemaa el Fna square and look for Cafe de Paris at one end then take the street down the side of the Cafe. After about 75m take the alley on the right then take first right off this alley. Go to the end and turn right again at the T-junction then left and Riad Andalla is on the left.  Overall Riad Andalla was a superb and atmospheric place to stay with friendly staff and in an ideal location for exploring the Medina of Marrakech.

Review_Title: An oasis in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: Christophe and Andre were very friendly relaxed welcoming and efficient!  I booked the room and taxi pick up online and it all went to plan.  At Marrakech airport (after changing some money) a driver took us directly to the hotel where we were shown up to the beautiful roof terrace by Abdul for some mint tea and biscuits.  Christophe then showed us a map of what not to miss in Marrakech we were only there for 3 days which to be honest was enough time to get a real feel of the city!  You must book the dinner it's fab and visit Le Jardin Majorelle which Yves Saint Laurent loved it's really beautiful.  Ask Christophe for local tips he is a great source of info!  Being two women travelling alone we did attract a bit of attention from the locals which we ignored...best thing to do was to have no eye contact and don't wear revealing outfits.  The word no means maybe for them!  Bargain price for a haven of tranquility...spotlessly clean and lovely friendly staff....oh yes lovely breakfast too :)

Review_Title: Superb value in the middle of the action - and the best meal I've had in Morroco
Review_Text: The Riad is about as close to the main square Djemaa el Fna as possible and yet once inside you would never know it. It is literally one minute away and therefore in the heart of the Medina and moments away from the Souks but inside it is a peaceful tranquil environment.    I would describe this Riad as 'happy'. According to its owners it was (beautifully) restored over a period of three months less than 2 years ago after they bought it from a local family. The staff members are incredibly polite - full of smiles- and very happy to help. This is customer service unprecedented in Morocco and a far cry from the glum miserable service I experienced in the Riad Saba last year. A quick word on that Riad. The owners were so incompetent that when they replied to my review of their Riad they got me mixed up with another guest who had had a bad experience there! They started writing about me being refused breakfast because I had been late to the table. Actually I was well within time but was offered only bread. My friend - who looks Moroccan - went up an hour later and got the full works from the same miserable maid who had not been bothered to do anything for me! The owners of Saba should pay a visit to Andalla and find out how good manners and a happy staff will make for an excellent guest experience.    Back to the Andalla: the roof terrace is great for people watching and offers a fantastic view of the action especially at night. I was up there for an evening meal which was the best I have had in Morocco. It was four courses beautifully presented served with smiles and great pride by the staff. As a veggie I had tipped off the Riad in advance of my requirements and they provided me with the meal with no problem at all. It was delicious.    It is a small Riad - very narrow but not at all cramped. Their website accurately shows the size of the bedrooms - so what you see on their site is what you get. Mine was excellent - a very comfortable bed a good shower and a very beautiful wash bowl in the bathroom. It also benefitted from superb air conditioning an essential in Morocco.    The owners are highly professional and very friendly. They will use their local knowledge to help you and are very accommodating. They run a very good operation so it is little wonder that the place gets consistently high scores on Trip Advisor.    I would not only recommend this Riad to anyone on a budget - it is incredibly good value - but also to those who might be thinking about staying in a more expensive Riad or a hotel. Some of the rooms are not the biggest but you don't go to Morocco to stay in a room. Here you get a great atmosphere friendly and polite service help when you need it a superb view from the roof and delicious food.

During my stay in Marrakech I stayed at the Riad Andalla. From the beginning I could tell that I had chosen the right place. The rooftop terrace has superb view over the Jeema el Fna. Five star hospitality and food. The owners Andre and Christophe really looked after me in a friendly and charming way and gave sound and helpful advice. My room Kamar which as Abdou explained means 1000 moons was atmospheric beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Location could not have been better literally 1 minute from the square and souks and within walking distance to all the main sights. Abdou and other staff who prepared excellent meals were great. I still dream of the zucchini soup I had the first evening the grilled aubergines layered with cheese the various "tangines" the fruit salad as desert etc. all prepared in a wonderful manner and served with great care and a superb touch of real hospitality.

We stayed here for two nights at the end of our 10 days in Morocco. We had been staying in Essaouira on the coast which is quite chilled and very slow paced in comparison to the madness of Marrakech! Fortunately Riad Andalla is quiet and peaceful despite being minutes from the place djemaa el fna which is hustling and bustling at all times of day. Christophe and Andre are very welcoming with a lot of local knowledge. We ate a delicious dinner on the terrace on our first night with amazing views of the square. The staff are very friendly and were incredibly welcoming to our 15 month old daughter nothing was too much trouble.

Review_Title: Great location, friendly staff, would go again.
Review_Text: From the beginning we could tell we had chosen the right place very friendly welcome and an excellent meal waiting for us when we got there (book meal before you arrive). Our luggage was put in our room and we went straight onto the terrace to have our meal. It overlooked the main Jemaa el Fna square with all it's amazing activity as good a view as any you will find around the square. Location could not have been better literally 1 minute from the square and souks and within walking distance to all the main sights. Christophe and Andre the owners were very helpful and friendly and Abdul and other staff were great. We both felt relaxed secure and at ease. We would definately recommend Riad Andalla and if ever we go back to Marrakech this is where we will stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful time in Marrakech with thanks to Riad Andalla. We stayed for 4 nights and even before we arrived the service we received was very professional. We asked lots of questions via email and Christophe was always prompt in replying to us in English as we don't speak French. On the night of our arrival we booked the airport transfer and dinner which we highly recommend! The riad is located literally next to the main square but would still be hard to find if you didn't know where you were going. Dinner was excellent very good value and so much food! It made a great first night having dinner with the atmosphere and view of the square just below us. Our room was kept clean and tidy for us each day and the staff are most helpful. Abdul and the rest of the team are very friendly even if we had a language barrier but Abdul did his best to explain the local customs to us! Christophe and Andre were both very helpful. Christophe gave us many suggestions of places to visit and places to eat. He also organised a day trip for us out in the Ourika valley with a private driver and guide which was brilliant. All in all a most excellent riad and one we would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent Experience at Riad Andalla - Treated Like Old Friends
Review_Text: Had a wonderful experience at Riad Andalla back in April/May 2010. We arranged for pick-up from the airport (highly recommended and cheaper than a cab) and were transported directly to the Riad. Christophe and his staff are extremely welcoming and warm. They were always happy to offer us advice and we even arranged for our laundry to be done twice! The dinner at the Riad is also highly recommended for at least one night. Breakfast is varied and also excellent. Location is ridiculously perfect.

This was our first trip to Marrakech. It will not be our last. When we do come back we will be going back 'home' to Riad Andalla.  The pre arrival communication with Christophe was pleasant and very proffesional. Putting us at ease even before our arrival.  When we did arrive in Marrakech our transfer was waiting with a smile and a sign with our name and the name of the Riad. After changing some money we took the taxi to Andalla. Amazed by the hustle and bustle of the city we arrived at the door it was opened by the very smiley Abdu who welcomed us like old friends. The Riad is breathtaking an oasis of calm and beauty right in the middle of the busy medina. I heard my name being called from another floor in a swarthy french tone. Christophe! From start to finish he and Andre are the highlight of the property and it is an great property. He showed us up to the stunning terrace with postcard views over the Djeema el Fna. A mint tea and some homemade buiscuits and we were home.  Christophe took time to show us a map and reccomend a place to eat on the first night. He then went through all the best places to visit.  I cannot say enough about the people behind this Riad. Christophe and Andre are the best of hosts. Always a cheeky smile and time for a chat.  We booked a table on the terrace to have supper on the second night. What can I say Bravo Andre! Bravo! Fresh local food cooked with finesse and passion. A great treat.  I have been in the hotel business for 20 years now and am rarely blown away. This place and the people deserve great success.  Do not look any further book it now!  We will return 'home' soon. Inch Allah!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent Riad. Rooftop terrace has superb view over the Djemaa al Fnaa. Five star hospitality and food. The owners really looked after us in a friendly and charming way and gave sound and helpful advice  The room was atmospheric beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Would definitely use this Riad if we visit Marrakesh again.  The price is reasonable for accommodation of this quality. Best regards to Christophe and Andre from Mr. and Mrs. lemon drink.

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, Great location, Wonderful hosts......highly recommended.
Review_Text: What a great riad....we spent 4 nights at the Riad Andalla and we wouldn't hesitate to go back there. The rooms and communal areas were spotless - really really clean. The roof terrace was not only a good resting place but also provides one of the best roof terrace views of the Medina. The location was great about a minute's walk from the Medina the rooms were well decorated and very comfortable. My husband and I didn't just feel like we were staying with good hosts we actually felt like part of their family. Christophe the owner took amazing care of us even when my husband fell ill towards the end of the holiday he was caring and helpful. I really felt like I wasn't alone. We will miss Christophe and Riad Andalla. If we ever decide to return to Marrakech we will definitely return to Riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What else can I add to all the excellent reviews that this riad has had since its opening?  Staying in this riad was the best part of our holidays in Morocco: great location (you can walk everywhere) great view over the Place Jemaa El Fna and a peaceful environment which you need after the hustle and bustle of the Red City! And what shall I say about the food - I would recommend that you have dinner on the terrasse with the Place Jemaa El Fna as a background.  It was so different from the usual holidays when you stay anonymous in a hotel: this is more like staying at a friend's place. Christophe Andre and all the staff make you feel welcome by providing excellent service and advice.  I would definitely recommend this Riad!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The location is perfect and Christophe Andre and all their staff go out of their way to help you. Breakfast on the terrace is wonderful and the riad is spotlessly clean.  I would go back again to this Riad as it was great value for money and we felt instantly at home

Review_Title: Great location, terrific hospitality for first visit to Marrakech
Review_Text: Andre and Christophe did a terrific job in making our first visit to Marrakech so memorable. This is a comfortable Riad where you are made to feel at home. Support staff are extremely courteous and care also about the guests. Being so close to Place Jemaa El Fna was great. We could walk almost everywhere. In the evening we had the spectacular view of the Place from the rooftop. Andre's cooking is to be savoured. The meals we ate here were excellent. Our teenage children loved it. Overall excellent value.

The owner says this is not a hotel it is a home with guests – which we like.    Like any home it has its wonderful people which are the staff. So helpful and cheerful even though we did not have a common language.    Also like any home it can have its problems. The taxi we booked to collect us from the airport was not there. We waited and waited and waited. We rang the Riad but there was no reply. Eventually we decided we did not want to haggle for a taxi and so got on the bus and asked to be put off at the main square. When we got out we rang the Riad again as we did not have a clue how to get there from the square. They answered but no one spoke English and so we could not make them understand. We then found a German guide (we speak German) and asked him to explain in French to the Riad where we were. He did and they told us to wait there and they would come and get us. It turned out we were only 2 minutes away but it was not a route anyone would have found for the first time on their own. All quite stressful and we were glad to have arrived. On the up side it should have been 15 euro for the taxi but it only cost 5 euro for the bus and tip. I don’t really understand why the Riad does not recommend the bus as it was very fast and clean and all they have to do is then pop round the corner to collect the guests.    We were taken to the roof terrace – which is fantastic – and enjoyed some mint tea. We were then taken to the room. The room was very small with a curtained off area behind which was the shower and toilet. Unfortunately within 10 minutes of being in the room water started pouring through the ceiling. We ran downstairs and by pointing we managed to make them understand the problem. They came and mobbed it up. Within half an hour the same thing happened again. The room was beginning to smell and our things were getting wet. Water started pouring down again and the owner eventually arrived and said that a man was on his way to fix it. We went out and when we got back we went in search of the owner – the only person to speak English – to find out if it was safe to go to sleep. He was talking and talking to someone else and just took no notice of me standing there. Eventually I interrupted and he said in a most off hand way “of course”.    We then tried to go to bed and needed to turn the air conditioning on as it was hot and smelt bad from all the water. The controls did not work. We found him again and he gave us a different set of controls saying he jammed them as some people turned the air conditioning up and down all the time. This seemed very odd. But we had controls that worked and so forgot about it. The working controls vanished the next day and so we were left with air conditioning that just turned on (very noisy) or off.    We did not receive the welcome talk that others mentioned and it would have been helpful.    We were not complaining about all the issues on the first day but it felt like we were being avoided by the owner in case we did. After a few days he finally started to speak to us and he was very nice. I don’t think I would want to rely on him if there was a big problem.    The rooms are small and the toilets are close to the bed and just behind a curtain. The rooms do not have locks there is no safe or fire alarms or any of the normal things you might expect. There was not any water in the room for cleaning your teeth and you cannot use the tap water. We did not mind any of these things but I do think it would have been helpful to know them in advance.    We loved the staff and the roof terrace. Even when we checked out we did not get an apology from the only English speaking person for the taxi and water incidents it was as if they never happened. A simple acknowledgement and sorry would have gone a long way. I had not intended to post a review but I received an e-mail asking me to do so.

From being met at the airport then met in the square by Christophe the service started well.....................then progressed to excellent. Christophe and Andre welcomed us to the Riad with a personal introduction advising us what and what not to do in Marrakech.  The room and indeed the whole Riad was unique in its beauty and comfort very clean.  The views from the roof terrace over Jemaa El Fna (the square) and the Atlas Mountains in the distance are magnificent. Everything in Marrakech is accessible on foot from this Riad especially the Souks.  It was a special birthday while we were there Christophe arranged (unknown to us at the time) a surprise at Dar Essalam a very good restaurant.  The only downside was the weather which is out of everyone's control.  Fabulous Riad would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elizabeth W wrote a review Mar 2010
Review_Text: I booked this riad based on the tripadvisor reviews and it certainly lived up to everything we had been told. It is well worth having the pickup from the airport as finding this place in the dark would not have been easy! Christophe and Andre were lovely and nothing was too much trouble from booking our coach dinners and with lots of helpful tips our stay in Marrakech was trouble free. The location is superb and being able to sit on the terrace and watch the Place Djemaâ el Fna coming alive in the morning was fantastic. We were right in the heart of Marrakech but so quiet! The riad is tasteful and comfortable with great hospitality offered by all the staff.

Christophe & André were absolutely professional from my first encounter with them via email. I knew exactly whether or not they had space for me to stay the night and in fact it happened that they had space only one night of the four I asked for (probably because everyone also wants to stay here :) ) but everything was very clear. They even put together a contract for me which both parties signed and I felt secure about the entire reservation. Especially given the fact that I was going to Marrakech alone as a girl this reassured me. I felt I could count on Christophe (whom i had mainly been corresponding with) in terms of answering my questions prior to even arriving.    The Riad itself is wonderful! It's very well located and very close to la place Djema El-Fna! That said I would definitely book a taxi to get you there from the airport if it is your first time in Marrakech - only because it is not evident to find unless you receive some help. Once there however you feel like you are in a little Oasis. All staff is very friendly and the owners are as well - very willing to help with any questions you may have and to offer any help ! I definitely felt at home despite the fact that home is far away in San Francisco!    Last but not least the reason I had booked this Riad to begin with was because of the terrace overlooking Djema El-Fna - the pictures you see online which seem to be taken from the terrace are real. The view is definitely gorgeous both in the morning for a coffee with cute heart shaped cookies or in the evening. Definitely worth staying at the Riad for this only - you can enjoy the square with a bit of retreat from your own Riad!    I highly recommend this Riad!  Cheers travelers!

The landlords were absolutely lovely & helpful & v. knowledgeable about the city. They gave us tips about where to eat where to go booked us tables and transfers to and from the airport. The riad is situated minutes from the Place Djemaa El Fna(that you can see from the roof terrace) but in a very quiet back street.

the riad is located on the edge of the square with a fantastic roof terrace that overlooks all the action. The riad has been super stylishly renovated and the guys that run the place are super friendly with lots of suggestion on what and who to see! The food stall recommendation was a highlight!! Overall the stay was a very enjoyable one with a relaxed atmosphere and great food from the riad itself!!! Highly recommended! Chris (Australian in London)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked to stay at this Riad on Laterooms.com & received a confirmation via email. Then I received a confusing email from the riad saying "I refer to your request that day and I regret to inform you that I'm not busy at Riad Andalla according to your dates". After many more confusing emails and phone calls to both the Riad and Laterooms.com I could still not establish if I actually had a room at the Riad. On the day of check in I received an email from Christophe informing me that he had secured me a room in an annex. I arrived at the Riad still not certain that I had a room. Christophe opened the door and immediately was rude to me "oh it is you" no apology was given for the mix up. He then proceeded to mock me and mimic me repeating the last words that I had said in a silly French way. I could not believe his behaviour.  The accommodation he had secured was at the Riad Abad across the lane we were taken there and told we could use the services of both Riads.  Every time we interacted with Christophe he would mimicked me I asked him to stop but he would not. I found it so juvenile and unprofessional. Upon checking out it continued until I demanded that he stop and I got in a argument with him. I am confused as to why this man played this game with me.    The Riad Andalla looked beautiful. The rooftop terrace had an amazing view overlooking the medina. From all accounts here it is a great place to stay. For some reason Christophe either took a big like or dislike to me and played these childish school yard games.    I am glad that we ended up staying at Riad Abad across the lane.    GOOGLE TRANSLATION TO FRENCH  Google Translation AUX FRANÇAIS    J'ai réservé pour séjourner dans cet Riad Laterooms.com & reçu une confirmation par courriel. Puis j'ai reçu un email de la confusion en disant riad "Je me réfère à votre demande ce jour-là et j'ai le regret de vous informer que je ne suis pas occupé à Riad Andalla en fonction de vos dates». Après avoir beaucoup plus de courriels et d'appels téléphoniques à confusion à la fois au Riad et Laterooms.com je pouvais encore mettre en place pas si j'ai eu une chambre au Riad. Le jour de check-in j'ai reçu un courriel de Christophe m'informant qu'il avait à me procurer une chambre dans une annexe. Je suis arrivé au Riad toujours pas certain que j'avais une chambre. Christophe a ouvert la porte et immédiatement a été rude pour moi "oh c'est vous" aucune excuse n'a été donnée pour le mélanger. Il s'est ensuite rendu à se moquer de moi et moi imiter de répéter les dernières paroles que j'avais dit à la française stupide. Je ne pouvais pas croire que son comportement.  Le logement qu'il avait obtenu était à la Abad Riad travers de la voie nous avons été là-bas et dit que nous pouvions utiliser les services des deux Riads.  Chaque fois que nous avons interagi avec Christophe il me imité je lui ai demandé d'arrêter mais il ne voulait pas. Je l'ai trouvé si mineur et non professionnelle. Au départ il a continué jusqu'à ce que j'ai exigé qu'il cesse et j'ai obtenu dans une discussion avec lui. Je ne comprends pas pourquoi cet homme a joué à ce jeu avec moi.    Le Andalla Riad était belle. La terrasse sur le toit avait une vue incroyable vue sur la médina. De tous les comptes ici c'est un grand endroit pour rester. Pour certains Christophe a eu lieu non plus un gros aimez ou n'aimez pas à moi et joué à ces jeux enfantins chantier école.    Je suis heureux que nous avons fini par rester au Riad Abad dans la ruelle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We adored our two nights at the Riad Andalla. When booking our dealings with Christophe one of the owners were always friendly and positive but it wasn't until our arrival that we realised how welcoming he and all the riad's staff would be.    Firstly we would recommend the taxi transfer to the riad from the airport if it is your first visit. The riad is very close to the Place Jemaa el Fna but would still be difficult to find even for a seasoned traveller. Our driver Amin(?) was courteous and pleasant and helped us with our bags to the door giving us helpful directions to remember our way.    As soon as we stepped inside Christophe welcomed us heartily deciphered that we could speak a kind of Franglais and tailored his speech accordingly. The bags were left downstairs and we were shown upstairs to the beautiful terrace which is in prime position overlooking the main square.    The terrace is certainly the riad's most exceptional feature. From this vantage point you can see snow-capped Atlas mountains palm trees lots of other rooftop terraces cafes and restaurants and Moroccans going about their daily business. At night the Koutobia is lit up like a beacon in front of you and you become privy to the sights sounds and smells of the many food stalls and the entertainment on the square.    We were welcomed with coffee and some handmade sweets which were to become favourites whilst in Marrakech. Abdul the riad's right-hand man served us and was so friendly we felt at home immediately. Christophe then bounded up to present us with a map and help us get our bearings. He pointed out major sights and attractions gave us tips on what to see in our time there and also gave some excellent eating recommendations. These were: of the night-time food stalls No.1 (Chez Aicha) is excellent and cheap and the terrace restaurant at Chegrouni on the main square is also very highly recommended. We took his advice and were extremely glad we did returning twice to Chez Aicha.    Our room Lamira (meaning 'The Princess' Abdul told us with a wry smile) was small but very clean and comfortable. It had air conditioning/ heating which was useful at night (we found that leaving this on also helped to drown out the dawn call to prayer which could be heard each morning around 5am).    Breakfast was excellent with fresh bread jams and great coffee. The best part was the Moroccan crêpes or pancakes made fresh and served to us warm. And the views? To die for.    One last thing that was very appreciated was that when the Mister needed a shave and realised he'd forgotten his razor one word in passing to Christophe was all it took to have him escorting us down the road to his local barber. The wet shave there was close and quick and the barber on Christophe's recommendation only accepted what we wanted to give him as payment. That was an extra touch that no other hotel or riad we've encountered would have supplied.    We could see why Christophe quit one of the world's most beautiful cities (Paris) to live here and why his associate André joined him from Corsica. They have a good thing here - it was a pleasure to be part of it for a couple of days and we wished we'd stayed longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Andalla was a great choice for us. We are experienced travelers from the US visiting Morocco for the first time. We arrived tired from a hard week of business in Europe. The Riad Andalla was our first stop in Morocco and the last place before we returned home. Between we spent about 10 days circumnavigating the country in a rented car. Riad Andalla is a lovely place; comfortable quiet fine and well arranged. We made a mistake in not eating in the hotel when we arrived. We only realized the magnitude of this error on our last night when we took our farewell meal in the hotel - fine food and accommodation. Christophe provided great service too. Our inbound flight was delayed by a mechanical problem so we arrived 24 hours late and without baggage. Christophe helped us sort things and adjusted to the situation as it unfolded. We were met as promised and carried to the hotel. Christophe and Andrè were steady sources of insight and fun. His staff Abdou Jemil Houria and Samira were attentive helpful and helped us find our way.

Review_Title: great plce to stay in marrakech
Review_Text: if your going to marrakech this place is really friendly and staff cannot do enough for you.  we only ate at riad for the first night though the food was lovely.  the riad is really close to the square and in walking distance of all sights.  if we were to back to marrakech the we would deffinately stay at the riad again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My mum and I stayed at Riad Andalla 22nd - 26th January 2010 and had a really lovely stay. Christophe and Andre make for great hosts and Abdul was always very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The Riad is very peaceful considering its close proximity to the Djamaa El Fna. I will definitely recommend friends & family to stay here.

Stayed here in Jan had a great time: excellent rooms excellent food quiet even though it is near to the Jemaa el Fna friendly staff and owners great views from the roof terrace of Jemaal el Fna and the snow topped mountains.

My boyfriend and I had an amazing weekend at the Riad Andalla. The owners Christophe and André made us feel welcome as if we were their personal guests. They were also so helpful and full of advice about Marrakech. The riad is very well located only 2 minutes from Jamâa El Fna in a labyrinth of little streets of the medina. It's charming and accessible and once you're there you can't hear the buzzling noise from the market. The rooms are on the smaller side but they are beautifully decorated and very very clean. The terrasse is the most amazing feature with an amazing view on the market place as well as the Koutoubia and the snowy mountains of the Atlas. What a treat to delect in their breakfast while watching the landscape! Abdul's mint tea is the best I've ever had and the fresh squeezed orange juice and homemade jams in the morning were a delight. I recommend this riad to anyone traveling to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This little Riad provides affordable accomodation just steps away from the Place Jamaa El Fna (where all the action happens) while still maintaining a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Owner Christophe a French expat who seems to have embraced the Moroccan way of life makes you feel at home in this 7-room recently renovated guest house. We enjoyed the beautiful terrace overlooking Jamma El Fna over breakfast - a priceless exprerience. Rooms may be on the small side but they feel intimate and the common areas always bustle with guests and the chatty owner. Overall a very warm place that we highly recommend to anyone visiting Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for four nights at Riad Andalla and it was a great place. It is only two minutes away from the Place Jmaa on foot. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is really nice. The staff is very kind and helpful. Great place to stay.Juan Carlos from Spain.

Lovely riad with beautiful view of the Jemaa el Fna from its terrace & just minutes away from the bustling souk & Jemaa el Fna. Special thanks to the riad owner Christophe who walked us from the square right into his Riad carrying my luggage recommended good food take his time to introduce a little bit about Marrakech & always greeting his guests on the terrace for breakfast in the morning together with Andre. Also Abdou who is always approachable & polite! Thank you for making our honeymoon stay there feel very welcomed in November '09! This riad is highly recommended for excellent service location charming interior(we stayed in the romantic Bachahamou room) and very reasonable room rates!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a fantastic time at the Andalla not only was the location fantastic for exploring the souks and Medina but the hospitality was second to none.    The accomodations were great clean comfortable and ideal for a short stay.    The hustle and bustle of the old town can be quite overwhelming so it was great to stay somewhere tranquil in the middle of it all.    Anyone thinking of Marrakech should check out the Andalla.    Simon & G x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carol King wrote a review Dec 2009
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed here for 2 night’s early December 2009 a lovely relaxing haven away from the busy Jemaa el Fna with a warm and friendly atmosphere from the moment you walked in the door.  The staff are lovely; Christophe and Andre are great hosts  You couldn’t ask for a better location the views from the roof terrace are amazing! We had are breakfast here and an evening meal on the first night-that I would highly recommend delicious!  The room was small but very nice clean and beautifully decorated as was the whole riad  Overall Great – location riad food hosts and staff plus value for money!!

Marrakech can be quite a challenge. What you need is a kind of safe haven in the middle of the chaos. We staid at Riad Andalla for three nights in November 2009. The Riad is in a typical design of Morocco everything clean and very tasteful. Our room was small but very nice. From the roofterrace you have a superb view over the Jeema El Fna and the Koutoubia Mosk.  The hosts Christophe and André as well as the faktotum Abdullah made our stay perfect. They also helped us to organize the rest of our trip to the south of Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at riad andalla for 3 nights in November. Its a fantastic place in a great location. Christophe and Andre are great hosts. Christophe met us at the edge of the square where the taxi from the airport dropped us off and he helped us with our luggage. On arriving at the riad Andre welcomed us with a cold drink . We had a lovely bedroom. The breakfast and evening dinner on the terrace was great. All in all it was a great experience so thanks Christoph Andre Abdul and all the rest of the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful house, amazing location and the warmest of welcomes
Review_Text: Located in the heart of the old Marrakesh medina overlooking the famous square. Cosy rooms artistically decorated plus characterful sitting areas and a roof-top terrace with amazing views. We were treated like guests in a home (with fantastic French/Moroccan food) rather than a hotel. Philipe welcomed us like old friends with freshly brewed mint tea free maps and advice on how to make the most of our short very memorable stay. Superb value for money. Can't fault it. Just go!

Review_Title: All you need is Riad Andalla:-)
Review_Text: There are several things that make Riad Andalla outstanding:  1. Beautiful hosts and staff. On our very first night we arrived late to the Riad. As soon as we entered we were lead to the terrace where the Owners (Christophe and Andre) and some other guests were chilling with a drink. They welcomed us and made us feel home straight away. From the following morning we had the impression as if we were in a house of a friend. All the staff were kind friendly and very helpful. The breakfast on the terrace was also great.  2. Perfect location/perfect view. It is located just next door to the Jemma el Fna with a terrace overlooking to the market. Even though it can be enjoyable getting lost in the Medina you probably do not always want to wonder around for hours to find your hotel. Riad Andalla has a very easy access.  3.Nice decoration/clean rooms/comfortable bed.  4. Competitive price.  If we go to Marrakesh next year we will stay in Riad Andalla again!  Kati+Alex
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent there three nights and we had been warmly and friendly welcomed. The Riad has a splendid location is very clean with a magical atmosphere. Rooms are very nice but not so big however comfortable.  The real plus of this Riad are:  a) a terrace with an amazing view on the Jemaa El Fna Place probably one of the best in Marrakech where a delicious breakfast is served. Dinner on demand (very good too!)  b) Cristophe and André the owners that really open the Riad as a friend house for their guests and always available to advice you on what to do and to see. Also the rest of the staff (how to forget Abdul!) is very kind and helpful.  For sure a place to recommend to our friends and where to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Riad - ideally located, warm and genuine hospitality
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 days in November 2009 on our first trip to Marrakech. We were very happy with everything. The riad is just off the main square so ideal for the souks the food stalls or just exploring. The riad itself is spotless and beautifully restored. The roof terrace with wonderful views over Jemaa El Fna is a great place to chill with a pot of tea. The owners and staff are welcoming and very friendly. The price we paid was very reasonable. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Riad Andalla to anyone planning a trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: perfect stay in wonderful city Marrakech, Morocco
Review_Text: Perfect stay very close to the great place Djemmaa el Fna and the Souk! Very nice service wonderful terrasse with view on the place!

Review_Date: Caroline F wrote a review Nov 2009
Review_Title: Like staying with your best friend
Review_Text: Beautiful house with great hosts. Nothing is too much trouble. 2 mins walk from Jama El Fna    The hotel was full when we booked but arranged for a room for us in another riad opposite - Riad Abad. This Riad was not a good experience - the staff treated us as if we were an inconvenience and tried to move us to stay in a room off the dining room that had no privacy and had wet plaster on the walls. The breakfast was inedible and the coffee horrible and bitter.  Christophe welcomed us into Riad Andalla in the afternoons though and my sister had a fabulous massage - the best she has ever had she said.

We cannot praise the hospitality of Andre & Christophe enough.  As soon as we arrived at the Riad we were made to feel that their beautiful home was ours to share.  It was obvious that they had employed their staff very carefully as all the staff were very obliging & friendly providing genuine & efficient service at all times.  As previously mentioned the rooms are cosy. We had the suite on the top floor with a view of the Koutoubia which was very comfortable & I would recommend.  The Riad was spotlessly clean & the breakfast was a good start to the day(especially as it was served on the roof terrace overlooking the Djemna el fna square).The location was fantastic (literally 2 mins from the square) you really couldn't wish for better.  The object of our trip was mainly shopping & relaxation & this riad provided the perfect base for both with the souks on our doorstep(we could even pop back to use our own toilet & drop our shopping off) & back out again for more shopping.  Two of our party had 1hr massages at the riad for 30 euros each and they were both really pleased with them.  We enjoyed a lovely meal at the Riad on our first night which was up on the roof terrace with that fabulous view we see on all the postcards. The sounds & smells of the square all added to the ambience even the call of the muezzin at 5.30 in the morning didn't make me grumpy.  To sum up we all loved every minute of our time at the Riad & Thank all the staff for their hard work which was always carried out with a smile. A special thankyou must go to Abdul who tended our every need (even accompanying me to a cabinet maker to arrange for an armoire to be made for me) And on the same note A Big thankyou to Christophe who accompanied me to the shipping agent to arrange transportation back to the UK. Christophe speaks great English & obviously his native French so made a very useful interpreter. Although Andre's English was not so good we still managed to communicate & could feel his genuine warmth.  We have been to Marrakech 4 times now & this experience was by far the best. We came back yesterday & I am already looking for flights for Feb 2010.  The Riad was as a previous reviewer said "PERFECT FOR US".  What we wanted from the riad was:-  LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!  THE VIEW  Comfort Cleanliness & good food & friendly service  What did we get?  ALL OF THE ABOVE & NEW FRIENDS IN MARRAKECH.  We will definately return to Marrakech & Riad-Andalla.  Merci.

Review_Date: Lucja L wrote a review Nov 2009
Review_Title: Rock the Kasbah in this magical spot
Review_Text: What a brilliant location overlooking the Djamaa El Fna so close you can touch it!  On arrival Christophe met us from our taxi from the airport and took us to the Riad which we would highly recommend arranging as trying to find the Riad without Christophe for the first time would be a nightmare! Christophe's english is great which made it easier for us but next time we stay definitely French for us (lessons are booked!)  Lovely mint tea and little sweet treats on arrival are a nice touch on the terrace. The service from Christophe and indeed everyone at the Riad was first class. A scrummy breakfast served on the terrace each morning watching Marrakech wake up is a wonderful way to start the day. The rooms are clean and tidy comfortable bed with plenty of hot water for showers. The air con was a blessing during the night as we found we had to keep the door and window closed as the noise outside from the sqare and various people making their way around the alleys around the Riad was just too much otherwise. Some other reviews have mentioned being awoken from the sounds of the mosque in the early hours and indeed you do hear this but this is all part of the charm of being in Morrocoo and found it quite a soothing and relaxing sound not a disturbance at all. The Terrace is amazing to chill out at sunset and watch the square really come to life with all the sounds and smells before heading out yourself to get into the thick of it all.  In the medina itself alcohol is not available openly at a lot of places. We found 2 spots close by Kosy Bar which is in the old Jewish quarter and is a funky superbly laid out bar (service is pretty rude but with the great views and a chilled beer/wine you can get past that!) bit pricey in comparison to other food and drink in Marrakech but not expensive by UK standards at £15 for a bottle of the cheapest wine and about £4 for a beer. For a cheaper alternative (but lacking in the decor comforts and atmosphere) is Grand Hotel Tazi which is literally around the corner from the Riad. Handy spot for that cold beer to quench your thirst without the frills! Just under £3 for a beer and wine was about £7 for 2 glasses (in a mni bottle). They also have a terrace upstairs bit run down but a bit nicer than the bar area because you are outside and can soak up the action.  Tried out a hammam close by which was absolutely immaculate friendly staff very clean and safe gorgeous facility and the massage at the end was amazing. Didi Spa is on Rue Prince my Rachid one of the streets coming off the square. I paid 250 dirhams (about £20) for a hammam and 1hr long massage and was worth every penny!  For a great Tagine and eating traditionally for lunch time try Chez Bahia on Riad Zitoune El Kdim which is another street leading off the square. The tagine pots are cooking away on display out the front so you can't miss it. Great food and service (you can try the Pastilla here as well). No awards for plush design but it is clean and tidy and well worth the visit (Cheap as chips too 100 dirhams for the 2 of us for lunch so just under £10.  Will definitely return to RIad Andalla next time we are in Marrakech! A little hidden gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer R wrote a review Nov 2009
Review_Text: This was the third and best riad we stayed at in Morocco. As everyone has noted the location was perfect. Christophe and team were very gracious and caring hosts. The rooms were clean beds comfortable showers good and hot with good drainage. The rooftop terrace was comfortable and had a stunning view of the Djeema el Fna. Decor throughout was lovely and obviously placed with thought and care. My favorite aspect of the riad was that it was very cozy and full of life. The guests and staff mingled and had conversations throughout the riad so we never felt lonely or isolated. When we came in the door after being out we felt like we were welcomed home each time. I recommend Riad Andalla to anyone visiting Marrakech.

This riad was booked on the basis of all of these high reccomendations from Trip advisor. The riad has an ideal location the decor is lovely and you really can see the attention the detail. Christophe and Andre are welcoming from the start even though we arrived at midnight they still offered us drinks and a welcoming smile.    The staff Abdou Samira Houria and Fatima all go out of their way to make you feel at home even when we had a little tummy trouble from some pastilla outside they were all concerned and helped as much as they could.    The people the place the services the breakfast (Yum!) all wonderful. Book this with no hesitation!

Review_Date: Maria O wrote a review Oct 2009
Review_Title: Fabulous Riad in amazing location. Perfect stay post Toubkal trek
Review_Text: Wow. This place is a gem of a find. I have been to Marrakech before but this place has it all - location quality friendly helpful owners and lovely rooms.    I was searching for a Riad in the Medina to be the perfect spot for some post Mount Toubkal trekking for myself and 8 friends in our 30s and 40s. We definitely found it in this place. The terrace is amazing it has a view onto the main square in Marrakech.    The owners Christophe and Andrew were so friendly and helpful and made our stay really special. Luckily their english was much better than my french but it was fun trying!    I'm sure I won't be the only one of my friends to go back.

Riad Andalla has the advantage of an absolutely amazing location right on the lip of the medina in an easy to find area. In a city where every turn leads to you becoming lost Riad Andalla's location is solid gold.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights in this wonderful Ryad. The location is really excellent. While you sit on the roof terrace you have an amazing view over Jamaa El Fna. I do not think there is a ryad so close to the square with this view.The ryad opened recently and is beautifully renovated and decorated and has great atmosfere. Also the rooms are nicely decorated and every room has a different theme. The rooms are not very large but well enough to stay. Christophe the owner is great. He really creates a good atmosfere and takes good care of his guests. We miss having a drink with him and the other guests. We ate 2 times in the ryad and it was wonderful as well. I highly recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A perfect retreat in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: It is very rare that we write a review of our hotel and believe me we have stayed in many places all over the globe!  Yes we have rated this gorgeous Riad as 'Perfect' and the word perfect can be often over used but in this example it deserves this title. Yet it is important to remember that it was perfect for us and perfect for the purpose of our visit to the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.    Location - You cannot find a better location for a weeks visit to Marrakech. Naturally you visit such a place for it's atmosphere and scattering of intersting locations and markets and this cannot fit the bill any better. It has simply stunning views for it's roof top lounge/dining area and although a 2min walk when you first arrive you soon realise after a couple of days that you are very lucky.    Hotel/Rooms - Beautiful decor a calm amongst the storm of Marrakech. It is clear that the owners have invested time and effort into the presentation of this Riad. Our rooms were attended to daily with fresh towels and a quick tidy. We opted for a standard room as the small saving would allow us to spend more in Marrakech and more often than not we would be out and about. If you prefer a bit more leg room and space to manuvre then i would recommend the small upgrade in price. VERY clean and wonderful staff.    Hosts - Well what can we say about the delightful Christophe & Andre the French owners of the Riad. Christophe speaks excellent English and helped us settle well and was very welcoming during our time Andre speaks little English but this does not stop him from being a charming presence. Christophe often went out of his way to help us in our pursuit of gifts and advice! A special mention must go to Abdul a true Morrocan gentleman who works at the hotel a great character!    When we do return to Morroco we will certainly check into this welcoming Riad this time with a better grasp on the French language!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are a couple who recently had the best stay in Riad Andalla and felt like we had to write an excellent review of the place. Location is perfect the heart of the city by the main square but also the riad is an oasis of calm where a good night's sleep is always had. French owners Christophe and Andre were simply the best. They were helpful in every way -- organising a trip to the Atlas mountains transfer to and from the airport and even a massage! The decor inside the riad is also superb with attention given to the smallest detail.    Enjoying a wonderful breakfast on the terrace was great but the evening meal overlooking the main square was something to remember for a long long time. So beautiful and romantic! Final point the local staff were superb. Special mention to Abdul who catered for our every need and was simply the nicest and friendliest chap you are ever likely to meet. When we return to Marrakech (which we will!!) this riad will be our first and only choice. Go today!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Andalla is excellent! It is in a great location less than 2 minutes walk from the main Place Djemaa el Fna ('La Place') souks and Koutoubia Mosque.    Superbly run by incredibly welcoming French owners Christophe and Andre with help from local staff this is the perfect place for those wishing to have an authentic riad experience in Marrakech.    The public areas are 'classic riad' - traditional tastefully decorated cosy and full of character! The rooms are clean bright and comfortable with air conditioning comfortable beds and a great shower!    The terrace is amazing with chic sofas for chilling out and shaded tables for breakfast dinner or writing postcards whilst overlooking the 'La Place' and the Grand Atlas Mountains. Perfect for relaxing and taking in the snake charmers calls to prayer and whatever else goes on in this great city!    I have no hesitation in recommending this riad and wouldn't wish to stay anywhere else in Marrakech.

The Riad has been beautifully renovated by the owners Christophe and Andre and offers charming and comfortable accommodation in a traditional setting. The tranquil roof terrace gives stunning views over the main square the Djemaa el Fna which is no more than a 2 minute walk away. The location in the centre of the Medina means the souks and sights are all within easy walking distance.    Christophe and André are very friendly and go out of their way to make you welcome whatever time you arrive or leave! We had a very short stay and they patiently helped us plan an itinerary which made the most of our limited time in Marrakech. Christophe speaks English but equally André is brilliant at adapting his French to suit the ability of the guest and so is easy to understand even with a fairly rudimentary grasp of French.    The staff at the Riad are also very friendly and helpful. As other reviews recommend eat dinner there at least once the cook is very talented and innovative and will take account of any particular food likes or dislikes you may have. The quality of the cooking is outstanding – it’s not good home cooking it is high quality restaurant standard. The Riad has a massage room and they can arrange for an excellent visiting masseur/se it’s a good way to relax after a hard day’s tourism!    We would recommend taking up their offer to arrange a taxi to meet you from the airport and take you to the Riad as although it is very central the Medina is such a maze when you first arrive it is difficult to get your bearings; if you are arriving at night we would say this is essential.    As some others have said the rooms are not very big but it’s a riad and anyway how much room do you need to sleep? The rooms are en-suite beautifully & thoughtfully decorated and you have the use of the whole house including the “lounge” on the ground floor and the fabulous terrace. It was also spotlessly clean.    We were getting a bit fed up with tourism but Christophe & André have changed that. Riad Andalla is all about treating you as a guest and enabling you to make the most of your stay it’s superb and we’d happily go back tomorrow!

great service the owner and the staff are always friendly and give you all informations you need. The rooms are very well keept clean and charming. The terrace on the roof is amazing you can see all the main square of marrakesh and fell forget sensations. a great place to stay.

Aug 2009 is the month I should have stayed in Riad Andalla. Due to tourist visa issues my party was unable to make it into the country of Morocco. But Christophe was amazingly responsive and communicative. If we had stayed at Riad Andalla Christophe would surely have been a wonderful host. We look forward to the day we can travel to Morocco to stay here pending a trouble-free tourist visa application process next time. Riad Andalla looks like the best riad b/c of its location & photos of rooms taken by other guests.

What can I say...the location the interior design and the services were great. Christophe and Andre as well as the staff did a wonderful job in making us feel welcome always in a very good mood and interested in helping us out concerning restaurants/things to do and so on (despite our somewhat broken French). The breakfast was delicious and the rooms were cozy and clean. And the roof terrace right behind the Cafe de France...what a treat! We spent hours just on the terrace looking over the Jemma el Fna - a view that you can otherwise just get from the restaurants around the market place.  After weeks of looking for a Riad in Marrakech we could never really decide on one because there was always something missing. Either we did not like the location or the way it looked or the price. But one day Riad Andalla popped up and we immediately knew that this was simply perfect. And that it was!

Really nice riad with reall nice people!They know how to make customers at home. Next to the famous place Jemâa el-Fna with a beutiful terrase where you can contemplate Marrakech. Everything was perfect!

You can go there with your eyes closed !  As soon as you get in André and Christophe make you feel like home !  The terrasse offers a stunning view of "Place Jema El Fna".  The cook Raja is amazing Abdu can tell you a lot of stories he knows everything ! And Samira is always laughing and it's infectious !  We've also been to the Hamman and got a massage by Amada and his wife Leila.... no words to describe when it's finished you only want one thing : Please continue.....  Well go there and you will come back again !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best Riad in the Medina
Review_Text: First the owner Chriqtophe offers you to book a taxi for you at the airport. Then he will welcome you at the entrance of the medina as the taxi are not allowed to get in. He will personnaly accompany you until the Riad which is ideally located very close to the place Djema El Fna with an extraordinary view from the terasse on the roof on the place and on the Atlas montains. The Riad is new very well decorated very charming and you are considered more as a friend than a customer. The service is perfect the staff adorable the rooms very charming and comfortable with the air conditioning. the breakfirst on the romantic terasse overhanging all the median is one of the best moment I had.

We spent 5 days at Riad Andalla and surely enjoyed our stay. The Riad is quiet nice and clean with a very nice atmosphere created by Christophe and Andre who gives you just the right amount of attention (not too little - not too much). The location is perfect - very close to Jema el Fna but on the other hand you still have the quietness inside the riad.  We had a very delicious meal prepared by the very good chef - Maroccan cuisine.  You won't regret a stay at riad Andalla.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I came expecting nothing and left getting it all
Review_Text: I've been to many places that I've liked in my life but never felt the need of writing a positive review of it and now here I am.  This riad is amazing for many reasons:  1- it is located in THE place to be in the Medina especially if it's your first time to Marrakech (but it's no wonder that people keep coming back to it).  2- the rooms are comfortable and decorated with great local style (like the rest of the house)... and the Riad has a beautiful terrace.  3- Last but not least the staff really take it seriously when it comes to making you feel at home. Christophe et André have the declared policy that their Riad is a guest house therefore you are a guest and not just a customer (as a matter of fact they live there).  Do not hesitate just go there and see it with your own eyes.

We stayed ay Riad Andalla for 4 nights. You can't find better hosts than Christophe and Andre! Our flight came in 4 hours late and Christophe recommended that we be picked-up by private taxi since it was our first trip to Marrakech. It was almost midnite when we arrived at the medina Jemaa El Fna and because the medina was closed to traffic after 5pm the taxi driver took us on foot across the square and through the maze of narrow alleys to the front door of Riad Andalla and Andre was there to meet us! Although it was a tad scary at every turn into dimly lit alleys leading to the Riad Andre's warm welcome erased all fears while Abdou the night guard promptly made mint tea to settle our anxieties. It was like showing up at a friend's house - we chatted for a while we in broken French and Andre in broken English but we understood each other perfectly. He finally showed us to our room which had 2 single beds a shower toilet and air-conditioning. By normal hotel standards it was a small room but this is a riad - the charm and ambience of the Moroccan house outweighed the closed quarters. It was adequate. Breakfast awaits us on the rooftop patio with freshly squeezed orange juice coffee bread hot crepes and preserves.    Christophe and Andre are a wealth of information on Marrakech. All you have to do is to ask! I had the privilege to tag along with Christophe and Andre to their weekly hammam (bathhouse) - an abrasive yet soothing treat for the newly initiated as well as the seasoned spa enthusiasts. Make sure your stay includes a weekend and you will also enjoy an excellent reasonably priced hour-long massage by a Moroccan couple who are good friends of Christophe and Andre.    But what made me want to write this review is what Christophe and Andre did to make our stay in Morocco so welcoming and memorable! We had planned to be in Essaouira on the coast for 2 nights and was hoping to come back to Riad Andalla for a night before our flight leaving for Paris the next day. Christophe and Andre were going to Corsica on vacation and had actually planned to close the riad for the entire week after we left for Essaouira. Having learned of our intended plans they suggested that we come back to Riad Andalla even though they will be gone and made arrangements for Abdou to open the door for us when we arrive back from Essaouira and be picked up by private taxi the following morning to the airport. We had the whole riad to ourselves and requested only coffee and juice for breakfast which Abdou promptly prepared. What an end to a wonderful stay in Marrakech and Riad Andalla made it so much more enjoyable! We would stay at Riad Andalla again when we visit Marrakech in the future - Christophe and Andre are like our friends and Riad Andalla is indeed the Jewel of Marrakech!    And one more thing we did not get to try at Riad Andalla. While we were there we keep hearing about Raja's excellent cooking but we didn't have enough nights there to try! I am sure we will when we find ourselves at the Andalla again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This riad is definitely a hidden treasure inside Marrakech's medina ; the two hosts Andre and Christophe are so friendly you instantly feel at home and the quality of both the rooms and the dinner (Raja is an amazing cook!) have nothing to envy to the best hotels in town...  Christophe and Andre know so many tips (what to visit where to eat even where to shave !) that made our stay unique and unforgettable.  I strongly recommend this riad to whoever wants to live a wonderful marrakchi experience !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This rias is situated on a very central location. In the city imagine you're on the roof terrace in an oasis with the sound of the city at the background. The owners provide a warm welcome and the staff is super friendly and hospitable.  We recommend this lovely riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have spent six nights at Riad Andalla on our 3rd trip to Marrakech and this so far was the best experience for two guys with a BIG interest in photography: the riad is located very close to the Jemaa elFna which means you can see the square from the terrace and you can also see the Atlas Mountains on the other side! Perfect!    The rooms are clean traditional and very cozy (althoug a bit small like in all riads) and the staff quite nice and helpful. The two guys running the place Cristophe and Andre are friendly and optimistic always taking care of us and helping me with my French (spoken not written unfortunately!). Andre even stayed up until 3 in the morning to wait for us at the riad after our bus back from Zagora changed schedule welcoming us with our room thank you again!    All in all out of the four riads I've been to in the last two and a half years Andalla was the best and really gives me no reason to search for different accomodations next time around.
